</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	purchase price set out in the table above consisted of the following components: (a)&nbsp;cash delivered on closing; (b)&nbsp;2,000,978 of our common shares delivered on closing
	with a fair value of $5.3&nbsp;million which reflects that Nokia was subject to a lock-up provision restricting sale or disposition of the shares, subject to customary exceptions; (c)&nbsp;other
	consideration deferred for specific tangible assets; and (d)&nbsp;a contingent receivable which was based on business performance in the twelve months following closing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	NSN Transaction was financed through a combination of cash on our balance sheet and increased debt facilities provided by Comerica Bank and Export Development Canada.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	recognized a one-time gain on purchase of business of $19.4&nbsp;million in the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2013 due to the difference between the cumulative tangible and
	intangible net assets and the purchase&nbsp;price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	part of the NSN Transaction, we acquired Nokia's Chinese operations associated with its microwave transport business. The acquisition was completed on December&nbsp;1, 2012 and at
	that time approximately 100&nbsp;employees based in Shanghai transferred to&nbsp;DragonWave.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	microwave transport assets of Nokia in Italy, including Nokia employees based in Italy, were excluded from the acquisition. On closing, we entered into a services agreement with
	Nokia for outsourced R&amp;D, product management, sales support and operations functions. This was aimed at enhancing our ability to continue to deliver on critical customer deliveries.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	24
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=26,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=437594,FOLIO='24',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DI49901A.;6',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:28' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DI49901_1_25">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	described above, the Amended and Restated Master Acquisition Agreement entered into on May&nbsp;3, 2012 included an arrangement with Nokia for additional consideration that was
	contingent on actual sales of products achieved in the first eighteen months subsequent to the acquisition date. The initial $10.6&nbsp;million value of the contingent receivable was increased
	during the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2013 based on a change in fair value offset by payments received and foreign exchange. The contingent receivable balance carried on the balance sheet as at
	February&nbsp;28, 2013 was $13.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;10, 2013, we announced changes to our operational framework with Nokia (the&nbsp;"Renewed Framework"). Under the terms of the Renewed Framework, on April&nbsp;12,
	2013, Nokia paid $13.8&nbsp;million to us which settled the balance of our contingent receivable. Nokia took on additional commitments and costs so that we could continue to develop and supply the
	microwave product line we acquired from Nokia. The services agreement, pursuant to which Nokia provided research&nbsp;&amp; development and certain other services to us since June&nbsp;1, 2012, was
	terminated. As a result, we reduced accounts payable by $13.3&nbsp;million. We also eliminated capital assets with a net book value of $0.6&nbsp;million and the corresponding capital lease
	obligation associated with the Italian operations in the amount of $1.3&nbsp;million. During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, we also reduced a capital lease obligation associated with our
	operations in India by $0.4&nbsp;million based on a revised agreement with&nbsp;Nokia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also recorded a liability for a termination fee which is currently valued at $3.5&nbsp;million. We paid a portion of the liability over the course of fiscal year 2015 and expect to
	the pay the balance during fiscal&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;When
	the NSN Transaction was completed, many aspects of our business were substantially changed, including our revenue profile, product offering, mix of geographic markets, distribution
	channels, contract manufacturing arrangements, R&amp;D activities and employee&nbsp;base.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Over
	time, our relationship with Nokia has become one based on the value that each party brings to the other across diverse domains including technology collaboration, product management
	and customer services and support. Either party may use alternative partners or products. Nokia has recently announced the formation of a microwave ecosystem administered through its Partner Business
	Unit (PBU). The PBU was established to facilitate Nokia's delivery of partner products and services alongside the Nokia portfolio. We are a member of PBU's microwave ecosystem, together with other
	microwave vendors. In April&nbsp;2015, Nokia announced its proposed combination with Alcatel-Lucent (ALU), which has a vertically integrated microwave business unit. The combination is subject to
	regulatory approvals and other conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	Nokia has reaffirmed its commitment to partnering, both the introduction of the multi-vendor microwave ecosystem and the proposed Alcatel-Lucent combination increases uncertainty
	for the future of this channel. In recognition of this, we are seeking Nokia's agreement to make changes to our existing contractual framework to support our cash flows and rationalize future legacy
	support obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Acquisition and Disposition of Axerra Networks,&nbsp;Inc.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On October&nbsp;14, 2010, we announced the acquisition of Axerra Networks,&nbsp;Inc. ("Axerra"). Axerra was well known in the
	mobile network industry as a leader in pseudowire technology and had a product portfolio that allowed carriers to address the increasing need to carry legacy TDM traffic over a packet
	based&nbsp;network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DragonWave
	acquired Axerra (the&nbsp;"Axerra Acquisition") in an all cash transaction valued at $9.5&nbsp;million. The earn-out phase of the Axerra Acquisition was completed on
	February&nbsp;13, 2012 and, based on sales performance since the completion of the Axerra Acquisition, the earn-out amount was $1.9&nbsp;million, raising the value of the transaction to
	$11.4&nbsp;million. At DragonWave's option, a portion of the earn-out was paid in cash, in the amount of $0.1&nbsp;million with the balance of the earn-out being paid in 400,983&nbsp;common
	shares of DragonWave, valued at $4.49 per common share based on a 20&nbsp;day volume weighted average&nbsp;price.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Axerra
	was the recipient of certain grants under Israel's Encouragement of Research and Development Law, 1984 (the&nbsp;"R&amp;D Law"). The R&amp;D Law requires that products supported by a
	grant must be manufactured in Israel in accordance with the percentage of manufacturing declared in the grant application. The grants are repayable in full based on a pre-determined royalty scheme.
	Royalties may be increased if manufacturing is transferred out of Israel. In certain other circumstances, such as the transfer of Axerra's know-how outside of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	25
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=27,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=215697,FOLIO='25',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DI49901A.;6',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:28' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DI49901_1_26">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Israel,
	repayment of the grant may be required and royalties may be increased. Restrictions on overseas transfer of manufacturing continue to apply despite full payment of the grant. Axerra was
	renamed DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. following the Axerra Acquisition.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Over
	the course of the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2013, the revenue levels generated by the product portfolio of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. declined dramatically and the R&amp;D
	activity in Israel was discontinued. In addition, the closing of the NSN Transaction resulted in some product redundancies. On January&nbsp;23, 2013, we entered into a share purchase agreement to
	dispose of all of the issued and outstanding shares of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. for a nominal amount to several Israeli based companies. In connection with the disposition of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd., we
	were granted a license to certain IP of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. and we have agreed to comply with the R&amp;D Law in connection with our use and disposition of the licensed IP. We are not otherwise subject
	to any ongoing royalty obligations to the Israel Office of the Chief Scientist. In connection with the disposition DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. was renamed Axerra Networks&nbsp;Ltd.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	the time of the disposition of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd., under the terms of a supply and services agreement, we estimated that we would have an opportunity to earn an additional
	$0.7&nbsp;million which represented our estimate of the amounts to be collected based on discounted forecasted future cash inflows. We revised our estimated receivable in fiscal 2014 and recognized
	a loss on change in estimate in the three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 of $0.6&nbsp;million. In fiscal year 2015 we reduced the estimated receivable to zero and recognized a further
	$52&nbsp;thousand loss on change in estimate associated with the disposition of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	DragonWave and HFCL Address Strategic Indian Market by Forming Joint Venture
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On October&nbsp;19, 2010, DragonWave and Himachal Futuristic Communications&nbsp;Ltd. ("HFCL"), one of India's
	leading telecommunication equipment manufacturers and turnkey service providers, announced the formation of a joint venture to provide leading packet microwave solutions to the Indian market.
	DragonWave owns 50.1% of the equity in DragonWave HFCL India Private Limited (the&nbsp;"Joint Venture Company") and the balance of the equity is owned by HFCL. We do not control the board of the
	Joint Venture Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Joint Venture Company, based in Delhi, utilizes HFCL's local market knowledge and expertise to sell and market DragonWave products in India. HFCL has a
	telecommunication equipment manufacturing facility at Solan, Himachal Pradesh.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With
	the completion of India's 3G and BWA radio-access spectrum auctions, service providers are rolling out 3G and 4G IP-based networks in order to support the bandwidth and service
	requirements of the new High-Speed Packet Access ("HSPA"), LTE and WiMAX base stations that will use this&nbsp;spectrum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Joint Venture Company had sales in fiscal 2015 of $18.9&nbsp;million primarily as a result of locally sourced material and the provision of installation and commission services to
	Reliance Jio, as well as the sale of hardware through the Nokia channel in the&nbsp;region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Equity Offerings&nbsp;&amp; Transactions (Over the Last Three Fiscal Years)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Offerings of Units
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2014 we completed the&nbsp;2014 Offering of units. The 2014 Offering consisted of the issue and sale of
	15,927,500&nbsp;2014 Units, at a price of CAD$1.80 per 2014 Unit for aggregate gross proceeds of approximately CAD$28.7&nbsp;million. Of the 15,927,500&nbsp;Units issued and sold, 2,077,500 of
	the 2014 Units were issued and sold pursuant to the exercise in full of the over-allotment option by the underwriters. Each 2014 Unit consisted of one common share and one-half of one 2014 Warrant.
	Each whole 2014 Warrant entitles the holder to purchase one common share of the Company at an exercise price of CAD$2.25 per share until August&nbsp;1, 2016, subject to certain standard adjustments.
	The 2014 Warrants trade on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol "DWI.WT" and on NASDAQ under the symbol "DRWIW". The Warrant Indenture for the 2014 Warrants was filed under our profile on SEDAR
	at
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	on August&nbsp;1, 2014, under the category "Other securityholders documents&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;English". As of the date of this
	Annual Report there are 7,963,750 of the 2014 Warrants outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	26
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=28,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=327007,FOLIO='26',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DI49901A.;6',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:28' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DI49901_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	gross proceeds of the 2014 Offering, before expenses, were approximately CAD$28.7&nbsp;million. We have used the net proceeds from the 2014 Offering to strengthen our balance
	sheet, to fund working capital and for general corporate purposes. We expect that any exercise of the 2014 Warrants will result in the cash proceeds from such exercise being paid to
	the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	September&nbsp;23, 2013, we completed the&nbsp;2013 Offering of 2013 Units. The 2013 Offering consisted of the issue and sale of 11,910,000 2013 Units at a price of $2.10 per 2013
	Unit for aggregate gross proceeds of approximately $25.0&nbsp;million. Each 2013 Unit consisted of one common share and three quarters of one 2013 Warrant. Each whole 2013 Warrant originally
	entitled the holder to purchase one of our common shares at an exercise price of $2.70 per share until September&nbsp;23, 2018, subject to certain adjustments. In connection with the 2014 Offering,
	and pursuant to the terms of the 2013 Warrants, the exercise price of the 2013 Warrants was changed to $1.30 per share. The form of 2013 Warrant setting out the terms of the 2013 Warrants was filed
	under our profile on SEDAR at
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	on September&nbsp;17, 2013, under the category "Documents incorporated by reference not previously
	filed&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;English". As of the date of this Annual Report there are 2,088,750 of the 2013 Warrants outstanding.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net proceeds of the 2013 Offering, after deducting commissions and listing expenses, were $22.4&nbsp;million. The net proceeds from the 2013 Offering were used to strengthen our
	balance sheet, to fund working capital and for general corporate purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	2013 Warrants contain a cashless exercise feature pursuant to which the holder may, in its sole discretion, exercise the 2013 Warrant in whole or in part and, in lieu of making the
	cash payment on account of the aggregate exercise price, elect instead to receive upon such exercise the net number of common shares
	determined according to the formula set forth in the form of Warrant and defined in the form of 2013 Warrant as the "Net Number". The 2013 Warrants also provide that holders may exercise on a cashless
	basis and receive 133
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
	/
<SMALL>
	3
</SMALL>
	% of the common shares they would otherwise be entitled to receive upon exercise of the Warrants, if such exercise (1)&nbsp;occurs after November&nbsp;12,
	2013 and before October&nbsp;12, 2014, and (2)&nbsp;the "Market Price" (as&nbsp;defined in the form of Warrant) is less than $2.10 (as&nbsp;adjusted for stock splits, stock dividends,
	recapitalizations and similar events). Since November&nbsp;12, 2013, an aggregate of 6,843,750 2013 Warrants have been exercised and 9,200,454&nbsp;common shares have been issued pursuant to such
	cashless exercises.
</FONT>
</P>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On May&nbsp;14, 2013, we, and our Peruvian-based, sales partner Electrodata, announced the ongoing deployment of over
	200&nbsp;new DragonWave Horizon links as part of regional service provider Olo del Peru's expansion plans. Increased microwave backhaul capacity is enabling the carrier to reach more customers and
	offer new and enhanced services.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

	On April&nbsp;10, 2013, we announced the Renewed Framework.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On March&nbsp;11, 2013, we announced a product addition to our portfolio with the introduction of the Harmony Radio
	Lite. Harmony Radio Lite is specifically tailored to provide reliable and affordable connectivity to vertical markets, such as public safety, education, healthcare, oil and gas organizations and
	utilities, as well support growing mobile backhaul demand in rural and suburban communities.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Fiscal Year 2013 (March&nbsp;1, 2012 until February&nbsp;28, 2013)
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	On February&nbsp;19, 2013, we announced an addition to our product portfolio with the introduction of the Avenue Link
	Lite. With a form factor of only 7.5&nbsp;inches square including antenna, the sub-6&nbsp;GHz point-to-point microwave radio supports both licensed and unlicensed spectrum and is ideally suited
	for non-line-of-sight (NLOS) scenarios where obstructions are found between link&nbsp;endpoints.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>

	Siemens Networks' (now&nbsp;Nokia) microwave transport business in China as all Chinese regulatory requirements had been&nbsp;met.
</FONT>

	product family to deliver high-capacity, 4G/LTE-Ready wireless backhaul networks.
</FONT>

	On May&nbsp;8, 2012, we announced the availability of higher modulation modes of up to 2048 QAM on our Horizon packet
	microwave products. This higher modulation allows the radios to transport up to 37% more data through existing microwave channels, which significantly improves spectral efficiency and,
	correspondingly, lowers operators' cost per&nbsp;bit.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DI49901_1_30">
</A>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>

	described above.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On May&nbsp;1, 2012, we announced that we had expanded our portfolio to deliver broader frequency coverage and extended
	application support by adding the Horizon S-Series, a sub-6&nbsp;GHz radio suited for non-line-of-sight applications such as those required for public safety and state and local governments, as well
	as certain microcellular backhaul applications. The Horizon E-Series, which operates in the licensed 70/80&nbsp;GHz frequencies, was also added. This series is designed for shorter-range deployments
	in urban environments, such as in a mobile backhaul scenario, microcellular backhaul applications or to provide enterprise connectivity.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DI49901_B__DESCRIPTION_OF_THE_BUSINESS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DI49901_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Description of the business
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	General
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Principal Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We target customers principally in the global communications service provider market, including broadband service providers and mobile
	service providers. In the broadband service provider market, our products are used to connect to the core of the network in both mature, developed markets as an extension or alternative to existing
	broadband infrastructure, and in emerging markets that possess limited broadband infrastructure as an alternative to deployment of wireline infrastructure. In the mobile service provider market, our
	products are used by service providers that provide emerging high-capacity mobile services to end-users. We also target enterprise and municipal/government customers that own or operate private
	networks requiring point-to-point applications. Our principal markets are described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Communications Service Provider Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Broadband Service Provider Market
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Broadband is a high-speed digital communications medium that uses high-bandwidth channels for sending and receiving large amounts of
	voice, video and other data. Traditionally, broadband services have been delivered to end-users via cable, DSL or T1/E1 (TDM) networks, which transmit communications much faster than analog networks
	used for earlier data and voice communications.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Communications
	service providers provide broadband connectivity to business customers both "in territory" where they own the infrastructure connecting their points of presence and
	end-users, and "out of territory", where they must lease or build this access infrastructure. The leased lines model is generally not optimal for these service providers, due to high lease costs and
	the fact that, in many cases, lines must be leased from direct competitors. As a result, these service providers have an economic and strategic imperative to find a cost-effective alternative to
	leased lines. We believe that Ethernet microwave transport technologies, such as those we provide, can serve as this alternative.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Mobile Service Provider Market
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Wireless communications services is the provision of voice, video and other data communications services to users of wireless devices
	for network connectivity for fixed and/or mobile applications. Within this market, we focus on service providers offering emerging high-capacity services based upon 3G+ access technologies, primarily
	HSPA and&nbsp;LTE.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	wireless networks, mobile wireless handsets and other subscriber devices connect to a network of wireless base stations, which are in turn interconnected by backhaul network solutions
	to the fiber optic core network. Cellular and other mobile networking technologies have evolved to provide higher bandwidth and IP networking capabilities. We believe that in markets where subscriber
	growth is most rapid, service providers will focus on building new networks to provide basic voice service, and in markets where the subscriber base is mature, service
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=32,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=596836,FOLIO='30',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DI49901A.;6',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:28' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DI49901_1_31">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	providers
	will focus on expanding the capacity of existing networks to roll out advanced data and video services which require higher network bandwidth per subscriber. Both scenarios create increased
	demand for backhaul capacity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3G+
	wireless technologies comprise a range of technologies that enable the provision of high-speed wireless access services for subscriber devices such as handsets and personal
	computers. 3G+ wireless technologies include technologies evolved from traditional cellular technologies or from all-IP broadband wireless access technologies such as LTE. As such, 3G+ mobile
	technologies encompass a range of different wireless network access standards that provide increased subscriber bandwidth either in legacy TDM networks or utilizing emerging wireless IP networks. 3G+
	mobile technologies enable users to utilize voice services as well as high bandwidth applications such as downloading music and other content such as maps and video, exchanging email, multimedia
	messaging, and a broad array of Internet applications.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	major emerging high-capacity all-IP radio access network technologies currently being deployed or planned for deployment are LTE and Small-Cell
	LTE/3G:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Long Term Evolution (LTE)
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is an advanced 3G+ technology for both GSM and
	CDMA cellular service providers. Approved in 2008, LTE is defined by the 3G Partnership Project with the latest release being 3GPP Release 10. With typical download speeds of approximately
	6&nbsp;Mbps, LTE is considerably higher bandwidth than HSPA (evolved from GSM) and EV-DO (evolved from CDMA). LTE is an IP networking technology and we envision that GSM and CDMA service providers
	will eventually migrate to LTE to provide an interoperable IP-based cellular system worldwide.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Small Cell LTE/3G
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Small cells are
	being widely planned for deployment to increase total network capacity in high usage areas, such as urban metros. The deployments are on non-traditional locations, such as light poles, and will be
	very dependent on high capacity wireless backhaul. Trials of these architectures are currently being carried out in several geographies, and initial pilot small cell deployments have&nbsp;commenced.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Enterprise and Government/Municipal/Public Safety Markets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We also target large organizations, such as enterprises and government/municipal bodies, with diverse locations that require or own
	high bandwidth communications networks. This market includes the education sector (distance learning and Internet access for schools), the health sector (remote imaging and campus networks) and
	municipalities that deploy networks for city-wide public Internet access and/or government and emergency services. In this market, we target our products at organizations that build their own
	communications networks rather than lease services from service providers. We believe that as bandwidth demand continues to grow, these organizations will increasingly consider the implementation of
	private networks to reduce service lease costs. Examples of our end-customers that have deployed private networks include SAAB (Sweden National Security Communication Network), The City of Barrie
	(Ontario, Canada), South Wales Fire Department (U.K.), The Palm Springs School District (California, United&nbsp;States), South Georgia Regional Information Technical Authority (Georgia,
	United&nbsp;States), Nexus Systems (Louisiana, United&nbsp;States), City of Joliet (Illinois, United&nbsp;States), City of Plano (Texas, United&nbsp;States), City of Hoffman Estates (Illinois,
	United&nbsp;States), City of
	Melrose Park (Illinois, United&nbsp;States), Crane Naval Base (Indiana, United&nbsp;States), Ventura County (California, United&nbsp;States), the Dubai Police (Dubai, U.A.E.) and the WireIE
	(Canada).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Distribution Methods
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	distribute our products and services both directly and indirectly through channel partners. This strategy permits us to broaden our customer coverage, while at the same time retaining
	contact with our customer base and managing costs. The sales cycles can be lengthy and often include network studies and trials of our equipment in laboratory and field environments. Because our
	products are utilized in large network deployments, the sales are project-based and accordingly are highly variable from quarter to&nbsp;quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	31
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=33,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=520294,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DI49901A.;6',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:28' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_32">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- PARA=JUSTIFY -->
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	sales and business development team of 45&nbsp;employees is organized across four geographic regions: North America, Europe the Middle East and Africa ("EMEA"), Asia-Pacific and
	the Caribbean and Latin America ("CALA"). These employees are currently based in the United&nbsp;States, Canada, Mexico, the United&nbsp;Kingdom, France, Spain, Italy, the Netherlands, Russia, the
	United Arab Emirates, Pakistan, South Africa, Singapore, Indonesia, China, Brazil and Argentina. Our sales and business development team is comprised of dedicated personnel assigned to specific
	customer accounts. Sales personnel have extensive knowledge of network infrastructure. In addition to monitoring closely the target markets for potential network deployments and new customer
	opportunities, our sales team builds on our existing relationships with our customers' network planning organizations, including participating in business case development and technical analysis
	of&nbsp;projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Direct Sales Strategy
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our direct customers are typically service providers that operate networks in large geographical areas. The sales cycle to this class
	of customer typically involves a trial (or&nbsp;trials), and typically requires nine to twelve months from first contact before orders are received. However, the sales cycle can be longer,
	particularly in green field situations. Once the order stage is reached, a supply agreement is usually established and multiple orders are processed under one master supply agreement. Master supply
	agreements provide the framework for future business and do not generally include any volume commitments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	North America is our primary geographic market, the sales team targets service providers across the world and our products have been deployed in numerous countries including:
	across Europe (in&nbsp;France, Germany, Sweden, Spain, Italy, Cyprus and the United&nbsp;Kingdom), the Middle East and Africa (in&nbsp;the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia, Jordan, Kuwait,
	Israel, Lebanon, Nigeria and South Africa), CALA (Peru, Mexico), and Asia (India, Pakistan, China and&nbsp;Australia).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	direct sales and business development team primarily focuses on Tier&nbsp;1 service providers, such as WireIE, Xplornet, Northeast Wireless Networks and Reliance Jio. This channel
	represented approximately 29% of revenue for the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 (fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;9%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Indirect Sales Channel Strategy
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Nokia Channel
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following the NSN Transaction we added Nokia to our distribution process. This relationship provides a potentially large indirect sales
	channel in which the product lines we purchased in the NSN Transaction, as well as other product lines we offer, are sold through Nokia's worldwide channel.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nokia
	purchases our products through multiple legal entities and moves them through its internal channels to the eventual end-users in geographic regions across the globe. The location
	of the Nokia buying entity does not necessarily reflect where the product is ultimately deployed. As a key part of our sales activities related to Nokia, our sales and support teams work directly with
	the Nokia customer teams in various geographic regions on bid activity, product demonstration coordination, customer meetings and general support of the Nokia customer&nbsp;teams.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, revenue through our channel relationship with Nokia has represented 53% of our total revenue. See
	"Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Information on the Company&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;B.&nbsp;Description of the
	Business&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;General&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Economic Dependence" and
	"Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Key Information&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;Risk&nbsp;Factors".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Other Indirect Channels
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our indirect sales channel consists primarily of distributors and regional value-added resellers ("VARs"), and is involved in both
	channel-initiated sales (sales initiated and serviced by third parties) and channel-fulfilled sales (sales initiated by our direct sales team and serviced by third party resellers). Our principal
	North American distributors are TESSCO Technologies&nbsp;Inc., Talley&nbsp;Inc., Alliance Communications Corporation and Hutton Communications&nbsp;Inc. These distributors have been selected
	based on geographic coverage and access to markets. Within North America, the VARs are identified by our distributors. We have agreements with several regional VARs in North America. Outside of North
	America, we select the VARs directly. We qualify our VARs
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=34,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=683483,FOLIO='32',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DK49901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:14' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_33">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	based
	on experience deploying microwave equipment, contacts in our target customer segments, and financial stability. We provide ongoing training to our VARs, and our VARs work with our dedicated
	account managers, participate in co-operative marketing programs for customer sales. Our personnel assist our VARs with initial installations of our products to provide quality assurance to
	end-customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also work with OEMs&nbsp;(original equipment manufacturers), including system integrators and network equipment vendors, to assist them in providing complete network solutions for
	their end-customers, who are primarily Tier&nbsp;1 service providers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	EMEA and Asia-Pacific, we have agreements with regional VARs in the United&nbsp;Kingdom, Ireland, Spain, France, Germany, Belgium, the Netherlands, Sweden, Norway, Hungary, the
	Czech Republic, Russia, Israel, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates, Kuwait, South Africa, Australia, Pakistan and&nbsp;Singapore.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	indirect sale channel represented approximately 18% of revenue for the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 (fiscal year ended
	February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;32%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenues
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our revenue for the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 was $157.8&nbsp;million, compared with $90.0&nbsp;million for the
	fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014. Almost all of our revenue originated from our Harmony and Horizon product lines. We prepare consolidated financial statements, which include
	the revenue from the Joint Venture Company. All intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated upon consolidation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	analyze our sales according to geographic region and target product development and sales strategies. The following table presents total revenues by geographic location though direct
	and indirect sales and through our channel partner,&nbsp;Nokia:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_4"></A>

</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	previous fiscal years we did not have visibility to the geographic breakdown of sales shipped through Nokia's warehouses to the end customer. Below is the financial information
	available on the geographic distribution of our sales for the fiscal years ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 and February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>

</TD>
</TR>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Production and Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	outsource most of our manufacturing and certain elements of the supply chain management and distribution functions. Outsourcing these functions allows us to focus on designing,
	developing, selling and supporting our products. In addition, we are able to leverage the economies of scale and expertise of specialized outsourced manufacturers, reduce manufacturing and supply
	chain risk and reduce distribution costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have several providers of outsourced manufacturing, repair and logistic services including: Plexus Corp. ("Plexus"), TQ-Systems Durach&nbsp;GmbH ("TQ"), Jabil Circuit ("Jabil"),
	Lloyd Douglas Solutions ("LDS"), and Panalpina World Transport&nbsp;LTD ("Panalpina").
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Plexus is an electronics manufacturing services company headquartered in Neenah, Wisconsin with manufacturing facilities
	located around the world. Plexus provides product design, supply chain and materials management, manufacturing, test, fulfillment and aftermarket solutions to branded product companies in the wireline
	networking, wireless infrastructure, medical, industrial and defense/security/aerospace market sectors. Our products are manufactured at Plexus facilities in Boise, Idaho and Penang, Malaysia.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	TQ is an electronics manufacturing services company providing manufacturing and repair services for us at its facility in
	Durach, Germany.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Jabil is an electronics manufacturing services company headquartered in St.&nbsp;Petersburg, Florida with facilities
	located around the world. Our products are manufactured and repaired at Jabil facilities in Penang, Malaysia and Marcianise, Italy.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	LDS provides manufacturing and repair services to us from its manufacturing and repair facility located in Kanata,
	Ontario.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Panalpina headquartered in Basel, Switzerland provides logistics services for us globally as well as at facilities located
	in Praque, Czech Republic and Johor, Malaysia.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have allocated manufacturing of our products (including components) among key suppliers to reduce the risks associated with using a single supply source and to ensure competitive
	pricing and levels of service. Using multiple suppliers also enables us to respond more rapidly to increases in demand for our&nbsp;products.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and Development Activities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	ability to develop technologically superior and cost-effective solutions relative to our competitors can only be achieved through our continued research and development ("R&amp;D")
	efforts.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	R&amp;D activities take place at our headquarters in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada and in Shanghai, China. We currently have approximately 127&nbsp;personnel in our engineering group,
	representing approximately 47% of our total personnel. The majority of our engineering staff hold degrees in engineering. A large number of our senior engineering personnel have worked together for
	several years and have been responsible for the development of our products. Our R&amp;D team works closely with our diverse customer base, and incorporates feedback from our direct and indirect sales
	teams into our product development plans to improve our products and address emerging market requirements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=36,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=661004,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DK49901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:14' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_35">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	November&nbsp;30, 2012, we added 100&nbsp;employees in Shanghai. As of the date of this Annual Report, there are 81&nbsp;employees in Shanghai, 74 of which are in R&amp;D. From
	June&nbsp;1, 2012 until November&nbsp;30, 2012, the services of these employees were provided under a services arrangement with&nbsp;Nokia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Between
	June&nbsp;1, 2012 and April&nbsp;9, 2013, we also received R&amp;D services outside of China provided by Nokia under a services arrangement. These services were discontinued on
	April&nbsp;9, 2013 as part of the Renewed Framework.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	R&amp;D expenses have historically been, and will continue to be, a significant portion of our overall cost structure as we will continue to invest in new product features and new
	platforms to better serve the current and future needs of our customers. We invested 11% and 22% of our revenues in R&amp;D during fiscal year 2015 and fiscal year 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Competitive Conditions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	face competition in our target markets from two types of microwave equipment suppliers: Hybrid equipment suppliers and Ethernet equipment suppliers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Microwave
	equipment has historically been used to address the backhaul requirements of 2G cellular applications and, today, a large portion of the market is still PDH (plesiosychronous
	digital hierarchy) and Hybrid products. The leading suppliers of PDH and Hybrid microwave equipment are NEC Corporation, Alcatel-Lucent, Ericsson and Huawei. While we compete with suppliers of PDH
	backhaul products used in 2G networks, our native Ethernet-based products are optimized for the transport of packet-based networks and feature significantly higher capacity, and a manufacturing
	process that delivers this high capacity at a lower price, compared to PDH&nbsp;equipment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	second category of equipment suppliers for backhaul applications are, like us, focused on Ethernet-based products in IP networks. These suppliers are our main competitors and include
	SIAE Microelettronica, Ceragon Networks&nbsp;Ltd. and Aviat Networks,&nbsp;Inc. (formerly Harris Stratex Networks,&nbsp;Inc.). We encounter these competitors in network builds focused on IP
	traffic. We believe that our high bandwidth capability/flexibility, and all-outdoor solution, performance and simplicity differentiate our solution from products offered by our competitors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also face competition from full service network integrators such as Huawei, NEC Corp., Alcatel-Lucent and Ericsson, who have developed competing Ethernet-based products for
	IP&nbsp;networks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	telecommunications equipment industry has experienced significant consolidation among its participants, and we expect this trend to continue. These consolidations have increased the
	size and resources of our competitors. Most recently, our principal channel partner Nokia has announced its proposed acquisition of Alcatel-Lucent. As indicated above, Alcatel-Lucent has a vertically
	integrated microwave business unit. The proposed combination of Nokia and Alcatel-Lucent combination increases uncertainty for the future of the Nokia channel. See
	"Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Key Information&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;Risk&nbsp;Factors".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	assessment of our competitive position, as described above, is based, among other factors, on our knowledge of the telecommunications equipment industry and communications with
	our&nbsp;customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Products or Services
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	principal commercialized product lines are Harmony, Horizon, Avenue and&nbsp;NetViewer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Harmony
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Harmony product line is a multi-service wireless platform enabling TDM and packet-based services across wireless or wireline
	infrastructure. This product line was originally acquired through the NSN Transaction, and is currently resold by Nokia under the brand name "Flexipacket". This product is unique in that it has true
	hybrid capabilities, with software upgradability to an all-IP&nbsp;network.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=37,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=617809,FOLIO='35',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DK49901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:14' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_36">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony First Mile 200
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harmony First Mile 200&nbsp;is a reliable and flexible indoor unit (IDU) of the Harmony family, which can be used for tail or chain
	application in the mobile backhaul. It can be connected to the Harmony Radio outdoor units (ODU) to carry traditional E1/T1 and Ethernet traffic. The Harmony First Mile 200&nbsp;directly powers the
	Harmony Radio, offers flexible protection architectures including Hot-Standby and ring capability. The Harmony First Mile 200&nbsp;also provides multiple end-to-end synchronization options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Hub 800
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;With the Harmony Hub 800, we deliver a multi-service platform that provides packet, pseudowire and hybrid capabilities. Hub
	800&nbsp;is a reliable and flexible indoor unit (IDU), which can be used for tail, hub and edge application in the mobile backhaul. It provides up to 12&nbsp;ODU directions with high capacity
	TDMoP (up&nbsp;to 128E1s) and full protection scenario, and is able to have interface to SDH network as well. The Hub 800&nbsp;uses a multi-slot structure, and provides microwave integration with
	the Harmony Radio. Optional cards are used to fit the requirements of different applications. The Harmony Hub 800&nbsp;also provides multiple end-to-end synchronization options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Radio
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harmony Radio is a reliable and flexible microwave radio, which efficiently transports Ethernet traffic in RF bands from 3.5&nbsp;GHz
	up to 38&nbsp;GHz. Harmony Radio can be used in different transmission networks: mobile networks, fixed networks or private networks. Harmony Radio is the traditional outdoor unit of the Harmony
	product Line: a packet microwave system designed to meet the requirements of evolved transport networks with the target of minimizing the total cost of ownership for the operator. Harmony Radio joins
	together the benefits of an advanced scalable microwave radio and of a real carrier grade Ethernet nodal solution. Harmony Radio provides field upgradability from a hybrid to an all-IP architecture.
	The Harmony Radio supports overhead compression, and all-outdoor XPIC. In addition, multi-radio provides advanced protection capability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Enhanced
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harmony Enhanced is the next generation of the Harmony Radio and Horizon Compact+ integrated into a single platform. Harmony Enhanced
	was launched in September&nbsp;2014, and the complete frequency coverage of this platform will continue development during the fiscal year ending February&nbsp;29, 2016. Harmony Enhanced is
	DragonWave's highest capacity radio in the 6-42GHz frequency bands, through new 4096QAM modulation support, and Bandwidth Accelerator Plus, which is the combination of both header and bulk
	compression. The Harmony Enhanced also enables future scalability by being MIMO-ready. Harmony Enhanced is an all-outdoor radio, with integrated Ethernet switching, including 4&nbsp;GigE ports,
	MPLS-TP and H-QoS support. Harmony Enhanced will support the longest all-outdoor reach in the industry through the optional high power&nbsp;system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Radio Lite
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Harmony Radio Lite is a sub-6&nbsp;Ghz product with near and non-line of sight capabilities in the licensed and unlicensed bands.
	With an all-outdoor architecture and integrated 6" antennas, the Harmony Radio Lite is optimized for 3G and 4G small cell backhaul. The Harmony Radio Lite is a differentiated platform with SynchE,
	1588, low delay and low PDV capabilities. In addition, the Harmony Radio Lite can be deployed as an integrated ODU with the Harmony First Mile 200 or Harmony Hub 800, and provides end to end Ethernet
	capabilities within the Harmony product&nbsp;family.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Eband
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harmony Eband is, a compact, lightweight, low energy consumption radio operating in the 70-80&nbsp;GHz spectrum. The Harmony Eband is
	ideally suited for mobile backhaul markets, providing reach comparable to a 23-38&nbsp;GHz offering, higher capacity and a lower OPEX expansion solution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Harmony
	Eband allows operators to tap into readily available spectrum that is generally lower cost and more lightly licensed than lower frequencies and it is equipped with a number of
	features that increase spectral
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=38,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=899196,FOLIO='36',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DK49901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:14' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_37">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	efficiency
	and extend the radio's reach, while also providing extensive networking capabilities compliant with the latest Carrier Ethernet standards. Harmony Eband's industry leading performance is
	demonstrated by operation up to 64&nbsp;QAM to achieve throughput of 2.5&nbsp;Gbps full duplex in 500&nbsp;MHz mode. Spectral efficiency is further enhanced by both payload and header
	compression to deliver capacity of up to 4&nbsp;Gbps. Additionally, Harmony Eband features the DragonWave Reach Extender, which leverages Waveform and Modulation Adaptivity (WMA) and MIMO to extend
	the radio's reach and deliver 3-6&nbsp;KM links with high availability. With an ultra-low delay mode and a CPRI interface, the Harmony Eband radio is also an ideal solution for fronthaul
	applications.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Harmony Trunk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Harmony Trunk is a traditional microwave system used for high-capacity multi-channel applications. This product is primarily used
	in emerging markets, and offers all-indoor configurations in a rack mount system. It operates in the sub-11&nbsp;GHz bands, with focus on reach capabilities, and both packet and hybrid
	configurations. We work in partnership with Fujitsu to provide our Harmony Trunk product and we act as an integrator/reseller of this product through our established sales&nbsp;channels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Horizon Product Family
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We commenced commercial production of our Horizon product line in 2007. Our Horizon product line was designed as a next-generation
	product to follow our AirPair product line, which was introduced in 2002 and is now in its end of life&nbsp;stage.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Horizon product family is an Ethernet microwave portfolio and consists of Horizon Compact+ and Horizon Quantum. Key features across our Horizon product line include adaptive
	modulation, ring/mesh support, advanced prioritization, jumbo frames, flow control, ATPC (adaptive transmission power control) and layer 2&nbsp;transparencies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Horizon Compact+
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In February&nbsp;2011, we launched the Horizon Compact+ globally. Horizon Compact+ is the evolution of our Horizon Compact product.
	Horizon Compact+ is an all-outdoor platform that is fully interoperable with Horizon Compact, enabling rapid adoption by existing customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	the first all-outdoor system to include 2048 QAM, Horizon Compact&nbsp;+&nbsp;has industry leading capacity and spectral efficiency capabilities. Building on the capacity
	increases enabled by our previously announced Bandwidth Accelerator technology, this spectrum-doubling capability increases the data bandwidth of Horizon Compact+ to as high as 2&nbsp;Gbps. This
	industry leading spectral efficiency, offers a significant total cost of ownership benefit, especially in markets with high spectrum costs, such as Europe, India and&nbsp;Asia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Horizon
	Compact+ offers all the packet-based features of Horizon Compact, and introduces SynchE, as well as up to 4&nbsp;ports of Ethernet access. Horizon Compact+ operates in licensed
	spectrum from 6 to 60&nbsp;GHz.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Horizon Quantum
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In September&nbsp;2009, we launched our Horizon Quantum product in North America and in February&nbsp;2010, we launched Horizon
	Quantum in Europe. We have designed Horizon Quantum to provide significantly increased bandwidth capacity of up to 4&nbsp;Gbps per link. Horizon Quantum is a native Ethernet implementation
	supporting sub-0.1-ms latencies and is optimized for the rollout of LTE services. Horizon Quantum is a half-rack-unit device incorporating a Bandwidth Accelerator feature that enables superior
	spectral efficiency by up to a factor of 2.5&nbsp;times as compared to conventional systems. The combination of these features results in a five times improvement in rack density per unit of
	available bandwidth capacity. Horizon Quantum also integrates key nodal intelligence that enables network operations to be streamlined and simplified to yield significant cost efficiencies. For
	example, Horizon Quantum incorporates integrated switching capability enabling aggregation and switching to optimize ring-and-mesh network deployments by requiring reduced network equipment to be
	deployed, powered and maintained. Horizon Quantum also incorporates our standard user-scalable bandwidth enabling simple and remote scaling, without truck rolls, providing our customers with key
	operational-cost benefits.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=39,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=599413,FOLIO='37',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DK49901A.;14',USER='SSTALKE',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:14' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DK49901_1_38">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Avenue
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Avenue portfolio comprises three microcellular solutions ranging from an access microcell backhaul link (Avenue Link Lite), to a
	high capacity aggregation link (Avenue Link) to the industry's first fully-integrated microcellular platform (Avenue Site), with multi-beam backhaul and independently-aligned antenna array, Ethernet
	switching, power supply, battery backup and a slot for a 3G/4G micro base station; all within a single zoning-friendly enclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	Avenue solutions are integrated within environmentally hardened enclosures, optimized for street-level deployments. Engineered to provide the greatest flexibility for mobile
	operators, our Avenue products can be deployed on any number of structures including street lamps, traffic light poles, or building sides. Our Avenue solutions are designed to blend into the urban
	environment, meeting the size, weight and aesthetic requirements set by city zoning officials.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	NetViewer
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NetViewer is a multi-service, multi-product network management platform, sold directly and through the Nokia channel. The NetViewer
	platform supports the Harmony product line and the Horizon and Avenue product lines. NetViewer enables provisioning, management, monitoring, and configuration across the line of products in a single
	graphical user interface (GUI)-based system. NetViewer also manages legacy Nokia microwave products. NetViewer is an industry leading end-to-end Ethernet provisioning engine.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Components
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	product solution consists of links. Each link is comprised of two radios, two modems, and two antennas and includes our proprietary embedded software and FPGA (field-programmable
	gate array) firmware. Our links incorporate commercially-available electronic components sourced from third party suppliers, including FPGAs, monolithic microwave integrated circuits and
	microprocessors. The antennas used in our wireless carrier-Ethernet links are manufactured by third party suppliers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Component
	pricing is impacted by a number of factors including the volume we are purchasing, the demand in the industry for similar products which can limit supply, and economic factors
	such as the price of oil which can impact the landed cost of our&nbsp;components.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	manufacturing of our products depends on obtaining adequate supplies of third party components on a timely basis. We source several key components used in the manufacture of our
	products from a limited number of suppliers, and in some instances, a single source supplier. Because certain components have longer lead times, we often pre-order components based on sales forecasts.
	This can result in oversupply or undersupply of components if actual sales are different from forecast sales. See "Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;3.&nbsp;Key
	Information&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;D.&nbsp;Risk&nbsp;Factors".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- BOXING PARAGRAPH(S) -->
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:SOLID #000000 1PT;MARGIN-RIGHT:1PT;PADDING-TOP:1PT;PADDING-RIGHT:3PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:2PT;PADDING-LEFT:4PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;Intangible Properties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;">
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with industry practice, we seek to protect our proprietary rights through a combination of patent, copyright, trade-mark and trade secret laws and contractual provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Patent
	law offers some protection for our current and future products and may protect certain elements of our manufacturing processes. Our patent strategy is focused on protecting novel
	elements of the following aspects of our product and manufacturing design, such&nbsp;as:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	core design features (including certain circuits and algorithms required for advanced, low-cost point-to-point radio
	implementations);
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	implementation technologies (consisting of the proprietary aspects of our manufacturing design that permit low-cost
	automated assembly and&nbsp;testing);
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	certain key Ethernet microwave networking technologies for high-speed, high-performance metro Ethernet networking
	applications (including bandwidth scaling feature (marketed as "Flex"), mesh rapid link shutdown feature, mesh node packaging/integration);&nbsp;and
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
