<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DQ49901_E__SHARE_OWNERSHIP_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DQ49901_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	E.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Share Ownership.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth information with respect to the beneficial ownership of our common shares as at May&nbsp;21, 2015 by
	each of our directors and all our directors and executive officers as a group as at that date. As used in this table, beneficial ownership means the sole or shared power to vote or direct the voting
	or to dispose of or direct the sale of any security. A person is deemed to be the beneficial owner of securities that can be acquired within 60&nbsp;days upon the exercise of any option, warrant
	or&nbsp;right.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_13"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:62%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"130%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="130%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="126PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Outstanding Option-Based Awards for Directors as at February&nbsp;28, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets forth all unexercised options outstanding as of February&nbsp;28, 2015 for each director of the Company
	(other than Peter Allen and Russell Frederick (who&nbsp;was a director of the Company until June&nbsp;20, 2014) whose unexercised options are reflected in the table titled "Outstanding
	Option-Based Awards and Share-Based Awards as at February&nbsp;28, 2015"&nbsp;below).
</FONT>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	The
	closing market price of the common shares on the Toronto Stock Exchange (the&nbsp;"TSX") on February&nbsp;28, 2015 was CAD$1.11 per
	common&nbsp;share.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Foreign
	currency is translated at the closing rate for the 2015 fiscal year. CAD to USD is 0.7995 (1.2508).
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Mr.&nbsp;Pons
	was a director until his resignation effective April&nbsp;14, 2015 and he will not stand for re-election at the&nbsp;Meeting.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Subsequent
	to February&nbsp;28, 2015, Mr.&nbsp;Pons resigned from the board, and his options expired on May&nbsp;14,&nbsp;2015.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-9PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	(5)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	Mr.&nbsp;Cossart
	was a director until June&nbsp;20, 2014 as he did not stand for re-election at the annual general and special meeting of shareholders.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>

	terminated effective April&nbsp;14, 2015 in connection with his resignation.

<FONT SIZE=1>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

	The
	closing market price of the common shares on the TSX on February&nbsp;28, 2015 was CAD$1.11 per common&nbsp;share.

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=59,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=984846,FOLIO='57',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_58">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Share-Based Awards
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Description of the Share Based Compensation Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;After a review of the Company's compensation policies in May&nbsp;2014, the board of directors recommended that shareholders approve
	the Share Based Compensation Plan which replaced the Sixth Amended and Restated Key Employee Stock Option Plan (the&nbsp;"Old Option Plan"). This recommendation was made to bring the Company's
	compensation policies in line with trends in compensation practice, which includes a move away from stock options to other forms of equity-based compensation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following disclosure is a summary of the Share Based Compensation Plan and is qualified in its entirety by reference to the Share Based Compensation Plan, a copy of which is set out
	in Appendix&nbsp;B to&nbsp;the Management Information Circular dated May&nbsp;23, 2014 of the Company and filed under our profile on SEDAR at www.sedar.com on May&nbsp;27, 2014, under the
	category "Management information circular&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;English". Capitalized terms used but not defined in the following disclosure shall have the meanings ascribed thereto
	in the Share Based Compensation Plan. The following is not a comprehensive discussion of all of the terms and conditions of the Share Based Compensation Plan. Readers are advised to review the full
	text of the Share Based Compensation Plan to fully understand all terms and conditions of the&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject
	to the adjustment provisions provided for in the Share Based Compensation Plan and the applicable rules and regulations of all regulatory authorities to which the Company is
	subject (including any stock exchange), the total number of common shares reserved for issuance pursuant to the Share Based Compensation Plan shall not exceed 10% of the issued and outstanding common
	shares, provided that the maximum number of Bonus Shares (as&nbsp;defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan) issued in any 12&nbsp;month period shall not exceed 1.0% of the total number of
	issued and outstanding common shares (calculated on a non-diluted basis). Should the Company issue additional common shares in the future, the number of common shares issuable under the Share Based
	Compensation Plan will increase accordingly. For purposes of calculating the available pool of common shares for awards under the Share Based Compensation Plan, common shares issuable upon the
	exercise of options granted under the Old Option Plan that are currently outstanding will not be available for grant. However, the following will not be counted in calculating the available pool of
	common&nbsp;shares:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(i)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	common
	shares issued pursuant to the exercise of options granted under the Share Based Compensation Plan, which shall be returned to the pool of common
	shares and may be made subject to additional awards granted pursuant to the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(ii)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	common
	shares issued pursuant to the exercise of options granted under the Old Option Plan, which shall be returned to the pool of common shares and may be
	made subject to additional awards granted pursuant to the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(iii)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	common
	shares issued pursuant to the settlement of vested awards, which shall be returned to the pool of common shares and may be made subject to
	additional awards granted pursuant to the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan;
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(iv)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Bonus
	Shares (as&nbsp;defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan);
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(v)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	common
	shares which by reason of the expiration, cancellation or termination of an unexercised option are no longer subject to purchase pursuant to an
	option granted under the Share Based Compensation Plan, which shall be returned to the pool of common shares and may be made subject to additional awards granted pursuant to the Share Based
	Compensation Plan;&nbsp;and
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(vi)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	common
	shares which by reason of the expiration without vesting of a performance based share unit ("PSU"), a RSU, or a deferred share unit ("DSU"), or by
	reason of the cancellation of a PSU, RSU or DSU are no longer subject to issuance, which shall be returned to the pool of common shares and may be made subject to additional awards granted pursuant to
	the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	purposes of the above, if an award entitles the holder to receive or purchase common shares, the number of common shares covered by such award or to which such award relates will be
	counted on the date of
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	58
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=60,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=940888,FOLIO='58',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_59">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	grant
	of such award against the aggregate number of common shares available for granting awards under the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Common
	shares will not be deemed to have been issued pursuant to the Share Based Compensation Plan with respect to any portion of an award that is settled in&nbsp;cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Share Based Compensation Plan includes provision for granting of PSUs, RSUs, DSUs, Bonus Shares (as&nbsp;defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan) and options to purchase
	common shares. Settlement of vested PSUs, RSUs and DSUs is effected by delivering common shares acquired in the open market and/or issued from treasury, or by making a cash payment equal to the number
	of PSUs, RSUs or DSUs multiplied
	by the volume weighted average trading price of the common shares on the applicable stock exchange for the five trading days preceding the settlement date, or by a combination of these methods. The
	manner of settlement for RSUs, PSUs and DSUs is determined by the Compensation Committee in its sole discretion.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of the date of this Annual Report, options to purchase 1,026,482&nbsp;common shares (representing approximately 1.36% of the issued and outstanding common shares at the date of this
	Annual Report) are outstanding under the Share Based Compensation Plan, 60,000&nbsp;RSUs are outstanding under the Share Based Compensation Plan and 3,638,085&nbsp;common shares (representing
	approximately 4.83% of the issued and outstanding common shares at the date of this Annual Report) are available for future grants under the Share Based Compensation Plan. Should the Company issue
	additional common shares in the future, the number of common shares issuable under the Share Based Compensation Plan will increase accordingly.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
	awards granted pursuant to the Share Based Compensation Plan will be subject to all statutory tax withholdings under applicable tax&nbsp;laws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PSUs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PSUs are performance based share units which are granted to participants in the Share Based Compensation Plan based on either
	individual and
	corporate performance criteria, or a combination thereof. Performance objectives are established at the beginning of each fiscal year and the participant is awarded a number of share units based on
	measured performance against these objectives at the end of the year. The share units are paid out to the participant at some later date but no later than three years from the year in which the PSUs
	were granted. Subject to the terms of any applicable grant, non-vested PSUs are forfeited if the participant voluntarily leaves his or her employment with the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company believes that PSUs will provide it with a transparent and objective tool for rewarding performance, while providing participants with a defined incentive award.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RSUs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RSUs are share units which are granted to participants which vest over time. RSUs may, at the discretion of the board or the
	Compensation
	Committee, include performance objectives. The share units are paid out to the participant at some later date but no later than three years from the year in which the RSUs were granted. Subject to the
	terms of any applicable grant, non-vested RSUs are forfeited if the participant voluntarily leaves his or her employment with the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DSUs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Share Based Compensation Plan also makes provision for the use of DSUs as payment of directors' fees. A DSU is a notional
	share that has
	the same value as one common share. Under the proposed plan, directors may choose, with the consent of the Company, and subject to restrictions and procedures imposed by applicable law, to take all or
	part of their fees in&nbsp;DSUs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DSUs
	may be paid out to directors as common shares in the Company or in cash, at the discretion of the board, when they retire from the board. Subject to compliance with applicable tax
	laws, a retiring director may be able to defer the payment of such awards and decide to receive all or a portion of the cash payout the following year. The Company believes that the use of DSUs can
	have the advantage of encouraging higher levels of share ownership by the directors, thereby aligning their interests more closely with that of the Company while also preserving cash for
	the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bonus Shares.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Share Based Compensation Plan permits common shares to be issued as a discretionary bonus to participants. The maximum
	number of
	common shares issued as Bonus Shares in any 12&nbsp;month period cannot exceed 1.0% of the total number of issued and outstanding common shares (calculated on a non-diluted basis).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=61,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=790863,FOLIO='59',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_60">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Administration.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the Share Based Compensation Plan, the board may, at any time, appoint a committee to, among other things,
	interpret,
	administer and implement the Share Based Compensation Plan on behalf of the board of directors in accordance with such terms and conditions as the board may prescribe, consistent with the Share Based
	Compensation Plan. The Compensation Committee administers the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible Persons.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the Share Based Compensation Plan, awards may be granted to any Non-Employee Director, Officer, Employee or
	Consultant
	(all&nbsp;as defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan), or any of its Related Entities (as&nbsp;defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan). As used in this summary and the Share Based
	Compensation Plan, a participant is an eligible person to whom an award has been granted under the Share Based Compensation Plan. With regard to options granted to participants who are subject to the
	tax rules imposed by the United&nbsp;States Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the&nbsp;"IRC"), the options may be either "incentive stock options" (as&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;422
	of the IRC or "nonstatutory stock options." Under the IRC, the maximum number of options which can first become eligible to be exercised in any calendar year is limited to U.S.&nbsp;$100,000 (based
	on the fair market value of the common shares on the date of grant). Any amount in excess of this figure will be non-statutory stock&nbsp;options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exercise Price of Options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The exercise price per common share for options is fixed by the Compensation Committee but under no
	circumstances can the
	exercise price at the time of the grant be less than the fair market value of the common shares determined in accordance with the terms of the Share Based Compensation Plan. The exercise price of
	"incentive stock options" (as&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;422 of the IRC)
	granted to shareholders owning 10% or more of the Company must equal 110% of the fair market value of the common shares on the date of&nbsp;grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Term of Options.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to certain extensions in the case of a blackout period, the term of options granted will be determined by the
	board or the
	Compensation Committee and specified in the option agreement pursuant to which such option is granted, provided that the date cannot be the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;the date which is the
	10th&nbsp;anniversary of the date on which such option is granted; and (ii)&nbsp;the last date permitted under the applicable rules and regulations of all regulatory authorities to which the
	Company is subject. Any "incentive stock option" (as&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;422 of the IRC) granted to a 10% shareholder in the preceding paragraph may have a maximum term of only
	five&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	the term of any options granted pursuant to the Share Based Compensation Plan is scheduled to expire: (i)&nbsp;at a time when the holder of the option is subject to restrictions on
	trading of securities of the Company under a trading "blackout" established by the Company (pursuant to the disclosure policy of the Company then in effect or otherwise) or pursuant to any lock-up
	agreement or other similar trading restriction (a&nbsp;"Blackout Period"); or (ii)&nbsp;within ten business days after the termination of a Blackout Period, the terms of the option will,
	notwithstanding the scheduled expiry date of the term of such Option, expire as of the date that is ten business days following the end of the applicable Blackout Period (the&nbsp;"Revised Expiry
	Date") and shall continue to be exercisable, convertible or otherwise remain outstanding for the benefit of the holder, as applicable, at any time up to the applicable time on the Revised
	Expiry&nbsp;Date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Limit on Incentive Stock Option Awards.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The maximum number of common shares issuable upon the exercise of "incentive stock options"
	(as&nbsp;defined in Section&nbsp;422 of the IRC) under the Share Based Compensation Plan is&nbsp;2,100,000.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of PSUs and RSUs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The board or the Compensation Committee may determine the vesting schedule of any PSU or RSU at the time of
	grant. PSUs
	vest based on performance criteria as determined by the board or Compensation Committee. RSUs generally vest in three annual increments. Subject to the terms of any applicable grant in the event that
	the participant terminates employment with the Company or its subsidiaries by reason of Eligible Retirement (as&nbsp;defined in the Share Based Compensation Plan), death or total disability
	(as&nbsp;determined by the Compensation Committee in good faith) (each an "Accelerated Vesting Event"), the non-vested PSU or RSU will: (i)&nbsp;in the case of Eligible Retirement or death being
	the Accelerated Vesting Event, immediately become 100% vested, or (ii)&nbsp;in the case of total disability being the Accelerated Vesting Event, vest on the sixtieth (60th) day following the
	participant's termination.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	60
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=62,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=28502,FOLIO='60',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_61">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject
	to the terms of any applicable grant if the participant terminates employment with the Company and its subsidiaries for any reason other than such Eligible Retirement, total
	disability or death or termination without cause, any non-vested PSUs and/or RSUs granted thereunder will be immediately cancelled without liability or compensation therefor and be of no further force
	and effect. For clarity, where the participant voluntarily terminates his/her employment with the Company or is otherwise terminated by the Company for cause, all non-vested PSUs and RSUs of the
	participant shall be immediately cancelled without compensation or liability therefor and be of no further force and&nbsp;effect.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the case of termination without cause, all unvested PSUs and RSUs immediately become 100% vested on the termination&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Settlement of Vested Units.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payment to the participant in respect of vested RSUs or PSUs will be as soon as practicable following the
	date on which
	the RSUs or PSUs become vested; provided that the settlement date shall not be later than the third anniversary of the date of grant and all payments in respect of vested units in the participant's
	notional account maintained by the Company shall be paid in full on or before December&nbsp;31 of the same calendar&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Vesting of DSUs.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the vesting provisions otherwise stipulated by the board or the Compensation Committee, where a participant
	is terminated
	for cause or where a non-employee director resigns or is otherwise removed as a result of losing his/her eligibility to serve on the board due to an order by a regulatory body or stock exchange or for
	culpable conduct as determined by the Compensation Committee, all unvested DSUs in the participant's notional account maintained by the Company shall be immediately cancelled without liability or
	compensation therefor and be of no further force and effect (unless otherwise determined by the Compensation Committee).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assignability.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Awards granted under the Share Based Compensation Plan are non-transferable and non-assignable to anyone other than to
	the estate of a
	participant in the event of death and then only in accordance with the terms of the Share Based Compensation&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination Provisions.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the terms of the Share Based Compensation Plan and any particular award granted under such plan, the
	following
	table describes the impact of certain events upon the rights of holders under the Share Based Compensation Plan. See also the discussion above under
	"Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;6.&nbsp;Directors, Senior Management and Employees&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;E.&nbsp;Share
	Ownership&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Share-Based Awards&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Description of the Share Based Compensation
	Plan&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Vesting of PSUs and RSUs" and "&#150;&nbsp;Vesting of&nbsp;DSUs".
</FONT>
</P>

</FONT>

<TR VALIGN="TOP">

<FONT SIZE=2>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any vested option shall expire upon the earlier of the expiry date of the award or 30&nbsp;days after the date of the event.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Termination for cause of an Employee, Officer or Non-Employee Director
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any non-vested award granted outstanding on date of the event and all rights thereunder shall terminate and no further vesting shall occur.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Resignation of an Employee or Officer
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any options held that are exercisable at the date of the event shall be exercisable until the earlier of 30&nbsp;days after the date of the event or the date on which the option otherwise expires.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:10PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Termination for cause, breach of fiduciary duty or for retirement which is not Eligible Retirement
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Any options held at the event date, whether or not exercisable on the date of the event, immediately expire and are cancelled on such date at a time determined by the Granting Authority, in its sole
	discretion.
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD COLSPAN=3 STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Procedure for Amending.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Share Based Compensation Plan may be amended, altered or discontinued by the board at any time, subject to
	obtaining any
	necessary approval of any applicable regulatory authority including, any rules imposed by any stock exchange or other quotation system upon which the common shares are traded, and to the extent
	otherwise imposed by applicable law and/or the rules of such stock exchange or other quotation system, and such amendment, alteration, or discontinuance shall be subject to the approval of the
	shareholders in accordance with the rules, regulations and policies of any applicable stock exchange at a duly constituted meeting of shareholders of the Company. In addition to the extent necessary
	or desirable to comply with applicable law or any rules imposed by any stock exchange or quotation system upon which the common shares are traded, the Share Based Compensation Plan shall be subject to
	the re-approval of shareholders of the Company pursuant to a duly authorized meeting of shareholders held no later than June&nbsp;20,&nbsp;2024.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other Material Information.
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Appropriate adjustments to the Share Based Compensation Plan and to awards granted thereunder will be made
	by the Company
	to give effect to adjustments in the number and type of common shares (or&nbsp;other securities or other property) resulting from subdivisions, consolidations, substitutions, or reclassifications of
	common shares, payment of share dividends or other prescribed changes in the Company's capital. In the event of any merger, acquisition, amalgamation, arrangement or other scheme of reorganization
	that results in a Change of Control, the board or the Compensation Committee may, subject to the terms of any applicable grant, take any action with respect to outstanding awards that it deems
	necessary or desirable, including the acceleration of any vesting provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Share Based Compensation Plan does not limit participation by insiders or provide for a maximum number of shares that may be issued to any one participant in the Share Based
	Compensation&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Description of the Old Option Plan
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Since the approval of the Share Based Compensation Plan at the annual general and special meeting of shareholders held on
	June&nbsp;20, 2014, no further options have been granted under the Old Option Plan but the options granted under the Old Option Plan will continue to be governed by the terms of the Old Option Plan.
	As of the date of this Annual Report, options to purchase 2,806,010&nbsp;common shares (representing approximately 3.73% of the issued and outstanding common shares at the date of this Annual
	Report) are outstanding under the Old Option Plan. No future grants will be made under the Old Option&nbsp;Plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	62
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=64,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=204454,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Old Option Plan was established to attract, retain and provide an incentive to the employees, directors, officers and consultants of the Company or its related entities (which
	includes any individual or company that controls or is controlled by the Company, or that is controlled by the same person or company that controls the Company), and to advance the Company's interests
	by providing these persons with the opportunity, through stock options, to acquire an ownership interest in the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Old Option Plan is administered by the Compensation Committee, or if a Compensation Committee is not appointed, by the board (in&nbsp;either case, the "Plan Administrator").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the Old Option Plan, unless otherwise determined by the board, options vest as to 25% on the first anniversary of the date of grant and thereafter, as to 1/36th&nbsp;of the
	remaining 75% of the optioned shares on the last day of each month, such that the option is fully vested on that date which is four years from the date of the&nbsp;grant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No
	option granted under the Old Option Plan shall extend for a period longer than seven years from the date of grant, provided that options granted prior to June&nbsp;15, 2010 shall
	expire, subject to accelerated terms as provided for in the Old Option Plan, in accordance with the terms of the option. The Old Option Plan contains provisions governing the termination of options in
	the event of a termination of employment or service of a director, officer, consultant or employee. In such circumstances, unvested options terminate immediately. Vested options expire 120&nbsp;days
	after the death of the participant or 30&nbsp;days after the termination of the participant's service "without cause" or by reason of voluntary resignation (or&nbsp;earlier if the option was
	otherwise due to expire). In the case of termination of the participant's services "for cause", or by reason of the breach of the participant's fiduciary duty to the Company or consulting arrangement
	with the Company, vested options terminate immediately.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	an option expires (other than an expiry by reason of the termination of the participant's services "for cause", or by reason of the breach of the participant's fiduciary duty to the
	Company or consulting arrangement with the Company) during or within ten days after a period during which a participant is prohibited from exercising options pursuant to the Company's insider trading
	policy, as in effect from time to time (a&nbsp;"Black Out Period"), the participant may elect for the term of such option to be extended to the date which is ten business days after the last day of
	the Black Out Period; provided that the expiration date as extended will not in any event be beyond the later of: (i)&nbsp;December&nbsp;31 of the calendar year in which the option was otherwise
	due to expire; and (ii)&nbsp;the 15th&nbsp;day of the third month following the month in which the option was otherwise due to&nbsp;expire.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a "Corporate Event" (as&nbsp;defined below), the board in its sole discretion (but&nbsp;subject to obtaining the prior approval of the TSX if required by the rules,
	regulations and policies of the TSX) may, without any action or consent of the participants, provide for: (a)&nbsp;the continuation or assumption of outstanding options by or to the successor to all
	or substantially all of the assets or capital shares of the Company, or any other successor of the business of the Company as determined by the board (the&nbsp;"Acquirer"); (b)&nbsp;the
	substitution of options for options and/or shares of restricted stock and/or other securities of the Acquirer; (c)&nbsp;the substitution of options with a cash incentive program of the Acquirer;
	(d)&nbsp;the acceleration of the vesting of options and, in the case of outstanding options the right to exercise such options, to a date prior to or on the date of the Corporate Event, and the
	expiration of outstanding options to the extent not timely exercised by the date of the Corporate Event or such other date as may be designated by the board; (e)&nbsp;the cancellation of all or any
	portion of the outstanding options by a cash payment and/or other consideration receivable by the holders of common shares as a result of the Corporate Event equal to the excess, if any, of the fair
	market value (as&nbsp;determined by the board), on the date of the Corporate Event, over the exercise price of the common shares subject to the outstanding options or portion thereof being
	cancelled; or (f)&nbsp;such other actions or combinations of the foregoing actions as it deems fair and reasonable in the circumstances. A "Corporate Event" is defined as: (i)&nbsp;a merger,
	amalgamation, consolidation, reorganization or arrangement of the Company with or into another corporation (other than a merger, amalgamation, consolidation, reorganization or arrangement of the
	Company with one or more of its Related Entities); (ii)&nbsp;a tender offer for all or substantially all of the outstanding common shares; (iii)&nbsp;the sale of all or substantially all of the
	assets of the Company; or (iv)&nbsp;any other acquisition of the business of the Company as determined by the&nbsp;board.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=65,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=723359,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Old Option Plan contains additional restrictions that are only applicable to options which are characterized as "incentive stock options" for the purposes of the IRC. In the case of
	incentive stock option grants to holders of 10% or more of the common shares, the exercise price of such incentive stock options must be not less than 110% of the fair market value of the common
	shares (provided that such fair market value shall not be less than the 5-day volume weighted trading price on the date of&nbsp;grant).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Except
	in the case of death of an optionee or in accordance with the applicable law, options are not assignable without the consent of the Company, provided that with the prior written
	consent of the Plan Administrator and subject to such conditions as the Plan Administrator may designate, allow options, other than incentive stock options, to be transferred or assigned to a
	registered retirement savings plan (RRSP), registered retirement income fund (RRIF) or tax-free savings account&nbsp;(TFSA).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments
	to the Old Option Plan generally require the consent of the TSX and the shareholders of the Company given at a duly constituted meeting. However, the following amendments to
	the Old Option Plan may be made by the board without TSX or other stock exchange approval and without shareholder approval: (a)&nbsp;amendments of a technical, clerical or "housekeeping" nature, or
	to clarify any provision of the Old Option Plan, including without limiting the generality of the foregoing, any amendment for the purpose of curing any ambiguity, error or omission in the Old Option
	Plan or to correct or supplement any provision of the Old Option Plan that is inconsistent with any other provision of the Old Option Plan; (b)&nbsp;suspension or termination of the Old Option Plan;
	(c)&nbsp;amendments to respond to changes in legislation, regulations, instruments (including National Instrument&nbsp;45-106), stock exchange rules (including the rules, regulations and policies
	of the TSX or NASDAQ) or accounting or auditing requirements; (d)&nbsp;amendments respecting administration of the Old Option Plan; (e)&nbsp;any amendment to the definition of "Consultant",
	"Officer", "Director" or "Employee" therein or otherwise relating to the eligibility of any service provider of the Company or a related entity to receive an award under the Old Option Plan;
	(f)&nbsp;changes to the vesting provisions for any outstanding option, except with respect to awards held by any insider; (g)&nbsp;amendments to the termination provisions of the Old Option Plan
	or any outstanding option, provided no such amendment may result in an extension of any outstanding option held by an insider beyond its original expiry date; (h)&nbsp;adjustments to reflect stock
	dividends, stock splits, reverse stock splits, share combinations or other alterations of the capital stock of the Company; (i)&nbsp;amendments to permit options granted under the Old Option Plan to
	be transferable or assignable for estate settlement purposes; (j)&nbsp;amendments necessary to qualify any or all incentive stock options for such favourable federal income tax treatment (including
	deferral of taxation upon exercise) as may be afforded incentive stock options under Section&nbsp;422 of the IRC; and (k)&nbsp;any other amendment, whether fundamental or otherwise, not requiring
	shareholder approval under applicable law (including, without limitation, the rules, regulations and policies of the&nbsp;TSX).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shareholder
	approval is required for the following types of amendments of the Old Option Plan: (i)&nbsp;amendments to the number of common shares issuable under the Old Option Plan,
	including an increase to a maximum percentage of common shares or a change from a maximum percentage of common shares to a fixed maximum number of common shares; (ii)&nbsp;amendments to the
	limitations on grants of options to Non-Executive Directors; (iii)&nbsp;amendments: (A)&nbsp;reducing the exercise price or purchase price of an option (which for such purpose shall include a
	cancellation of outstanding options and contemporaneous re-grant of options having a lower exercise price or purchase price), or (B)&nbsp;extending the term of an option; (iv)&nbsp;amendments to
	permit options to be transferable or assignable other than for estate settlement purposes; (v)&nbsp;amendments to the amendment section of the Old Option Plan; and (vi)&nbsp;amendments required to
	be approved by shareholders under applicable law (including, without limitation, the rules, regulations and policies of the TSX). In the event of any conflict between subsections&nbsp;(a)
	to&nbsp;(k) in the preceding paragraph and subsections&nbsp;(i) to&nbsp;(vi) in this paragraph, subsections&nbsp;(i) to&nbsp;(vi) shall prevail to the extent of the conflict. Further, except
	in certain limited circumstances, in no event may the board alter or impair any rights or increase any obligations with respect to any option previously granted without the consent of
	the&nbsp;optionee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ESPP
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The ESPP was established on July&nbsp;17, 2008 (the&nbsp;"Effective Date") following approval of the ESPP at the Company's 2008
	annual and special meeting of shareholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=66,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=478277,FOLIO='64',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_65">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	ESPP is open for participation to all employees (including directors and officers who are under a permanent full-time or part-time contract of employment with the Company) of the
	Company and any subsidiary subject to certain provisions contained within the&nbsp;ESPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Summary of ESPP
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the ESPP, 500,000&nbsp;common shares (approximately 0.66% of the 75,305,768&nbsp;issued and outstanding common shares
	on the Record Date) are reserved for issuance under the ESPP. All common shares purchased or issued pursuant to the ESPP come from the treasury of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	board has full power and authority to administer the ESPP on behalf of the Company, including the power and authority to delegate the administration of the ESPP to the Compensation
	Committee. The board determines questions of interpretation or application of the ESPP and its decisions are final and binding on all participants. board members receive no additional compensation for
	their services in administering the&nbsp;ESPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligible
	employees become participants in the ESPP by delivering to the Company an election to purchase shares prior to the commencement of the applicable purchase period. Each
	participant contributes to the ESPP, at the participant's option, an amount equal to or between the following minimum and maximum amounts (in&nbsp;whole percentages): a minimum of one percent (1%)
	of the participant's basic compensation, and a maximum of ten percent (10%) of the participant's basic compensation. The contributions are made through payroll deductions at the end of each employee's
	bi-weekly or monthly pay period, as applicable. The Company, as agent of the participant, makes such deductions and pays the participant's contribution to the Administrator (as&nbsp;such term is
	defined in the&nbsp;ESPP).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	the last business day of each month, the Administrator purchases common shares from the Company based on the contributions received from each participant during the preceding month
	(the&nbsp;"Participant Shares"). The purchase price of the Participant Shares is the volume weighted average closing trading price of the common shares on the TSX for the five trading days
	immediately preceding the last business day of such month. The Administrator deposits the Participant Shares into an account in the name of the participant and holds such shares on behalf of such
	participant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company matches a portion of each employee's participation in the ESPP by issuing additional common shares to each participant (through the Administrator). Specifically, on the last
	business day of each month,
	the Company issues to the Administrator that number of common shares (the&nbsp;"Matching Shares") equal to twenty-five percent (25%) of the aggregate number of Participant Shares purchased by the
	Administrator on behalf of the participants for such month for each participant. The Matching Shares are deposited into a trust account by the Administrator on behalf of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Participant Shares purchased on behalf of each participant vest immediately to the benefit of such participant. Subject to provisions in the ESPP relating to a change in control of
	the Company, the Matching Shares vest one year from the date of issuance of such Matching Shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of a change of control of the Company, the board, in its sole discretion (but&nbsp;subject to obtaining the prior approval of the TSX if required by the rules, regulations
	and policies of the TSX) may, without any action or consent of the participants in the ESPP, provide for: (a)&nbsp;the continuation of the vesting period with regard to any unvested Matching Shares;
	(b)&nbsp;the substitution of any unvested Matching Shares for shares of the acquirer; (c)&nbsp;the substitution of any unvested Matching Shares with a cash incentive program of the acquirer;
	(d)&nbsp;the acceleration of the vesting period to a date prior to or on the date of the change of control; (e)&nbsp;the cancellation of all or any portion of any unvested Matching Shares by a
	cash payment and/or other consideration receivable by the holders of any unvested Matching Shares as a result of the change in control equal to the market price of the unvested Matching Shares on the
	date of the change of control; or (f)&nbsp;such other actions or combinations of the foregoing actions as it deems fair and reasonable in the circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Upon
	the termination of employment of any participant for any reason, any unvested Matching Shares held by the Administrator for such participant are forfeited by such participant. A
	participant whose employment is terminated for any reason other than death must withdraw or otherwise transfer all of their Participant Shares and vested Matching Shares in such participant's account
	within ninety (90)&nbsp;days of such termination of employment. The participant may also request that the Administrator sell the Participant Shares and vested
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=67,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=582496,FOLIO='65',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DQ49901A.;12',USER='CMACGOW',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:53' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DQ49901_1_66">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Matching
	Shares in the participant's account and distribute the cash proceeds to the participant. In the event of the death of a participant, the Participant Shares and vested Matching Shares in such
	participant's account are distributed to such participant's estate in accordance with the instructions of such participant's legal representative. Such distribution may take the form of a distribution
	of the cash realized from the sale of such Participant Shares and vested Matching Shares by the Administrator if so requested by the legal representative of the participant's estate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company reserves the right to discontinue use of payroll deductions at any time such action is deemed advisable. The ESPP will terminate on the date which is ten (10)&nbsp;years
	from the Effective Date (as&nbsp;such term is defined in the ESPP), unless earlier terminated by the board. No right or interest of any participant in or under the ESPP may be assigned by such
	participant.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;No
	common shares are issuable under the ESPP at any time to any Insider (as&nbsp;such term is defined in the ESPP) if such issuance, together with all of the Company's previously
	established or proposed Share Compensation Arrangements (as&nbsp;such term is defined in the ESPP), including the ESPP, could result, at any time, in: (i)&nbsp;the number of common shares issued
	to Insiders pursuant to the ESPP, together with all of such other Share Compensation Arrangements, within any one (1)&nbsp;year period exceeding ten percent (10%) of the issued and outstanding
	common shares; or (ii)&nbsp;the number of common shares issuable to Insiders at any time pursuant to the ESPP and all such other Share Compensation Arrangements exceeding ten percent (10%) of the
	issued and outstanding common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Amendments
	to the ESPP generally require the consent of the TSX and the shareholders of the Company given at a duly constituted meeting. However, the following amendments to the ESPP may
	be made by the board without TSX or other stock exchange approval and without shareholder approval: (a)&nbsp;amendments of a technical, clerical or "housekeeping" nature, or to clarify any provision
	of the ESPP, including without limiting the generality of the foregoing, any amendment for the purpose of curing any ambiguity, error or omission in the ESPP or to correct or supplement any provision
	of the ESPP that is inconsistent with any other provision of the ESPP; (b)&nbsp;suspension or termination of the ESPP; (c)&nbsp;amendments to respond to changes in legislation, regulations,
	instruments (including National Instrument&nbsp;45-106), stock exchange rules (including the rules, regulations and policies of the TSX) or accounting or auditing requirements; (d)&nbsp;amendments
	respecting administration of the ESPP; (e)&nbsp;any amendment to the definition of "Employee" in the ESPP; (f)&nbsp;any amendment to the definition of "Subsidiary" in the ESPP and the
	consequential amendments to Appendix&nbsp;"B" of the ESPP; (g)&nbsp;changes to the vesting provisions for any outstanding Unvested Matching Shares (as&nbsp;defined in the ESPP);
	(h)&nbsp;amendments to the participant contribution provisions of the ESPP; (i)&nbsp;amendments to the withdrawal and suspension provisions of the ESPP; (j)&nbsp;amendments to the number or
	percentage of Matching Shares contributed by the Company; (k)&nbsp;amendments to the termination provisions of the ESPP; (l)&nbsp;adjustments to reflect stock dividends, stock splits, reverse
	stock splits, share combinations or other alterations of the capital stock of the Company; and (m)&nbsp;any other amendment, whether fundamental or otherwise, not requiring shareholder approval
	under applicable law (including, without limitation, the rules, regulations and policies of the&nbsp;TSX).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shareholder
	approval will be required for the following types of amendments of the ESPP: (a)&nbsp;amendments to the number of common shares issuable under the ESPP, including an
	increase to the fixed maximum number of common shares or a change from a fixed maximum number of common shares to a fixed maximum percentage; and (b)&nbsp;amendments required to be approved by
	shareholders under applicable law (including, without limitation, the rules, regulations and policies of the&nbsp;TSX).
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_DIRECTORS_AND_OFFICERS>

	knowledge, there is only one person who beneficially owns, directly or indirectly, or

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Related Party Transactions.
<BR>
</B>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company purchased repair services from a network repair company which has a member who serves on both companies' board of
	directors. During the years ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 and 2014 the Company paid a nominal amount and $0.1&nbsp;million respectively, relating to the purchase of services from this repair
	facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;All
	transactions are in the normal course of business and have been recorded at the exchange amount.
</FONT>
</P>

	Instrument&nbsp;51-102&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

	Continuous Disclosure Obligations
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	to disclose such information, has any material
	interest, direct or indirect, in any transaction completed in the three most recently completed financial years or the current financial year that has or is reasonably expected to materially
	affect&nbsp;us.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<A NAME="FIS_FINANCIAL_DATA"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DQ49901_ITEM_8__FINANCIAL_INFORMATION_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DQ49901_7">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;8.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial Information.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DQ49901_A__CONSOLIDATED_FINANCIAL_STAT__A__02647">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DQ49901_8">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Consolidated Financial Statements and Other Financial Information.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;See "Part&nbsp;III&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;18. Financial Statements" for a list of all financial
	statements filed as part of this Annual Report.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Export Sales
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, our sales to end users located outside of Canada amounted to $153.4&nbsp;million, or
	97% of our $157.8&nbsp;million revenues for this&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Legal proceedings
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It is common in our industry to receive notices alleging patent infringement arising in the normal course of business. We have set up
	internal procedures to deal with such notices, which include assessing the merits of each notice and seeking, where appropriate, a business resolution. Where a business resolution cannot be reached,
	litigation may be necessary. The ultimate outcome of any litigation is uncertain, and regardless of outcome, litigation can have an adverse impact on our business because of defense costs, negative
	publicity, diversion of management resources and other factors. Our failure to obtain any necessary license or other rights on commercially reasonable terms or litigation arising out of intellectual
	property claims could materially adversely affect our business. For the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 and as of the date of this Annual Report, we are not party to any litigation that we
	believe is material to our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We currently intend to retain any future earnings to fund the development and growth of our business and do not anticipate paying any
	cash dividends in the foreseeable future. Any future determination to pay dividends will be at the discretion of our board of directors and will depend upon many factors, including our results of
	operations, capital requirements and other factors that our board of directors deems relevant. There are no restrictions in our articles preventing us from declaring dividends or paying dividends to
	our shareholders. However, our debt facilities with Comerica Bank and Export Development Canada contain covenants restricting our ability to make payments of dividends on our common shares. We have
	not paid any dividends during our last three financial years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;9.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Offer and Listing.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Trading Price and Volume
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our common shares are publicly traded on the TSX under the symbol "DWI". Trading of the common shares on the TSX commenced with the
	closing of our initial public offering on April&nbsp;19, 2007. Our common shares are also traded on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol "DRWI". Trading of our common shares on NASDAQ
	commenced on October&nbsp;15,&nbsp;2009.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's warrants issued from the public issuance on August&nbsp;1, 2014 are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol DWI.WT and on the NASDAQ Global Market under the
	symbol&nbsp;DRWIW.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	ranges of our common shares on the TSX and NASDAQ for the annual high and low market prices during the five most recent full financial years ended February&nbsp;28/29 are
	as&nbsp;follows:
