<EFX_ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION>
<A NAME="FIS_ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_ITEM_10__ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;10.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Additional Information.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_A__SHARE_CAPITAL_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Share Capital.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Not applicable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_B__MEMORANDUM_AND_ARTICLES_OF_ASSOCIATION">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Memorandum and Articles of Association
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Articles of Incorporation and By-laws
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's Articles of Incorporation are on file with Corporations Canada under Corporation Number&nbsp;351766-7. Our Articles of
	Incorporation and by-laws do not include a stated purpose and do not place any restrictions on the business that the Company may carry&nbsp;on.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Directors
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A director of our Company need not be a shareholder. In accordance with our by-laws and the CBCA, at least 25% of our directors must be
	residents of Canada. In order to serve as a director, a person must be a natural person at least 18&nbsp;years of age, of sound mind and not bankrupt. Neither our Articles of Incorporation or
	by-laws, nor the CBCA, impose any mandatory retirement requirements for&nbsp;directors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	by-laws and the CBCA authorize the directors from time to time to determine the remuneration for their services. There is no requirement for an independent quorum.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	director who is a party to, or who is a director or officer of or has a material interest in any person who is a party to, a material contract or transaction or proposed material
	contract or transaction with our Company must disclose to the Company the nature and extent of his or her interest at the time and in the manner provided by the CBCA The CBCA prohibits such a director
	from voting on any resolution to approve the contract or transaction unless the contract or&nbsp;transaction:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	relates primarily to his or her remuneration as a director, officer, employee or agent of the Company or
	an&nbsp;affiliate;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is for indemnity or insurance for director's liability as permitted by the CBCA;&nbsp;or
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	is with an affiliate.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	board of directors may, on behalf of the Company and without authorization of our shareholders:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	borrow money upon the credit of the Company;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	issue, reissue, sell or pledge debt obligations of the Company;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	give a guarantee on behalf of the Company to secure performance of an obligation of any person;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=71,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=580431,FOLIO='69',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_70">
</A>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	mortgage, hypothecate, pledge or otherwise create a security interest in all or any property of the Company, owned or
	subsequently acquired, to secure any obligation of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These
	borrowing powers may be varied by the Company's by-laws or its Articles of Incorporation. However, our by-laws and Articles of Incorporation do not contain any restrictions on or
	variations of these borrowing powers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Common Shares
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our Articles of Incorporation authorize the issuance of an unlimited number of common shares. They do not authorize the issuance of any
	other class of&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	holders of the common shares of our Company are entitled to receive notice of and to attend all meetings of the shareholders of our Company and have one vote for each common share
	held at all meetings of the shareholders of our Company. Our directors are elected at each annual meeting of shareholders and do not stand for re-election at staggered intervals.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company may from time to time pay dividends on the issued and outstanding common shares in the capital of the Company, as and when declared by our board of directors, from any assets
	properly applicable to the payment of dividends. The Company may pay a dividend by issuing fully paid common shares of the Company and, subject to the foregoing, the Company may pay a dividend in
	money or property. The board of directors shall not declare and the Company shall not pay a dividend if there are reasonable grounds for believing that: (a)&nbsp;the Company is, or would after the
	payment be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or (b)&nbsp;the realizable value of the Company's assets would thereby be less than the aggregate of its liabilities and stated capital
	of all classes of&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the event of the liquidation, dissolution or winding-up of the Company or other distribution of assets of the Company among shareholders for the purpose of winding-up its affairs,
	subject to the prior rights of any other class of shares ranking senior to the common shares, the holders of common shares shall be entitled to receive the remaining assets of the Company. The Company
	has not issued any shares which rank senior to the common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	are no redemption provisions and no liability for further capital calls associated with the Company's common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Actions Necessary to Change Rights of Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to change the rights of our shareholders, we would need to amend our Articles of Incorporation to effect the change. Such an
	amendment would require the affirmative vote of holders of two-thirds of the shares cast at a duly called special meeting of shareholders. For certain amendments such as those creating of a class of
	preferred shares, a shareholder is entitled to dissent in respect of such a resolution amending our articles and, if the resolution is adopted and the Company implements such changes, demand payment
	of the fair value of its&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Meetings of Shareholders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;An annual meeting of shareholders is held each year for the purpose of considering the financial statements and reports, electing
	directors, appointing auditors and for the transaction of other business as may be brought before the meeting. The board of directors has the power to call a special meeting of shareholders at any
	time. A quorum at any meeting of shareholders shall be persons present not being less than two in number and holding or representing more than twenty-five percent (25%) of the total number of issued
	and outstanding common shares of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Notice
	of the time and place of each meeting of shareholders must be given not less than 21&nbsp;days, nor more than 60&nbsp;days, before the date of each meeting to each director,
	to the auditor and to each shareholder who at the close of business on the record date for notice is entered in the securities register as the holder of one or more shares carrying the right to vote
	at the meeting. Notice of meeting of shareholders called for any other purpose other than consideration of the minutes of an earlier meeting, financial statements and auditor's report, election
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=72,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=671916,FOLIO='70',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_71">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	of
	directors and reappointment of the incumbent auditor, must state the nature of the business in sufficient detail to permit the shareholder to form&nbsp;a reasoned judgment on and must state the
	text of any special resolution or by-law to be submitted to the&nbsp;meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	only persons entitled to be present at a meeting of shareholders are those entitled to vote, the directors of the Company and the auditor of the Company. Any other person may be
	admitted only on the invitation of the chairman of the meeting or with the consent of the meeting. In circumstances where a court orders a meeting of shareholders, the court may direct how the meeting
	may be held, including who may attend the&nbsp;meeting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Limitations on Right to Own Securities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There is no limitation imposed by the laws of Canada or by the by-laws or Articles of Incorporation of the Company on the right of a
	non-resident to hold or vote the common shares, other than as provided in the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Investment Canada Act
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. The
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Investment Canada
	Act
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	may require review and approval by the Minister of Industry (Canada) of certain acquisitions of "control" of the Company by a "non-Canadian". The threshold for acquisitions
	of control is generally defined as being one-third or more of the voting shares of the Company. "Non-Canadian" generally means an individual who is not a Canadian citizen, or a corporation,
	partnership, trust or joint venture that is ultimately controlled by non-Canadian.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Change of Control
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no provisions in our by-laws or Articles of Incorporation that would have an effect of delaying, deferring or preventing a
	change in control of the Company and that would operate only with respect to a merger, acquisition or corporate restructuring involving the Company. Our by-laws do not contain a provision governing
	the ownership threshold above which shareholder ownership must be&nbsp;disclosed.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_C__MATERIAL_CONTRACTS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_5">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	C.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Material Contracts
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Original Master Acquisition Agreement is a material contract which was entered into in the financial year ended February&nbsp;29,
	2012, and, as noted above, this agreement has been superseded and replaced by the Amended and Restated Master Acquisition Agreement, particulars of which are set out above under
	"Part&nbsp;I&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Item&nbsp;4.&nbsp;Information on the Company&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;A.&nbsp;History&nbsp;&amp; Business
	Developments&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Mergers&nbsp;&amp; Acquisitions and Joint Ventures".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	are no other material contracts which were entered into in the financial year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, or before the financial year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 which are
	still in effect as of the date of this Annual Report, other than those not required to be disclosed under applicable securities&nbsp;laws.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_D__EXCHANGE_CONTROLS_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_6">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	D.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Exchange Controls.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There are no governmental laws, decrees, regulations or other legislation, including foreign exchange controls, in Canada which may
	affect the export or import of capital or that may affect the remittance of dividends, interest or other payments to non-resident holders of the Company's securities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_E__TAXATION_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_7">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	E.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Taxation.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CERTAIN CANADIAN FEDERAL INCOME TAX CONSIDERATIONS FOR NON-RESIDENTS OF CANADA
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following summary describes the principal Canadian federal income tax considerations generally applicable to a purchaser who
	acquires, as a beneficial owner, common shares and who, at all relevant times, for the purposes of the application of the
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Income Tax&nbsp;Act
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(Canada)
	(the&nbsp;"Tax&nbsp;Act") and the regulations thereunder, (1)&nbsp;is not, and is not deemed to be, resident in Canada; (2)&nbsp;does not use or hold, and is not deemed to use or hold, the
	common shares in a business carried on in Canada; (3)&nbsp;deals at arm's length with us; (4)&nbsp;is not affiliated with us or a subsequent purchaser of the common shares; and (5)&nbsp;holds
	the common shares as capital property (a&nbsp;"Non-Resident Holder"). Generally, the common shares will be capital property to a Non-Resident Holder provided the Non-Resident Holder does not acquire
	or hold those common shares in the course of carrying on a business or as part of an adventure or concern in the nature of&nbsp;trade.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	71
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=73,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=555590,FOLIO='71',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_72">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Special
	rules, which are not discussed in this summary, may apply to a Non-Resident Holder that is an insurer that carries on an insurance business in Canada and&nbsp;elsewhere.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	summary is based on the current provisions of the Tax&nbsp;Act, and counsel's understanding of the current administrative policies and assessing practices of the Canada Revenue
	Agency ("CRA") published in writing prior to the date hereof. This summary takes into account all specific proposals to amend the Tax&nbsp;Act publicly announced by or on behalf of the Minister of
	Finance (Canada) prior to the date hereof (the&nbsp;"Proposed Amendments") and assumes that all Proposed Amendments will be enacted in the form proposed. However, no assurances can be given that the
	Proposed Amendments will be enacted as proposed, or at all. This summary does not otherwise take into account or anticipate any changes in law or administrative policy or assessing practice whether by
	legislative, regulatory, administrative or judicial action nor does it take into account tax legislation or considerations of any province, territory or foreign jurisdiction, which may differ from
	those discussed herein.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	summary is of a general nature only and is not, and is not intended to be, legal or tax advice to A Non-Resident Holder. This summary is not exhaustive of all Canadian federal
	income tax considerations.
	Accordingly, Non-Resident Holders should consult their own tax advisors with respect to their particular circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Currency Conversion
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, for purposes of the Tax&nbsp;Act, all amounts relating to the acquisition, holding or disposition of the common shares
	must be converted into Canadian dollars based on the exchange rates as determined in accordance with the Tax&nbsp;Act. The amount of dividends required to be included in the income of, and capital
	gains or capital losses realized by, a Non-Resident Holder may be affected by fluctuations in exchange&nbsp;rates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dividends
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividends paid or credited or deemed to be paid or credited to a Non-Resident Holder by us will be subject to Canadian withholding tax
	at the rate of 25&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent of the gross amount of the dividend, subject to any reduction in the rate of withholding to which the Non-Resident Holder is entitled under any applicable
	income tax convention between Canada and the country in which the Non-Resident Holder is resident. For example, where the Non-Resident Holder is a U.S.&nbsp;resident entitled to benefits under the
	Canada-U.S.&nbsp;Income Tax Convention (1980) and is the beneficial owner of the dividends, the applicable rate of Canadian withholding tax is generally reduced to 15&nbsp;per&nbsp;cent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Dispositions
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Non-Resident Holder will not be subject to tax under the Tax&nbsp;Act on any capital gain realized on a disposition or deemed
	disposition of our common shares, unless the common share is or is deemed to be "taxable Canadian property" to the Non-Resident Holder for the purposes of the Tax&nbsp;Act and the Non-Resident
	Holder is not entitled to relief under an applicable income tax convention between Canada and the country in which the Non-Resident Holder is&nbsp;resident.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally,
	provided the common shares are listed on a "designated stock exchange" as (defined in the Tax&nbsp;Act) (which includes the TSX and NASDAQ) at the time of disposition, the
	common shares will not constitute taxable Canadian property of a Non-Resident Holder, unless at any time during the 60-month period immediately preceding the disposition:(i)(a) the Non-Resident
	Holder, (b)&nbsp;persons with whom the Non-Resident Holder did not deal at arm's length, (c)&nbsp;partnerships in which the Non-Resident Holder or a person described in (b)&nbsp;holds a
	membership interest directly or indirectly through one or more partnerships, or (d)&nbsp;the Non-Resident Holder together with such persons, owned 25% or more of our common shares, and
	(ii)&nbsp;more than 50% of the fair market value of the common shares was derived directly or indirectly from one
	or any combination of: (a)&nbsp;real or immovable property situated in Canada, (b)&nbsp;"Canadian resources properties" (as&nbsp;defined in the Tax&nbsp;Act), (c)&nbsp;"timber resource
	properties" (as&nbsp;defined in the Tax&nbsp;Act), and (d)&nbsp;options in respect of, or interests in or for civil law rights in, property described in (a)&nbsp;to (c), whether or not such
	property exists. Notwithstanding the foregoing, our common shares may otherwise be deemed to be taxable Canadian
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	72
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_73">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	property
	to a Non-Resident Holder for purposes of the Tax&nbsp;Act. Non-Resident Holders whose common shares constitute taxable Canadian property should consult with their own tax&nbsp;advisors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CERTAIN UNITED STATES FEDERAL INCOME TAX CONSIDERATIONS FOR U.S.&nbsp;HOLDERS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This section describes the material United&nbsp;States federal income tax considerations of the acquisition, ownership and
	disposition of our common shares. This summary addresses only persons or entities that are "U.S.&nbsp;holders" (as&nbsp;defined below). This summary is for general information purposes only and
	does not purport to be a complete analysis or listing of all potential U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax consequences that may apply to a U.S.&nbsp;holder arising from or relating to the acquisition,
	ownership, and disposition of our common shares. In addition, this summary does not take into account the individual facts and circumstances of any particular U.S.&nbsp;holder that may affect the
	U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax consequences to such U.S.&nbsp;holder. Accordingly, this summary is not intended to be, and should not be construed as, legal or U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax advice
	with respect to any U.S.&nbsp;holder. This summary does not address the U.S.&nbsp;state and local, U.S.&nbsp;federal estate and gift, or foreign tax consequences or the alternative minimum tax
	provisions of the Code (as&nbsp;defined below). Each U.S.&nbsp;holder should consult its own financial advisor, legal counsel, or accountant regarding the U.S.&nbsp;federal income,
	U.S.&nbsp;state and local, and foreign tax consequences arising from and relating to the acquisition, ownership, and disposition of common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	section does not apply to you if you are a member of a class of holders subject to special rules, including, but not
	limited&nbsp;to:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that are tax-exempt organizations, qualified retirement plans, individual retirement accounts, or
	other tax-deferred accounts;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that are financial institutions, insurance companies, real estate investment trusts, or regulated
	investment companies;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that are dealers in securities or currencies or U.S.&nbsp;holders that are traders in securities
	that elect to apply a mark-to-market accounting method;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that have a "functional currency" other than the U.S.&nbsp;dollar;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that own common shares as part of a straddle, hedging transaction, conversion transaction,
	constructive sale, or other arrangement involving more than one&nbsp;position;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders who use common shares as security for a loan;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that acquired common shares in connection with the exercise of employee stock options or otherwise as
	compensation for&nbsp;services;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that hold common shares other than as capital assets within the meaning of Section&nbsp;1221 of
	the&nbsp;Code;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;expatriates or former residents of the U.S.; and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders that own (directly, indirectly, or by attribution) 10% or more of the total combined voting power of
	our outstanding shares.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	section is based on the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the&nbsp;"Code"), its legislative history, existing and proposed regulations under the Code, published rulings
	and court decisions, the Convention Between Canada and the United&nbsp;States of America with Respect to Taxes on Income and on Capital, signed
	September&nbsp;26, 1980, as amended (the&nbsp;"Canada-U.S.&nbsp;Tax Convention"), all as in effect on the date hereof, and all of which are subject to change, possibly with retroactive effect.
	This summary does not discuss the potential effects, whether adverse or beneficial, of any proposed legislation that, if enacted, could be applied on a retroactive basis.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
	summary is not binding upon the Internal Revenue Service (the&nbsp;"IRS") and no rulings have been or will be sought from the IRS regarding any matters discussed in this summary.
	In that regard, there can be no assurance that one or more of the tax considerations described in this summary will not be challenged by the IRS or a U.S.&nbsp;court.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	73
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=75,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=440035,FOLIO='73',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_74">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	a partnership (or&nbsp;other entity or arrangement treated as a partnership for United&nbsp;States federal income tax purposes) holds our common shares, the United&nbsp;States
	federal income tax treatment of a partner (or&nbsp;member) will generally depend on the status of the partner and the tax treatment of the partnership (or&nbsp;other entity). A partner in a
	partnership (or&nbsp;member of such other entity) holding our common shares should consult its tax advisor with regard to the U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax treatment of an investment in our
	common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You
	are a U.S.&nbsp;holder if you are a beneficial owner of a common share and you&nbsp;are:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an individual who is a citizen or resident (including a lawful permanent resident alien holding a green card) of the
	United&nbsp;States as determined for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax&nbsp;purposes;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a corporation (or&nbsp;other entity treated as a corporation for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes) created or
	organized in or under the laws of the United&nbsp;States or any state thereof or the District of&nbsp;Columbia;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	an estate whose income is subject to U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax regardless of its source;&nbsp;or
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a trust if it (1)&nbsp;is subject to the primary supervision of a federal, state or local court within the
	United&nbsp;States and one or more United&nbsp;States persons are authorized to control all substantial decisions of the trust or (2)&nbsp;has a valid election in effect under applicable
	Treasury Regulations to be treated as a U.S.&nbsp;person.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	United&nbsp;States federal income tax consequences of the acquisition, ownership and disposition of our common shares can be very complex and, in certain cases, uncertain or
	potentially unfavorable to a U.S.&nbsp;holder. Accordingly, each prospective investor considering an acquisition of, or who acquires common shares is strongly urged to consult its own tax advisor
	with respect to the United&nbsp;States federal, state or local income and alternative minimum tax, United&nbsp;States federal estate or gift, or foreign tax consequences of such acquisition,
	ownership and disposition of common shares in light of its own particular facts and circumstances.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	U.S.&nbsp;Holders
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Taxation of Distributions
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax laws, and subject to the passive foreign investment company ("PFIC") rules discussed below, if
	you are a U.S.&nbsp;holder, a distribution of cash, if any, paid on a common share, including a constructive distribution, generally will be included in your gross income as a dividend (without
	reduction for any amounts withheld in respect of Canadian federal income tax) to the extent of our current or accumulated "earnings and profits" (as&nbsp;computed under United&nbsp;States federal
	income tax&nbsp;rules).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	you are a non-corporate U.S.&nbsp;holder, dividends paid to you that constitute qualified dividend income will be taxable to you at a maximum tax rate of 23.8% (including the 3.8%
	tax on net investment income discussed below) provided that you hold our common shares for more than 60&nbsp;days during the 121-day period beginning 60&nbsp;days before the ex-dividend date and
	meet other holding period requirements. Dividends we pay with respect to our common shares should be qualified dividend income provided that we are not a PFIC in the year the dividend is paid or the
	previous taxable&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You
	must include any Canadian tax withheld from the dividend payment in this gross amount even though you do not in fact receive the withheld amount. The dividend is taxable to you when
	you receive the dividend, actually or constructively. The dividend will not be eligible for the dividends-received deduction generally allowed to U.S.&nbsp;corporations in respect of dividends
	received from other U.S.&nbsp;corporations. The amount of the dividend distribution that you must include in your income as a U.S.&nbsp;holder will be the U.S.&nbsp;dollar value of the Canadian
	dollar payments made, determined at the spot Canadian dollar/U.S.&nbsp;dollar
	rate on the date the dividend distribution is includible in your income, regardless of whether the payment is in fact converted into U.S.&nbsp;dollars. Generally, any gain or loss resulting from
	currency exchange fluctuations during the period from the date you include the dividend payment in income to the date you convert the payment into U.S.&nbsp;dollars will be treated as ordinary
	income or loss. The gain or loss generally will be income or loss from sources within the United&nbsp;States for foreign tax credit limitation purposes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	74
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=76,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=479070,FOLIO='74',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_75">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To
	the extent that a distribution paid on our common shares is in excess of our current and accumulated "earnings and profits" (as&nbsp;determined for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax
	purposes), such distribution generally will be treated as a non-taxable return of capital to the extent of your adjusted tax basis in our common shares, with any excess treated as a gain from the sale
	or exchange of the&nbsp;Shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	U.S.&nbsp;holder that pays (whether directly or through withholding) Canadian income tax with respect to distributions by us generally will be entitled, at the election of such
	U.S.&nbsp;holder, to receive either a deduction or a credit for such Canadian income tax paid. Complex limitations apply to the foreign tax credit, including the general limitation that the credit
	cannot exceed the proportionate share of a U.S.&nbsp;holder's U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax liability that such U.S.&nbsp;holder's "foreign source" taxable income bears to such
	U.S.&nbsp;holder's worldwide taxable income. In applying this limitation, a U.S.&nbsp;holder's various items of income and deduction must be classified, under complex rules, as either "foreign
	source" or "U.S.&nbsp;source." Special rules apply in determining the foreign tax credit limitation with respect to dividends that are subject to the maximum 20% tax&nbsp;rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
	foreign tax credit purposes, dividends will be income from sources outside the United&nbsp;States and will, depending on your circumstances, be either "passive category" or
	"general category" income for purposes of computing the foreign tax credit allowable to you. However, the amount of a distribution with respect to our common shares that is treated as a "dividend" may
	be lower for U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax purposes than it is for Canadian federal income tax purposes, potentially resulting in a reduced foreign tax credit allowance to a U.S.&nbsp;holder. The
	foreign tax credit rules are complex, and each U.S.&nbsp;holder should consult its own U.S.&nbsp;tax advisor regarding the foreign tax credit&nbsp;rules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Taxation of Sale, Exchange or other Taxable Disposition
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject to the PFIC rules discussed below, if you are a U.S.&nbsp;holder and you sell or otherwise dispose of your common shares, you
	will recognize gain or loss for United&nbsp;States federal income tax purposes equal to the difference between the United&nbsp;States dollar value of the amount that you realize and your tax
	basis, determined in United&nbsp;States dollars, in your common shares. Any such gain or loss will be capital gain or loss if our common shares are held by you as capital assets. Any such gain or
	loss generally will be United&nbsp;States source income or loss for purposes of applying the United&nbsp;States foreign tax credit rules unless the gain is subject to tax in Canada and is
	re-sourced as "foreign source" under the Convention and
	such U.S.&nbsp;holder elects to treat such gain as "foreign source." Capital gain of a non-corporate U.S.&nbsp;holder is generally taxed at a maximum rate of 23.8% (including the 3.8% tax on net
	investment income discussed below) where the U.S.&nbsp;holder has a holding period greater than one year. Deductions for capital losses are subject to&nbsp;limitations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	PFIC Rules
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If we are considered to be a PFIC, as that term is defined in Section&nbsp;1297 of the Code, at any time during a
	U.S.&nbsp;holder's holding period, the following sections will generally describe the United&nbsp;States federal income tax consequences to a U.S.&nbsp;holder in relation to the acquisition,
	ownership and disposition of common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	generally will be regarded as a PFIC for United&nbsp;States federal income tax purposes if, for a taxable year, either (i)&nbsp;75% or more of our gross income for such taxable
	year is passive income or (ii)&nbsp;on the basis of a quarterly average, 50% or more of the assets held by us either produce passive income or are held for the production of passive income, based on
	the fair market value of such assets. "Passive income" includes, for example, dividends, interest, certain rents and royalties, certain gains from the sale of stock and securities, and certain gains
	from commodities transactions. If a foreign corporation (such as DragonWave) owns, directly or indirectly, at least 25% by value of the stock of another corporation, the foreign corporation is treated
	for purposes of the PFIC tests described above as owning its proportionate share of the assets of the other corporation, and as receiving directly its proportionate share of the other corporation's
	income. In addition, under certain attribution rules, if we are a PFIC, U.S.&nbsp;holders will be deemed to own their proportionate share of the our subsidiaries which are PFICs (such subsidiaries
	referred to as "Subsidiary PFICs"), and will be subject to U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax on (i)&nbsp;a distribution on the shares of a Subsidiary PFIC and (ii)&nbsp;a disposition of shares of a
	Subsidiary PFIC, both as if the holder directly held the shares of such Subsidiary&nbsp;PFIC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	75
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=77,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=217002,FOLIO='75',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_76">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;PFIC
	classification is fundamentally factual in nature, generally cannot be determined until the close of the taxable year in question, and is determined annually. Consequently, there
	can be no assurance that we have never been and will not become a PFIC for any taxable year during which U.S.&nbsp;holders hold common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	any given taxable year for which we are classified as a PFIC, during which a U.S.&nbsp;holder holds common shares, a U.S.&nbsp;holder would be subject to increased tax liability
	(possibly including a non-deductible interest charge) upon the sale or other disposition of our common shares or upon the receipt of certain distributions treated as "excess distributions," unless
	such U.S.&nbsp;holder elects to be taxed currently, by making a Mark-to-Market or a Qualified Electing Fund ("QEF") Election. An excess distribution generally would be any distribution to a
	U.S.&nbsp;holder with respect to common shares during a single taxable year over 125% of the average annual distributions received by such U.S.&nbsp;holder with respect to our common shares during
	the
	three preceding taxable years or, if shorter, during such U.S.&nbsp;holder's holding period for our common shares. In addition, certain special, generally adverse rules would apply to our common
	shares if we are a PFIC. For example, under certain proposed Treasury regulations, a "disposition" for this purpose may include, under certain circumstances, transfers at death, gifts, pledges,
	transfers pursuant to tax-deferred reorganizations and other transactions with respect to which gain ordinarily would not be recognized. In addition, if we are treated as a PFIC, dividends paid by us
	will not be eligible for taxation at the preferential tax rates described above under the heading "Taxation of Distributions".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	a U.S.&nbsp;holder owns our common shares during any year in which we are a PFIC, such U.S.&nbsp;holder must also file IRS Form&nbsp;8621 regardless of whether such holder makes
	a Mark-to-Market or QEF&nbsp;Election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the PFIC rules:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the gain or excess distribution will be allocated ratably over the applicable holding period for your
	common&nbsp;shares;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the amount allocated to the taxable year in which you realized the gain or excess distribution will be taxed as ordinary
	income;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the amount allocated to each prior year, with certain exceptions, will be taxed at the highest tax rate in effect for that
	year;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the interest charge generally applicable to underpayments of tax will be imposed in respect of the tax attributable to
	each such year. A U.S.&nbsp;holder that is not a corporation must treat such interest as non-deductible personal interest.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	we were a PFIC, a U.S.&nbsp;holder might be able to make a Mark-to-Market Election with respect to our common shares to mitigate some of these adverse tax consequences. A
	U.S.&nbsp;holder that holds stock of a PFIC generally may make a Mark-to-Market Election with respect to its stock if the stock constitutes "marketable stock". Marketable stock is stock that is
	regularly traded (other than in de minimis quantities) on a U.S. or non-U.S.&nbsp;exchange or other market that the U.S.&nbsp;Treasury Department determines has trading, listing, financial
	disclosure, and other rules adequate to carry out the purposes of the Mark-to-Market Election. The common shares should constitute marketable stock with respect to which a Mark-to-Market Election
	could be made. In such case, a U.S.&nbsp;holder would generally include as ordinary income or loss the difference between the fair market value of our common shares at the end of the taxable year
	and the adjusted tax basis of our common shares (but&nbsp;loss could only be included to the extent of the net amount of previously included income as a result of the Mark-to-Market Election). If a
	U.S.&nbsp;holder made the election, the U.S.&nbsp;holder's tax basis in our common shares would be adjusted to reflect any such income or loss amounts.
	Any gain recognized on the sale or other disposition of common shares would be treated as ordinary income. A U.S.&nbsp;holder should consult their own tax advisors regarding the availability and
	advisability of making a Mark-to-Market Election with respect to our common shares in their particular circumstances in the event the Company is or becomes a PFIC. A Mark-to-Market Election would not
	be available for any Subsidiary&nbsp;PFIC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	QEF Election, if available, generally would allow a U.S.&nbsp;holder to avoid the consequences of the PFIC rules but would require such holder to include its pro&nbsp;rata share
	of the Company's ordinary income and net capital gain in income currently, whether or not distributed. However, the Company does not intend to provide
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	76
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=78,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=322224,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_77">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	U.S.&nbsp;holders
	with such information as may be required to make a QEF Election effective in the event it is a&nbsp;PFIC.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	The PFIC rules are complex and in certain cases, uncertain. Each U.S.&nbsp;holder is strongly urged to consult its tax advisor regarding application and
	operation of the PFIC rules, including the availability and advisability of, and procedure for, making the Mark-to-Market and/or QEF&nbsp;Elections.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Additional Tax on Passive Income
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Certain individuals, estates and trusts whose income exceeds certain thresholds will be required to pay a 3.8% Medicare surtax on "net
	investment income" including, among other things, dividends and net gain from disposition of property (other than property held in certain trades or businesses). U.S.&nbsp;holders should consult
	their own tax advisors regarding the effect, if any, of this tax on their ownership and disposition of common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Withholding Requirements Relating to Foreign Accounts
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Withholding taxes may apply to certain types of payments made to "foreign financial institutions" (as&nbsp;specially defined under
	applicable rules) and certain other non-U.S.&nbsp;entities. Specifically, a 30% withholding tax may be imposed on dividends on, and gross proceeds from the sale or other disposition of, common
	shares paid to a foreign financial institution or to a foreign non-financial foreign entity, unless (1)&nbsp;the foreign financial institution undertakes certain diligence and reporting,
	(2)&nbsp;the
	non-financial foreign entity either certifies it does not have any substantial United&nbsp;States owners or furnishes identifying information regarding each substantial United&nbsp;States owner,
	or (3)&nbsp;the foreign financial institution or non-financial foreign entity otherwise qualifies for an exemption from these rules. If the payee is a foreign financial institution and is subject to
	the diligence and reporting requirements in clause&nbsp;(1) above, it must enter into an agreement with the United&nbsp;States Treasury requiring, among other things, that it undertake to identify
	accounts held by certain United&nbsp;States persons or United&nbsp;States-owned foreign entities, annually report certain information about such accounts, and withhold 30% on payments to
	non-compliant foreign financial institutions and certain other account holders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	IRS has issued administrative guidance providing that the withholding provisions described above will generally apply to payments of dividends on common shares made on or after
	July&nbsp;1, 2014, and to payments of gross proceeds from a sale or other disposition of such shares on or after January&nbsp;1, 2017. U.S.&nbsp;holders should consult their tax advisors
	regarding these withholding provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Backup Withholding and Information Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under U.S.&nbsp;federal income tax law and Treasury regulations, certain categories of U.S.&nbsp;holders must file information
	returns with respect to their investment in, or involvement in, a foreign corporation. Penalties for failure to file certain of these information returns are substantial. U.S.&nbsp;holders who
	acquire or hold common shares should consult with their own tax advisors regarding the requirements of filing information returns, and if applicable, any Mark-to-Market Election or
	QEF&nbsp;Election.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If
	the holder is a non-corporate U.S.&nbsp;holder, then payments to it made within the United&nbsp;States, or by a United&nbsp;States payor or United&nbsp;States middleman, of
	dividends on or proceeds arising from the sale or other taxable disposition of common shares, and/or proceeds arising from the sale or other taxable disposition of common shares, generally will be
	subject to information reporting and backup withholding (currently at the rate of 28%), where such U.S.&nbsp;holder fails to furnish its correct United&nbsp;States taxpayer identification number
	(generally on IRS Form&nbsp;W-9), and to&nbsp;make certain certifications, or otherwise fails to establish an exemption from backup withholding. Any amounts withheld under the backup withholding
	rules from a payment to a U.S.&nbsp;holder generally may be refunded (or&nbsp;credited against its United&nbsp;States federal income tax liability, if any) provided the required information is
	furnished to the IRS in a timely manner. Each U.S.&nbsp;holder should consult its own tax advisor regarding the backup withholding&nbsp;tax.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_8">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	F.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Dividends and Paying Agents.
<BR>

</EFX_ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION>
<EFX_MARKET_RISK>
<A NAME="FIS_MARKET_RISK"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DS49901_ITEM_11__QUANTITATIVE_AND_QUAL__ITE02596">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DS49901_12">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;11.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Quantitative and&nbsp;Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosure About Market Risk
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Interest rate risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash, cash equivalents and our debt facility, which has interest rates with market rate fluctuations, expose us to interest rate risk
	on these financial instruments. Net interest expense, excluding deferred financing costs, recognized during the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 was $0.4&nbsp;million and
	$1.4&nbsp;million on our cash, cash equivalents and debt facility (three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;expense of $0.3&nbsp;million and
	$1.0&nbsp;million respectively).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Credit risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to trade receivables and other receivables, we are exposed to credit risk on our cash and cash equivalents in the event
	that our counterparties do not meet their obligations. We do not use credit derivatives or similar instruments to mitigate this risk and, as such, the maximum exposure is the full carrying value or
	fair value of the financial instrument. We minimize credit risk on cash and cash equivalents by transacting with only reputable financial institutions and&nbsp;customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Foreign exchange risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign exchange risk arises because of fluctuations in exchange rates. To mitigate exchange risk, we may utilize forward contracts to
	secure exchange rates with the objective of offsetting fluctuations in our operating expenses incurred in foreign currencies with gains or losses on the forward contracts. We had no forward contracts
	in place at February&nbsp;28, 2015 (February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;$1.2&nbsp;million). All foreign currency gains and losses related to forward contracts are
	included in foreign exchange gain (loss) in the consolidated statements of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of February&nbsp;28, 2015, if the US dollar had appreciated 1% against all foreign currencies, with all other variables held constant, the impact of this foreign currency change on
	our foreign denominated financial instruments would have resulted in a nominal decrease in after-tax net loss for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 (three and twelve months
	ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;decrease of $0.1&nbsp;million) with an
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	78
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=80,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=440032,FOLIO='78',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DS49901A.;16',USER='IMORTON',CD='26-MAY-2015;19:26' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DS49901_1_79">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	equal
	and opposite effect if the US dollar had depreciated 1% against all foreign currencies at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_MARKET_RISK>

<EFX_MATERIAL_MODIFICATIONS>
<A NAME="FIS_MATERIAL_MODIFICATIONS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_ITEM_14__MATERIAL_MODIFICATION__ITE03266">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_3">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;14.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Material Modifications to the Rights of Security Holders and Use of&nbsp;Proceeds.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	A.
</B>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Not applicable.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	B.
</B>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Not applicable.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	C.
</B>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Not applicable.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	D.
</B>
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Not applicable.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_E__USE_OF_PROCEEDS">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_4">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	E.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Use of Proceeds
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2014 Offering
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2014 we completed the&nbsp;2014 Offering. Under the terms of the 2014 Offering, we issued and sold 15,927,500
	2014 Units at CAD$1.80 per 2014 Unit for aggregate gross proceeds of $26.2&nbsp;million (CAD$28.7&nbsp;million). After deducting commissions and expenses, we realized net proceeds of
	$24.0&nbsp;million. Each 2014 Unit consisted of one common share of the Company and one half of one 2014 Warrant. Each whole 2014 Warrant originally entitled the holder to purchase one of our common
	shares at an exercise price of CAD$2.25 per share until August&nbsp;1, 2016. Upon issuance, we recognized a liability in the amount of $2.6&nbsp;million for the&nbsp;2014 Warrants. The shelf
	registration statement was declared effective on August&nbsp;29, 2013. The file number is 333-190674. The 2014 Offering had CIBC acting as the sole book-runner for the offering and H.C. Wainwright &amp;
	Co., LLC acting as lead manager (together, the "underwriters").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	2013 Offering
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September&nbsp;23, 2013, pursuant to the 2013 Offering, we issued 11,910,000&nbsp;common shares and 8,932,500&nbsp;2013
	Warrants for proceeds, before deducting fees and expenses, of approximately $25.0&nbsp;million. After deducting fees and expenses, we realized net proceeds of $22.4&nbsp;million. The
	2013&nbsp;Units were offered at a price of $2.10 per 2013&nbsp;Unit. Each 2013&nbsp;Unit consisted of one common share and three quarters of one 2013&nbsp;Warrant. Each whole
	2013&nbsp;Warrant originally entitled the holder to purchase one common share at an exercise price of $2.70 per share until September&nbsp;23, 2018, subject to certain adjustments. In connection
	with the 2014 Offering, and pursuant to the terms of such warrants, the exercise price of the 2013 Warrants issued in the 2013 Offering was changed to $1.30 per share. As at September&nbsp;23, 2013
	we recognized a liability in the amount of $6.4&nbsp;million for the&nbsp;2013 Warrants. The shelf registration statement was declared effective on August&nbsp;29, 2013. The file number is
	333-190674. The 2013 Offering had Canaccord Genuity acting as the sole book running manager.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Use of Proceeds
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2014, pursuant to the 2014 Offering, we issued and sold 15,927,500&nbsp;2014 Units for proceeds, before deducting
	fees and expenses, of approximately CAD$28.7&nbsp;million. After deducting fees and expenses, we realized net proceeds of $24.0&nbsp;million (CAD$26.2&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	previously disclosed, we planned to use the proceeds we received from the 2014 Offering as follows: approximately CAD$11.5&nbsp;million to strengthen our balance sheet,
	approximately CAD$5.7&nbsp;million to fund working capital and approximately CAD$5.7&nbsp;million for general corporate purposes. A portion of the aggregate net proceeds of the 2014 Offering
	(being CAD$3.3&nbsp;million) was received by us as a result of the exercise of the over-allotment option by the underwriters on August&nbsp;1, 2014. As a result, the net proceeds were greater than
	anticipated. The additional net proceeds will be used to fund working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our industry, a strong balance sheet (in&nbsp;the sense of a cushion of available cash) is attractive to customers as it demonstrates the capacity to ramp up and support higher
	production levels. In some longer term and larger deployments, a certain amount of cash on the balance sheet is a precondition to qualifying to supply products. To the extent we are successful in
	winning more business, funds allocated to strengthening our balance sheet may be
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	80
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=82,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=611348,FOLIO='80',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DU49901A.;13',USER='DCOMBA',CD='27-MAY-2015;13:04' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DU49901_1_81">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	reallocated
	to supporting higher levels of production, including purchases of component inventory to support our supply chain. Any amounts for general working capital remain unallocated and will be
	expended at the discretion of&nbsp;management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
	we intend to use the net proceeds from the 2014 Offering for the purposes set forth above, we reserve the right to use such net proceeds for other purposes to the extent that
	circumstances, including unforeseen events and other sound business reasons, make such use necessary or&nbsp;prudent.
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<A NAME="FIS_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_ITEM_15__CONTROLS_AND_PROCEDURES_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_5">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;15.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Controls and&nbsp;Procedures.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Disclosure Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the end of the period covered by this Annual report for the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 and up to May&nbsp;27, 2015, an
	evaluation was carried out under the supervision of, and with the participation of, our management, including our Chief Executive Officer, or CEO, and Chief Financial Officer, or CFO, which are our
	principal executive officer and principal financial officer, respectively, of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures (as&nbsp;defined in
	Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) of the Exchange Act. Based upon that evaluation, our CEO and CFO have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective as at February&nbsp;28, 2015 to give
	reasonable assurance that the information we are required to disclose in reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act and/or applicable Canadian securities legislation is (i)&nbsp;recorded,
	processed, summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission's as well as in accordance with applicable Canadian securities legislation
	rules and forms, and (ii)&nbsp;accumulated and communicated to management, including our principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, as
	appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Management's Report on Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our management is also responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as such term is
	defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f) and&nbsp;15d-15(f) as well as National Instrument&nbsp;52-109 of the Canadian Securities Administrators. These controls are designed to provide
	reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes. Under the supervision and with the participation of our
	management, including our principal executive officer, our CEO, and principal financial officer, our CFO, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial
	reporting based on the framework in Internal Control&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (1992
	Framework). Based on our evaluation under the framework in Internal Control&nbsp;&#150;&nbsp;Integrated Framework, our management concluded that our internal control over
	financial reporting was effective and that there are no material weaknesses in the Company's disclosure controls and procedures as of February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	81
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=83,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="1",CHK=234764,FOLIO='81',FILE='DISK105:[15ZBE1.15ZBE49901]DU49901A.;13',USER='DCOMBA',CD='27-MAY-2015;13:04' -->
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_PAGE_DU49901_1_82">
</A>
<EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDITORS_OPINION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Attestation Report of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Consolidated Financial Statements of the Company as of February&nbsp;28, 2015, 2014 and 2013 and for each of the years ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2015, 2014 and 2013, including the reports of our independent registered public accounting firm thereon are set forth on pages&nbsp;F-1 to&nbsp;F-68.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the period covered by this Annual Report, no changes occurred in our internal control over financial reporting that have
	materially affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_ITEM_16__RESERVED">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_6">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;16.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;RESERVED
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDITORS_OPINION>
</EFX_CONTROL_AND_PROCEDURES>
<EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<A NAME="FIS_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_ITEM_16A__AUDIT_COMMITTEE_FINANCIAL_EXPERT_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_7">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;16A.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Audit Committee Financial Expert.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Audit Committee
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have a separately designated standing Audit Committee established in accordance with section&nbsp;3(a)(58)(A) of the Exchange Act
	and NASDAQ Rule&nbsp;5605(c)(2). Our Audit Committee is composed of Lori O'Neill (Chair), Claude Haw, and Cesar Cesaratto, each of whom, in the opinion of the directors, is financially literate and
	independent as determined under National Instrument&nbsp;52-110 (Audit Committees) ("NI&nbsp;52-110"), Rule&nbsp;10A-3 of the Exchange Act and NASDAQ Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Audit Committee assists the board of directors in fulfilling its responsibilities for oversight of financial and accounting matters. In addition to recommending the auditors to be
	nominated and reviewing the compensation of the auditors, the Audit Committee is responsible for overseeing the work of the auditors and pre-approving non-audit services. The Audit Committee also
	reviews our annual and interim financial statements and news releases containing information taken from our financial statements prior to their release. The Audit Committee is responsible for
	reviewing the acceptability and quality of our financial reporting and accounting standards and principles and any proposed material changes to them or their application.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Audit Committee has a published charter, which is available at
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	and on our website,
<U>
	www.dragonwaveinc.com
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Audit Committee Financial Expert
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our board of directors has determined that each of Lori O'Neill and Claude Haw qualifies as an "audit committee financial expert"
	within the meaning of the SEC's rules and each of the members of the Audit Committee is independent as determined under Exchange Act Rule&nbsp;10A-3 and&nbsp;NASDAQ Rule&nbsp;5605(a)(2).
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_AUDIT_COMMITTEE_EXPERT>
<EFX_CODE_OF_ETHICS>
<A NAME="FIS_CODE_OF_ETHICS"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_DU49901_ITEM_16B__CODE_OF_ETHICS_">
</A>
<A NAME="A2224732Z20-F_HTM_TOC_DU49901_8">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ITEM&nbsp;16B.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Code of Ethics.
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics (the&nbsp;"Code of Ethics") that is applicable to each of our employees,
	including our principal executive officer, principal financial officer, principal accounting officer or controller. Our Code of Ethics is available at on our website at
<U>
	www.dragonwaveinc.com
</U>
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any
	amendments to our Code of Ethics, and all waivers of the Code of Ethics with respect to any of the officers covered by it, will be posted on our website within five business days of
	such amendment or waiver and shall be provided in print to any shareholder who requests&nbsp;them.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	have been no waivers or implicit waivers to the Code of Ethics during the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	82
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
</EFX_CODE_OF_ETHICS>
