<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Note&nbsp;1: Gross profit before inventory provisions is a non-GAAP financial measure. See "Use
	of Non-GAAP Performance Measures".
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DragonWave is a leading provider of high-capacity packet microwave solutions that drive next-generation IP networks. DragonWave's
	carrier-grade point-to-point packet microwave systems transmit broadband voice, video and data, enabling service providers, government agencies, enterprises and other organizations to meet
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	7
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=9,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=1037120,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GE49904A.;11',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GE49904_1_8">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	their
	increasing bandwidth requirements rapidly and affordably. The principal application of DragonWave's products is mobile network backhaul. Additional applications include leased line replacement,
	last mile fiber extension and enterprise networks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	support product lines branded under the names Horizon, Avenue and Avenue Lite, Harmony and Harmony Lite, and Harmony Eband. The key elements of our solutions include: high
	performance; carrier-grade availability; cost-competitiveness; support of legacy networking standards; and the availability of advanced network management and wireless network IP&nbsp;planning.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	demand for our products is driven by global trends, including IP convergence and pressure on backhaul capacity caused by increased functionality of mobile devices, the shift in
	demand from voice to multimedia content and services, growing demand for wireless coverage, increasing numbers of subscribers, and
	investment in radio access network spectrum. In our target markets, network traffic is shifting from legacy TDM traffic to IP-based traffic to improve network efficiency and enable IP-based services.
	Principally, we target the global wireless communications service provider market and, in particular, those service providers offering high-capacity wireless communication services, including
	traditional cellular service providers and emerging broadband wireless access (BWA) service providers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	sell our products both directly and indirectly through our channel partners.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	direct customers are typically service providers that operate networks in large geographical areas. The sales cycle to this class of customer typically involves a trial
	(or&nbsp;trials), and typically requires nine to twelve months from first contact before orders are received, but can be longer, particularly in greenfield situations. Once the order stage is
	reached, a supply agreement is usually established and multiple orders are processed under one master supply agreement. Master supply agreements provide the framework for future business and do not
	generally include any volume commitments.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	channel partners are distributors, value-added resellers and OEMs&nbsp;(original equipment manufacturers) including system integrators and network equipment vendors. In 2012, we
	acquired Nokia's microwave product line, and since that time Nokia has been our principal channel partner. Nokia rebrands our Harmony product as FlexiPacket. In our fiscal year ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2015, the Nokia channel accounted for 53% of our&nbsp;sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also have a 50.1% owned subsidiary, DragonWave HFCL India Private Limited ("DragonWave HFCL") to address the Indian market. Because we have a controlling interest in
	the subsidiary we consolidate its results. In fiscal 2015, our sales of services and locally sourced material in India flowed through DragonWave&nbsp;HFCL.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	outsource most of our manufacturing and certain elements of the supply chain management and distribution functions. Outsourcing these functions allows us to focus on designing,
	developing, selling and supporting our products. Our research and development expenses have historically been, and will continue to be, a significant portion of our overall cost structure as we will
	continue to invest in new product features and new platforms to better serve the current and future needs of our&nbsp;customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	industry is global and highly competitive. We face competition in our target markets from two types of&nbsp;microwave equipment suppliers: hybrid equipment suppliers (including NEC
	Corporation, Alcatel-Lucent, Ericsson&nbsp;and Huawei) and suppliers, like us, of Ethernet equipment (including SIAE Microelettronica, Ceragon Networks&nbsp;Ltd. and Aviat Networks,&nbsp;Inc.).
	We also face competition from full service network integrators such as Huawei, NEC Corporation, Alcatel-Lucent and Ericsson, who have developed competing Ethernet-based products for
	IP&nbsp;networks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	8
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=10,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=109871,FOLIO='8',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GE49904A.;11',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GE49904_1_9">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	business priorities include: managing resources to minimize cash demands; strengthening our balance sheet; maintaining our global reach while focusing on key revenue growth areas;
	maintaining and growing our relationships with channel partners; building on customer wins; and building toward leadership in outdoor smallcell backhaul.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	primary operational objective continues to be to achieve cash flow break-even from operations. To this end, we plan to focus on new revenue opportunities; continuing to optimize
	costs associated with manufacturing and logistics with the objective of improving gross profit performance and; closely monitoring operating expenses to ensure we maintain the leverage in our current
	business&nbsp;model.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Recent Developments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Highlights of Our Financial Results
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following are key points on our results of operations for the fourth quarter and full year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, compared
	to the same periods in fiscal&nbsp;2014:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our revenue increased by $25.9&nbsp;million between the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2014 and the fourth quarter of
	fiscal year 2015. When comparing the full year, revenue increased by $67.8&nbsp;million between fiscal year 2014 and fiscal year 2015. The primary factors contributing to revenue
	changes&nbsp;are:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Growth in sales through the Nokia channel (Q4&nbsp;FY2015 vs. Q4&nbsp;FY2014 increase of $10.3&nbsp;million; FY2015
	vs. FY2014 increase of $37.0&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Growth in direct sales to a Tier&nbsp;1 carrier located in India (Q4&nbsp;FY2015 vs. Q4&nbsp;FY2014 increase of
	$7.3&nbsp;million; FY2015 vs. FY2014 increase of $26.3&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Increases in direct and indirect sales in North America, Europe, and the Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa were only partially
	offset by smaller decreases in other regions (Q4&nbsp;FY2015 vs. Q4&nbsp;FY2014 net increase of $8.3&nbsp;million; FY2015 vs. FY2014 net increase of $4.5&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our gross profit percentage in the fourth quarter of FY2015 increased to 19.4%, compared to 14.5% in the fourth quarter of
	FY2014. The increased gross profit percentage relates to lower material costs and lower production and repair&nbsp;costs.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	9
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A fair value adjustment gain of $1.0&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million, respectively, was realized during the three
	and twelve month periods ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, as a result of a depreciation of the warrant valuation on the remaining warrants outstanding from the public equity offerings completed in
	September&nbsp;2013 and August&nbsp;2014. This compared to a fair value adjustment loss of $0.4&nbsp;million and gain of $3.2&nbsp;million in the three and twelve month periods ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2014 resulting from the September&nbsp;2013 public equity offering.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other items before taxes impacting the loss in the fourth quarter and in fiscal 2015 totaled $0.6&nbsp;million and
	$2.2&nbsp;million, respectively, and included amortization of software assets, accretion expense, interest expense, a gain on change in estimate, a gain on sale of fixed assets and a foreign
	exchange&nbsp;gain.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The net loss applicable to shareholders was $2.3&nbsp;million and $21.5&nbsp;million, respectively, for the three and
	twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the three and twelve month periods ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 we drew an additional $5.8&nbsp;million and
	$17.4&nbsp;million respectively on our line of credit which became available to us as our accounts receivable balance increased. Our ending cash position at February&nbsp;28, 2015 was
	$23.7&nbsp;million, as compared to $29.5&nbsp;million at the end of the third quarter of fiscal 2015 and $19.0&nbsp;million at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	New&nbsp;Wins
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;22, 2015 we announced that we had signed a Master Purchase Agreement for Technical Products and Related Services with a
	tier one North American carrier. This new agreement complements and expands current agreements between us and this customer. In keeping with industry norms, the agreement does not include any volume
	commitments; it establishes the framework for future business from this important, long-standing customer.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;7, 2015 we announced that Saudi Telecom Company (STC), the largest network operator in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, had entered into a supply agreement for our products
	to support its enterprise network expansion. STC has ordered Horizon Compact+ and Harmony Enhanced high capacity microwave products in its aggressive network expansions. Our agreement with STC was
	made in partnership with Creative
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	10
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Telecom
	Company (CTC) and Waseela For Technology Consultations (Waseela), which will provide local integration services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	continue to pursue opportunities to expand our customer base and our sales to existing customers around the&nbsp;world.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Revenue Expectations&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Update to Guidance During Q4
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;13, 2015, at the time of the release of our financial statements for the third quarter ended February&nbsp;28,
	2015, we announced that we anticipated fourth quarter revenue growth in the range of up to 10% over the $47.3&nbsp;million revenue we achieved in the third quarter of fiscal year 2015. On
	March&nbsp;5, 2015, we communicated updated revenue expectations of approximately $44.0&nbsp;million for the quarter ended February&nbsp;28, 2015. Revenue was anticipated to be lower due to
	uneven timing of installation services revenue, shipments that did not make the Q4&nbsp;cut-off date, and delays in equipment orders. Actual revenue in Q4&nbsp;decreased by $3.6&nbsp;million
	compared to Q3 of fiscal year 2015. The primary drivers for the decrease were as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Relationship with Nokia
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We closed our acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business on June&nbsp;1, 2012. At the time of the acquisition we became the
	preferred strategic supplier of packet microwave and related products to Nokia. The integration phase for the transaction is now&nbsp;complete.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	April&nbsp;10, 2013 we announced a renewed framework with Nokia which included:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The settlement of a contingent receivable whereby Nokia paid us $13.8&nbsp;million (balance sheet impacting only).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The termination of a services agreement with Nokia which resulted in a reduction of our accounts payable by
	$13.3&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The elimination of a capital lease obligation ($1.3&nbsp;million) and corresponding assets ($0.6&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our agreement to a termination fee in the amount of $8.7&nbsp;million to be paid by us to Nokia in installments. As of
	the date of this MD&amp;A, $4.4&nbsp;million of this fee has been&nbsp;paid.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net impact to the statement of operations resulting from the renewed framework was a gain on contract amendment of $5.3&nbsp;million during the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014.
	During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, we also entered into a revised agreement that reduced a capital lease obligation with Nokia associated with our operations in India by
	$0.4&nbsp;million, which impacted the gain on contract amendment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	11
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=13,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=300186,FOLIO='11',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GE49904A.;11',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GE49904_1_12">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Over
	time, our relationship with Nokia has become one based on the value that each party brings to the other across diverse domains including technology collaboration, product management
	and customer services and support. Either party may use alternative partners or products. Nokia has recently announced the formation of a microwave ecosystem administered through its Partner Business
	Unit (PBU). The PBU was established to facilitate Nokia's delivery of partner products and services alongside the Nokia portfolio. We are a member of PBU's microwave ecosystem together with other
	microwave vendors. In April&nbsp;2015, Nokia announced its proposed combination with Alcatel-Lucent (ALU), which has a vertically integrated microwave business unit. The combination is subject to
	regulatory approvals and other conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	Nokia has reaffirmed its commitment to partnering, both the introduction of the multi-vendor microwave ecosystem and the proposed Alcatel-Lucent combination increases uncertainty
	for the future of
	this channel. In recognition of this, we are seeking Nokia's agreement to changes to our existing contractual framework to support our cash flows and rationalize future legacy support obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_93"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Please note: Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA is a
	non-GAAP measure. See "Use of Non-GAAP Performance Measures".
</I>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=1>
<B>
	FY15
<BR>
	Q4
</B>
</FONT>
</TH>
<TH STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenue and Expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We continue to have one reportable segment, broadband wireless backhaul equipment. The vast majority of our sales come from the
	shipment of equipment (as&nbsp;opposed to services or software) either through direct sales, sales to distributors, or through original equipment manufacturers (OEMs).
</FONT>
</P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis

	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015

</B>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>

	also analyze our sales according to geographic region and target product development and sales strategies to meet the unique requirements of each region. Through co-operation with our
	channel partner, Nokia, we have visibility to the geographical location of our shipments through Nokia's various warehouses. The table below displays this information.

<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Volume of Units Shipped
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The number of units shipped has increased substantially over time and this trend indicates in part the ability of the logistics and
	operations segments of the business to scale our manufacturing and shipping capacity to larger volume levels. It also indicates the significant downward pricing pressure experienced by
	our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=15,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=197111,FOLIO='13',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GE49904A.;11',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GE49904_1_14">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cost of Sales and Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A large component of our cost of sales is the cost of products purchased from outsourced manufacturers. Final testing and assembly for
	the links sold by us is carried out both at our premises and at the premises of our contract manufacturers. Additional costs for logistics and warranty activities are included in cost of sales. We use
	the services of a number of outsourced contract manufacturers with locations in Germany, China and&nbsp;Malaysia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research
	and development ("R&amp;D") costs relate mainly to the compensation of our engineering group and the material consumption associated with prototyping activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales
	and marketing ("S&amp;M") expenses include the remuneration of sales staff, travel and trade show activities and customer support services.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General
	and administrative ("G&amp;A") expenses relate to the remuneration of related personnel, professional fees associated with tax, accounting and legal advice, and insurance costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Occupancy
	and information systems costs are related to our leasing costs and communications networks and are accumulated and allocated, based on headcount, to all functional areas in
	our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_97"></A>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Additional Investment in DragonWave HFCL India Private Limited.
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 we contributed an additional $0.2&nbsp;million to DragonWave HFCL India Private
	Limited, in the form of a capital contribution. Subsequent to year end, the non-controlling shareholder which owns 49.9% of the subsidiary contributed its portion of the capital contribution.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Comparison of the three months and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 and February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenue
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=16,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=1022109,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GE49904A.;11',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GE49904_1_15">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	two main factors which led to the increase in revenue when compared to the prior year period were (1)&nbsp;an increase in sales through the Nokia channel and (2)&nbsp;a key
	account win with Reliance Jio in India. We saw increases in direct sales to North America, Europe, and the Middle East resulting from project-based deployments.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_98"></A>

	Increase in direct sales in Europe, Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
	Note: Gross profit before inventory provision is a non-GAAP financial measure. See "Use of Non-GAAP Performance
	Measures".
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our gross profit percentage improved relative to the previous year in both the three and twelve month periods ended February&nbsp;28, 2015. This
	improvement relates to lower material costs, lower overhead costs driven by the increased focus on outsourcing and warehousing changes and reduced warranty costs. These changes were offset by
	inventory provisions in the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 of $1.2&nbsp;million and $2.8&nbsp;million respectively. The inventory provisions were taken on older product
	platforms as customers continue the rapid adoption of our higher capacity products. The increase in total sales volume also resulted in an increase in our gross profit. We continue to actively pursue
	additional gross profit improvements through better material costs and more favourable logistics performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	15
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<I>

</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	The Impact of Foreign Exchange ("FX") on Operating Expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating expenses include compensation costs, professional fees and consulting services paid in local currencies. We pay for expenses
	in a variety of currencies most notably Canadian dollars. The following table breaks down the composition of our operating expense disbursements by&nbsp;currency.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015, the Canadian dollar weakened relative to the U.S dollar, and as a result expenses paid for in Canadian dollars when translated to
	U.S.&nbsp;dollars are lower. The table below highlights the change in the foreign exchange rates used to translate Canadian dollars to United&nbsp;States dollars in operating expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_99"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:54%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"150%" -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Depreciation
	expense levels are lower than they were in the previous year because spending on R&amp;D test equipment has been limited for the past two years. A favourable commodity tax
	ruling in China also resulted in lower expenses (approximately $0.5&nbsp;million for the fiscal year ended February&nbsp;28, 2015) for our R&amp;D organization, and spending on external contractors
	has decreased as well. The impact of a weakened Canadian dollar reduced our United&nbsp;States dollar denominated expenses by $0.5&nbsp;million in fiscal year&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	16
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	S&amp;M organization, which includes marketing, product line management, customer service and sales, grew between the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2014 and the fourth quarter of fiscal
	year 2015. We continue to adjust these teams internationally to meet the regional requirements of our customer&nbsp;base.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;G&amp;A
	expenses include Finance, HR, the Executive office, as well as the portion of the costs of the Operations organization which do not flow directly into Cost of Goods sold. The table
	below shows that growth in a number of areas has been offset by the impact of the foreign currency translation of the largely Canadian expense&nbsp;base.
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The amortization of software is decreasing slightly as the net book value of intangible assets including Infrastructure Systems Software and
	Computer Software is reduced. During the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, we fully amortized the remaining balance associated with favourable Accounts Receivable terms which was an
	intangible asset acquired as part of our acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 we incurred accretion expenses associated with the termination liability in connection with the termination of a
	services agreement with Nokia discussed above under "Relationship with Nokia" and a smaller portion associated with capital leases. The accretion expense in both the three and twelve months ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2014 relates to capital leases which we acquired as part of our acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business.
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_108"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Interest Expense
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:57%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"140%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="140%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have a credit line available to us of $40.0&nbsp;million plus $4.0&nbsp;million for letters of credit and foreign exchange facilities. The
	credit line will expire on June&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of February&nbsp;28, 2015, $32.4&nbsp;million is outstanding on the line of credit and $1.9&nbsp;million against its letter of credit facility. As of the date of this MD&amp;A, no
	additional funds have been drawn down on the line of credit. Interest rates vary with market rate fluctuations, with loans bearing interest in the range of 3% to 4% above the applicable base rates.
	During the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 the weighted average debt outstanding was $27.9&nbsp;million and $20.3&nbsp;million, respectively (three months and twelve months
	ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$15.0&nbsp;million). We capitalized the fees associated with the creation and renegotiation of the line and are amortizing
	those costs over the life of the&nbsp;facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	(Loss) / Gain on Change in Estimate
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=21,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=863694,FOLIO='19',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GG49904A.;15',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GG49904_1_20">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	are three factors contributing to the (loss)/gain on change in estimate during the three and twelve months ended
	February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2015, we reduced the estimated receivable related to the disposition of
	DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. (Israel); this estimate change had a ($52&nbsp;thousand) impact on the Statement of Operations (Q4&nbsp;FY2014 impact of ($0.6&nbsp;million)).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2015, we increased the value of product related accrued liabilities by
	($0.2&nbsp;million) estimated at the time of the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport (fiscal year 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;we reduced the liability by
	$2.7&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 we reduced the termination liability for the Italian services
	agreement which created a gain of $0.3&nbsp;million (fiscal year 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;gain of $0.3&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 we also changed the estimate of our Israeli lease liability which created a gain of $0.3&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_110"></A>

<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>

<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->

</TD>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	August&nbsp;1, 2014 we completed an equity offering which included the issuance of warrants. Of the total equity issuance costs of $2.3&nbsp;million, $0.2&nbsp;million was
	attributed to the warrants specifically and expensed to our
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	consolidated
	statement of operations in the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015. The remaining issuance costs were netted against the proceeds of the offering. Similarly, in the previous
	fiscal year, on September&nbsp;23, 2013, we completed an equity offering, which included the issuance of warrants. A portion of the total issuance costs were also expensed to our consolidated
	statement of operations in the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014. See "Equity Offerings and Use of Proceeds" below.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	warrant liability is required to be presented at its estimated fair value as at each balance sheet date. Increases or decreases in fair value of the warrants are included as a
	component of other income (expense) in our consolidated statement of operations. The income for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 related to the warrants which were issued
	pursuant to the 2013 Equity Offering and the 2014 Equity Offering.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	foreign exchange gains and losses for both the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 resulted from the translation of foreign denominated monetary accounts and the
	strength of the U.S.&nbsp;dollar relative to foreign currencies. During the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 the translation of cash accounts resulted in foreign currency
	losses of $0.4&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million respectively, while the translation of foreign currency denominated liability accounts, particularly those denominated in Euro, resulted in
	foreign currency gains which more than offset the foreign exchange losses.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	tax expense in the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 reflects the anticipated payment of taxes in entities which perform R&amp;D or sales and customer support
	services for DragonWave internationally. It also reflects the anticipated payment of taxes in India. In fiscal year 2014 our tax expense related primarily to China. In fiscal year 2015 our tax expense
	relates to anticipated cash taxes payable in China and India offset by a
</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=23,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=495650,FOLIO='21',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GG49904A.;15',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GG49904_1_22">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$0.4&nbsp;million
	refund anticipated from the U.S.A. as a result of a favourable tax ruling related to fiscal year 2010. We actively seek and apply for all tax incentive programs available in these
	jurisdictions to minimize these expenses wherever possible.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2015, we had cumulative operating tax loss carry forwards in the following jurisdictions: Canada&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$109.0&nbsp;million,
	United&nbsp;States&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$8.0&nbsp;million and Luxembourg&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$53.5&nbsp;million. We also had capital loss carryforwards in
	the following jurisdictions: Canada&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$16.3&nbsp;million, and the United&nbsp;States&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$45.5&nbsp;million. In
	addition, we had
	$15.6&nbsp;million of investment tax credits available to reduce future federal Canadian income taxes payable and $2.6&nbsp;million available to reduce future provincial income
	taxes&nbsp;payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Use of Non-GAAP Performance Measures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	"Gross profit before inventory provisions"
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In this MD&amp;A we break out "Gross profit before inventory provisions" as this measure allows management to evaluate our operational
	performance and compare to prior periods more effectively. "Gross profit before inventory provisions" does not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP, it is therefore unlikely to be
	comparable to similar measures presented by other issuers and is not designed to replace other measures of financial performance or the statement of operations as an indicator of performance. This
	measure should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for other measures of performance calculated according to GAAP. We believe that it is useful to compare gross profit results without
	the impact of inventory provisions, since our inventory provisions generally relate to discontinuance of products. We believe this non-GAAP measure also provides investors with a better ability to
	understand our operational performance. We calculate "Gross profit before inventory provisions" consistently over each fiscal&nbsp;period.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	most directly comparable GAAP measure presented in our interim financial statements for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 to "Gross profit before inventory
	provisions" is "Gross&nbsp;profit".
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	"Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA"
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In this MD&amp;A we also break out "Adjusted Cashflow from Operations" also called "Adjusted EBITDA". This measure corresponds to earnings
	before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization less elements that are non-cash in nature. Because it omits non-cash items, we feel that Adjusted Cashflow from Operations /Adjusted EBITDA better
	represents the cash impact of the results of operations in the period. Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA does not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP, and is not designed
	to replace other measures of financial performance or the statement of operations as an indicator of performance. This measure should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for other
	measures of performance calculated according to GAAP. Consistent improvement in Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA is one of management's primary objectives. Reducing cash usage from
	drivers other than working capital and capital investments is an important objective for us and we believe this financial measure is therefore useful to investors in evaluating our operating
	performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	most directly comparable GAAP measure presented in our interim financial statements for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 to "Adjusted Cashflow from
	Operations/Adjustment EBITDA" is "Net Loss". A reconciliation of "Adjusted Cashflow from Operations/Adjusted EBITDA" to "Net Loss" is set out below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	22
</FONT>
</P>

</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Note:
	Days Sales Outstanding in accounts receivable excluding a Tier&nbsp;1 carrier in India were 59&nbsp;days
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cash and Cash Equivalents
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As at February&nbsp;28, 2015, we had $23.7&nbsp;million in Cash and Cash Equivalents ("Cash"), representing a $4.7&nbsp;million
	increase from the Cash balance at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	23
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key
	points associated with the Cash decrease of $5.9&nbsp;million in the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2015&nbsp;include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We borrowed a further $5.8&nbsp;million against the line of credit.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Inventory levels grew slightly as a result of the lower than anticipated sales in the&nbsp;quarter.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Receivables, with longer payment terms than the terms we have with suppliers, grew at a greater rate than
	our&nbsp;payables.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We continued to invest in capital equipment and software required to meet capacity requirements for the recent increase
	in&nbsp;sales.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	24
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Trade Receivables
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our trade receivables balance increased by $31.2&nbsp;million between February&nbsp;28, 2014 and February&nbsp;28, 2015 as a
	result of the increase in sales and variable payment terms of select customers. Our days sales outstanding increased to 96&nbsp;days at February&nbsp;28, 2015 versus 81&nbsp;days at
	February&nbsp;28, 2014. Our allowance for doubtful accounts continues to represent a small percentage of our total trade receivables outstanding (February&nbsp;28,
	2015&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;1.0%; February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;3.0%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2015, two customers exceeded 10% of the total receivable balance. These customers represented 37% and 34% of the trade receivables balance (February&nbsp;28,
	2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;one customer represented 56% of the trade receivables balance).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Included
	in G&amp;A expenses is a nominal bad debt expense for the three month period ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 and $0.2&nbsp;million for the twelve month period ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2015 (fourth quarter fiscal year 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$48&nbsp;thousand; full fiscal year
	2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.5&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	25
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The accounts payable and accrued liabilities balance increased by $10.2&nbsp;million between February&nbsp;28, 2014 and
	February&nbsp;28, 2015 primarily due to an increase in purchases tied to higher sales&nbsp;levels.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Debt Facility
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;6, 2014, we extended the credit facility with Comerica Bank and Export Development Canada which was set to mature on
	June&nbsp;1, 2016. The revised line has been increased to
	$40.0&nbsp;million plus $4.0&nbsp;million for letters of credit and foreign exchange facilities and will expire on June&nbsp;1, 2016. The new terms of the credit facility include customary
	terms, conditions, covenants, and representations and warranties. Credit availability is subject to ongoing compliance with borrowing covenants and short term assets on hand. As at February&nbsp;28,
	2015, we had $32.4&nbsp;million drawn on this facility, and in addition had utilized $1.9&nbsp;million for letters of credit. Access to additional available funds is geared to future growth in
	accounts receivable. The credit facility is secured by a first priority charge on all of our assets and principal direct and indirect subsidiaries. Borrowing options under the credit facility include
	U.S.&nbsp;dollars, Canadian dollars and Euro loans. Interest rates vary with market rate fluctuations, with loans bearing interest in the range of 3% to 4% above the applicable base rates. Direct
	costs associated with obtaining the debt facility such as closing fees, registration and legal expenses have been capitalized and will be amortized over the thirty month term of the&nbsp;facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	credit facility contains financial covenants including minimum tangible net worth requirements, holding a minimum of $10.0&nbsp;million within our lenders (Comerica Bank) operating
	account, and minimum liquidity ratio requirements. The credit facility also imposes certain restrictions on our ability to acquire capital assets above a threshold over a trailing six month period.
	Certain of our assets, including accounts receivable, inventory, and equipment, are pledged as collateral for the credit facility. Upon an event of default, outstanding obligations would be
	immediately due and payable unless a waiver is&nbsp;received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	were in breach of one of our covenants in both March, 2014 and April, 2014. We obtained waivers for these breaches and amended the terms of the facility on May&nbsp;13, 2014. We
	were in compliance with all covenants as at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	26
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=28,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=295404,FOLIO='26',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GI49904A.;12',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GI49904_1_27">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Equity Offerings and Use of Proceeds
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	2014 Equity Offering
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2014 we completed a public equity offering (the&nbsp;"2014 Equity Offering"). Under the terms of the 2014 Equity
	Offering, we issued and sold 15,927,500&nbsp;units at CAD$1.80 per unit for aggregate gross proceeds of $26.2&nbsp;million (CAD$28.7&nbsp;million). After deducting commissions and expenses, we
	realized net proceeds of $24.0&nbsp;million. Each unit consisted of one common share of the Company and one half of one warrant. Each whole warrant originally entitled the holder to purchase one of
	our common shares at an exercise price of CAD$2.25 per share until August&nbsp;1, 2016. Upon issuance, we recognized a liability in the amount of $2.6&nbsp;million for the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	2013 Equity Offering
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September&nbsp;23, 2013, pursuant to the public equity offering of units (the&nbsp;"2013 Equity Offering"), we issued
	11,910,000&nbsp;common shares and 8,932,500&nbsp;warrants for proceeds, before deducting fees and expenses, of approximately $25.0&nbsp;million. After deducting fees and expenses, we realized
	net proceeds of $22.4&nbsp;million. The units were offered at a price of $2.10 per unit. Each unit consisted of one common share and three quarters of one warrant. Each whole warrant originally
	entitled the holder to purchase one common share at an exercise price of $2.70 per share until September&nbsp;23, 2018, subject to certain adjustments. In connection with the 2014 Equity Offering,
	and pursuant to the terms of such warrants, the exercise price of the warrants issued in the 2013 Equity Offering was changed to $1.30 per share. As at September&nbsp;23, 2013 we recognized a
	liability in the amount of $6.4&nbsp;million for the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Use of Proceeds
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2014, pursuant to the 2014 Equity Offering, we issued 15,927,500&nbsp;common shares and 7,963,750&nbsp;warrants
	for proceeds, before deducting fees and expenses, of approximately CAD$28.7&nbsp;million. After deducting fees and expenses, we realized net proceeds of $24.0&nbsp;million
	(CAD$26.2&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	previously disclosed, we planned to use the proceeds we received from the 2014 Equity Offering as follows: approximately CAD$11.5&nbsp;million to strengthen our balance sheet,
	approximately CAD$5.7&nbsp;million to fund working capital and approximately CAD$5.7&nbsp;million for general corporate purposes. A portion of the aggregate net proceeds of the 2014 Equity
	Offering (being CAD$3.3&nbsp;million) was received by us as a result of the exercise of the over-allotment option by the underwriters on August&nbsp;1, 2014. As a result, the net proceeds were
	greater than anticipated. The additional net proceeds will be used to fund working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	our industry, a strong balance sheet (in&nbsp;the sense of a cushion of available cash) is attractive to customers as it demonstrates the capacity to ramp up and support higher
	production levels. In some longer term and larger deployments, a certain amount of cash on the balance sheet is a precondition to qualifying to supply products. To the extent we are successful in
	winning more business, funds allocated to strengthening our balance sheet may be reallocated to supporting higher levels of production, including purchases of component inventory to support our supply
	chain. Any amounts for general working capital remain unallocated and will be expended at the discretion of&nbsp;management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
	we intend to use the net proceeds from the 2014 Equity Offering for the purposes set forth above, we reserve the right to use such net proceeds for other purposes to the extent
	that circumstances, including unforeseen events and other sound business reasons, make such use necessary or&nbsp;prudent.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	27
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<P ALIGN=LEFT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-LEFT:8PT;TEXT-INDENT:-8PT;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=1>
	General corporate purposes
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	CAD$5.7&nbsp;million
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=1>
	No variances to date
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Liquidity Discussion
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our consolidated financial statements for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 have been prepared assuming that
	we will continue as a going concern, which contemplates the realization of assets and the disbursement of liabilities in the normal course of business. We have consumed a significant amount of cash
	resources during the past three years, mainly attributable to material and operating expense base reductions that lagged reductions in sales volumes, and our acquisition and integration of Nokia's
	microwave transport business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have formulated a plan to return to cashflow break-even from operations and to continue to operate as a going concern. We plan to continue utilizing our asset backed lending
	facilities described in the "Debt Facility" section above to finance our working capital&nbsp;needs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Some
	of the significant assumptions and associated risks of our plan to achieve cashflow break-even from operations include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Achieving growth in sales including capturing new accounts;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reducing the costs of our products to improve margin performance on hardware;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Efficiently and cost effectively expanding into new regions including India and&nbsp;Russia;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued access to debt under arrangements with our current lenders including renewal of credit line;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Adapting to changes resulting from Nokia's creation of its PBU and microwave ecosystem and Nokia's proposed combination
	with&nbsp;ALU.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	we believe that our assumptions are reasonable, actual events or circumstances may cause our assumptions to be incorrect and actual results may differ materially from
	the&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Commitments as at February&nbsp;28, 2015
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Future minimum operating lease payments as at February&nbsp;28, 2015 per fiscal year relate to leases of office and warehouse space.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	28
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	are subject to claims and legal actions in the normal course of our business activities. We recognize a provision for estimated loss contingencies when it is probable that a liability
	has been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. In management's opinion, adequate provisions have been made for all current and future&nbsp;claims.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Outstanding Share Data
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our common shares are listed on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol DWI and on the NASDAQ under the symbol&nbsp;DRWI.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	warrants issued on August&nbsp;1, 2014 in connection with the 2014 Equity Offering are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange under the symbol DWI.WT and on the NASDAQ Global Market
	under the symbol&nbsp;DRWIW.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2015 the following securities were issued and outstanding: 75,290,818&nbsp;common shares, options to purchase 3,985,587&nbsp;common shares granted under our
	Share Based Compensation Plan, 80,000&nbsp;restricted share units ("RSUs") granted under our Share Based Compensation Plan, and warrants exercisable for 10,052,500&nbsp;common shares. The number
	of common shares issuable upon the exercise of the warrants is subject to adjustment in accordance with terms of the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	March&nbsp;5, 2015 we announced that we had received a notice from NASDAQ that we were not in compliance with NASDAQ's Listing Rule&nbsp;5450(a)(1), as the minimum bid price of
	our common shares had closed below $1.00 per share for 30&nbsp;consecutive business days. The notification of noncompliance has no
	immediate effect on the listing or trading of our common shares on the NASDAQ Global Market under the symbol&nbsp;"DRWI".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of May&nbsp;8, 2015 the following securities were issued and outstanding: 75,305,761&nbsp;common shares, options to purchase 3,834,757&nbsp;common shares granted under our Share
	Based Compensation Plan, 60,000&nbsp;RSUs granted under our Share Based Compensation Plan, and warrants exercisable for 10,052,500&nbsp;common shares. The number of common shares issuable upon the
	exercise of the warrants is subject to adjustment in accordance with terms of the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Restricted Shares&nbsp;&amp; Employee Share Purchase Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We launched an Employee Share Purchase Plan ("ESPP") on October&nbsp;20, 2008. The plan includes provisions to allow employees to
	purchase common shares. We will match the employees' contribution at a rate of 25%. During the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 a total of 16,567 and 44,012&nbsp;common shares
	were purchased by employees at fair market value, while we issued 4,139 and 11,003&nbsp;common shares as its matching contribution, expressed net of 1,500&nbsp;forfeited shares during the twelve
	months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015. The shares we contributed will vest twelve (12)&nbsp;months after&nbsp;issuance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	record an expense equal to the fair value of shares granted pursuant to the ESPP over the period the shares vest. The total fair value of the shares earned during the three and twelve
	months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 was $3&nbsp;thousand and $13&nbsp;thousand (three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$3&nbsp;thousand
	and $23&nbsp;thousand). The fair value of the unearned ESPP shares as at February&nbsp;28, 2015 was $13&nbsp;thousand
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
