<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(February&nbsp;28,
	2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$13&nbsp;thousand). The number of shares held for release, and still restricted under the ESPP at February&nbsp;28, 2015 was
	11,000 (February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;7,305).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Restricted Share Units (RSUs)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Pursuant to the terms of our Share Based Compensation Plan, we entered into restricted share unit agreements with certain of our
	independent directors. These units which were issued during July&nbsp;2014 are unvested and subject to each director's continued engagement on the Board for a period of one year from the date
	of&nbsp;issuance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table sets forth the summary of RSU activity under our Share Based Compensation Plan for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015:
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have recognized $36&nbsp;thousand and $94&nbsp;thousand for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 as compensation expense for restricted share units, with a
	corresponding credit to contributed surplus.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	were no RSUs vested as of February&nbsp;28, 2015. All RSUs will vest during the second quarter of fiscal year 2016 with the exception of 20,000&nbsp;RSUs which were cancelled
	on April&nbsp;14,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>

<TH COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">

<B>
	Cost per
<BR>
	Month

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=33,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=361448,FOLIO='31',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GI49904A.;12',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GI49904_1_32">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The leases listed above are arranged at market pricing levels in all jurisdictions and the lease periods listed above represent a commitment for
	the time period indicated. We are actively seeking sub-lease arrangements in a number of locations as part of our efforts to reduce costs. There can be no assurance that we will secure sub-leases or
	that sub-lease terms will be&nbsp;favorable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;21, 2014, we subleased a portion of our Kanata office space and as such during the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 we recorded net rent expense of
	$84&nbsp;thousand, representing the present value of our estimated remaining rent expense for the duration of the lease after taking into account estimated future sublease income and deferred rent
	on the&nbsp;facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	use an outsourced manufacturing model in which most of the component acquisition and assembly of our products is executed by third parties. Generally, we provide the supplier with a
	purchase order 90&nbsp;days in advance of expected delivery. We are responsible for the financial impact of any changes to the product requirements within this period. In some cases when a product
	has been purchased by a contract manufacturer but not pulled on for a build after a certain amount of time, we provide a deposit against that inventory, but do not take ownership of&nbsp;it.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	contract manufacturers currently have inventory intended for use in the production of our products, and we have purchase orders in place for raw materials and manufactured products
	with these contract manufacturers as well. All of this material is considered to be part of the normal production process and we take&nbsp;provisions against any portion of that inventory that we do
	not expect to be fully used based on current forecasts and projections. As mentioned previously, we would generally be responsible for the cost of the material approved to be purchased on our behalf
	by our contract manufacturers should those forecasts or projections&nbsp;change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2015, we have provisions totaling $0.1&nbsp;million on inventory held by contract manufacturers that we do not expect to be fully&nbsp;used.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial instruments are classified into one of the following categories: assets held at fair value, loans and receivables, other
	financial liabilities, or liabilities held at fair&nbsp;value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Categories for financial assets and liabilities
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table summarizes the carrying values of our financial instruments:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_127"></A>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=34,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=154434,FOLIO='32',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GI49904A.;12',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GI49904_1_33">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Fair value
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We classify our fair value measurements using a fair value hierarchy that reflects the significance of inputs used in making the
	measurements. The accounting standard establishes a fair value hierarchy based on the level of independent, objective evidence surrounding the inputs used to measure fair value. A financial
	instrument's categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. The inputs fall into three levels that may be
	used to measure fair&nbsp;value.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	September&nbsp;23, 2013 warrant liability is classified as Level&nbsp;3 as it is measured at fair value using significant unobservable inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	August&nbsp;1, 2014 warrant liability is classified as Level&nbsp;1 as the warrants issued in the 2014 Equity Offering are traded on the Toronto Stock Exchange and on the NASDAQ
	Global&nbsp;Market.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2015 we held the following Level&nbsp;3 financial instruments carried at fair value on the consolidated balance&nbsp;sheet.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_128"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">

</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</TD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	reconciliation of the Level&nbsp;3 warrant liability measured at fair value for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015&nbsp;follows:

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=10,SEQ=35,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=931557,FOLIO='33',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GI49904A.;12',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GI49904_1_34">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Interest rate risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash, cash equivalents and our debt facility, which has interest rates with market rate fluctuations, expose us to interest rate risk
	on these financial instruments. Net interest expense, excluding deferred financing costs, recognized during the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 was $0.4&nbsp;million and
	$1.4&nbsp;million on our cash, cash equivalents and debt facility (three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;expense of $0.3&nbsp;million and
	$1.0&nbsp;million respectively).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Credit risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to trade receivables and other receivables, we are exposed to credit risk on our cash and cash equivalents in the event
	that our counterparties do not meet their obligations. We do not use credit derivatives or similar instruments to mitigate this risk and, as such, the maximum exposure is the full carrying value or
	fair value of the financial instrument. We minimize credit risk on cash and cash equivalents by transacting with only reputable financial institutions and&nbsp;customers.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Foreign exchange risk
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Foreign exchange risk arises because of fluctuations in exchange rates. To mitigate exchange risk, we may utilize forward contracts to
	secure exchange rates with the objective of offsetting fluctuations in our operating expenses incurred in foreign currencies with gains or losses on the forward contracts. We had no forward contracts
	in place at February&nbsp;28, 2015 (February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.2&nbsp;million). All foreign currency gains and losses related to forward contracts are
	included in foreign exchange gain (loss) in the consolidated statements of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of February&nbsp;28, 2015, if the U.S.&nbsp;dollar had appreciated 1% against all foreign currencies, with all other variables held constant, the impact of this foreign currency
	change on our foreign denominated financial instruments would have resulted in a nominal decrease in after-tax net loss for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 (three and twelve
	months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;decrease of $0.1&nbsp;million) with an equal and opposite effect if the U.S.&nbsp;dollar had depreciated 1% against
	all foreign currencies at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Economic Dependence
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We were dependent on three key customers with respect to revenue in the three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015. These customers
	represented approximately 46%, 16% and 10% of sales (three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;one customer represented&nbsp;68%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015 we were also dependent on two key customers with respect to revenue. These customers represented approximately 53% and 16% of sales
	(twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;one customer represented&nbsp;59%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Controls and Procedures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At the end of the period covered by this MD&amp;A (such period being the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015), an
	evaluation was carried out under the supervision of, and with the participation of, our management, including our Chief Executive Officer, or CEO, and Chief Financial Officer, or CFO, which are our
	principal executive officer and principal financial officer, respectively, of the effectiveness of the design and operation of our disclosure controls and procedures (as&nbsp;defined in
	Rule&nbsp;13a-15(e) of the Securities Exchange
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	34
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=11,SEQ=36,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=424928,FOLIO='34',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GI49904A.;12',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GI49904_1_35">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Act
	of 1934, as amended (the&nbsp;"Exchange Act")). Based upon that evaluation, our CEO and CFO have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures were effective as at February&nbsp;28,
	2015 to give reasonable assurance that the information we are required to disclose in reports that we file or submit under the Exchange Act and/or applicable Canadian securities legislation is
	(i)&nbsp;recorded, processed, summarized and reported, within the time periods specified in the U.S.&nbsp;Securities and Exchange Commission's as well as in accordance with applicable Canadian
	securities legislation rules and forms, and (ii)&nbsp;accumulated and
	communicated to management, including our principal executive and principal financial officers, or persons performing similar functions, as appropriate, to allow timely decisions regarding required
	disclosure.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	management is also responsible for establishing and maintaining adequate internal control over financial reporting, as such term is defined in Exchange Act Rules&nbsp;13a-15(f)
	and&nbsp;15d-15(f) as well as National Instrument&nbsp;52-109 of the Canadian Securities Administrators. These controls are designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the reliability of
	financial reporting and the preparation of financial statements for external purposes. Under the supervision and with the participation of our management, including our principal executive officer,
	our CEO, and principal financial officer, our CFO, we conducted an evaluation of the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting based on the framework in Internal
	Control&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Integrated Framework issued by the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission. Based on our evaluation under the framework in
	Internal Control&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Integrated Framework, our management concluded that our internal control over financial reporting was effective and that there are no material
	weaknesses in the Company's disclosure controls and procedures as of February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ernst&nbsp;&amp;
	Young&nbsp;LLP, the independent registered public accounting firm that audited our consolidated financial statements filed on SEDAR on May&nbsp;12, 2015, has also
	audited the effectiveness of our internal control over financial reporting as of February&nbsp;28, 2015, as stated in their report which is included in the annual audited financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Changes in Internal Control over Financial Reporting
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the period covered by this report, no changes occurred in our internal control over financial reporting that have materially
	affected, or are reasonably likely to materially affect, our internal control over financial reporting.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Critical Accounting Policies and Estimates
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Inventory
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory is valued at the lower of cost and net realizable value ("NRV"). The cost of inventory is calculated on a standard cost
	basis, which approximates average actual cost. NRV is
	determined as the market value for finished goods, replacement cost for raw materials, and finished goods market value less cost to complete for work in progress inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	regularly review inventory quantities on hand and record a provision for excess and obsolete inventory based on factors including our estimated forecast of product demand, the stage
	of the product life cycle and production requirements for the units in&nbsp;question.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	carry inventory for the purposes of supporting our product warranty. Our standard warranty is typically between 12 and 36&nbsp;months but we earn revenue by providing enhanced and
	extended warranty and repair service during and beyond the standard warranty period. Customer service inventory consists of both component parts and finished&nbsp;units.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	35
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

</A>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- PARA=JUSTIFY -->
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Indirect
	manufacturing costs and direct labour expenses are allocated systematically to the total production inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenue recognition
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We derive revenue from the sale of broadband wireless backhaul equipment which includes embedded software and a license to use said
	software and extended product warranties. Software is considered to be incidental to the product. Services range from installation and training to basic consulting. Revenue is recognized when
	persuasive evidence of an arrangement exists, delivery has occurred and there are no significant remaining vendor obligations, collection of receivables is reasonably assured and the fee is fixed and
	determinable. Where conditions to final acceptance of the product are specified by the customer, revenue is deferred until acceptance criteria have been&nbsp;met.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	business agreements may also contain multiple elements. Accordingly, we are required to determine the appropriate accounting, including whether the deliverables specified in a
	multiple element arrangement should be treated as separate units of accounting for revenue recognition purposes, the fair value of these separate units of accounting and when to recognize revenue for
	each element. For arrangements involving multiple elements, we allocate revenues to each element based on a selling price hierarchy. The selling price for a deliverable is based on its vendor specific
	objective evidence ("VSOE") if available, third party evidence ("TPE") if VSOE is not available, or estimated selling price ("ESP") if neither VSOE nor TPE is available. In multiple element
	arrangements, revenues are allocated to each separate unit of accounting for each of the deliverables using the relative estimated selling prices of each of the deliverables in the arrangement based
	on the aforementioned selling price hierarchy. We have determined the selling price both for the undelivered items and the delivered items using&nbsp;ESP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	generate revenue through direct sales and sales to distributors. We defer the recognition of a portion of sales to distributors based on estimated sale returns and stock rotation
	granted to customers on products in the same period the related revenues are recorded. These estimates are based on historical sales returns, stock rotations and other known&nbsp;factors.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue
	associated with extended warranty and advanced replacement warranty is recognized ratably over the life of the contracted service.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Revenue
	from engineering services or development agreements is recognized according to the specific terms and acceptance criteria as services are&nbsp;rendered.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	accrue estimated potential product liability as warranty costs when revenue on the sale of equipment is recognized. Warranty costs are calculated on a percentage of revenue per month
	based on current actual warranty costs and return experience.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Shipping
	and handling costs borne by us are recorded in cost of sales. Shipping and handling costs charged to customers are recorded as revenue, if billed at the time of shipment. Costs
	charged to customers after delivery are recorded in cost of&nbsp;sales.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	generate revenue through royalty agreements as a result of the use of our intellectual property. Royalty revenue is recognized as it is&nbsp;earned.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	36
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GK49904_1_37">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	Advanced Replacement and Extended Warranty
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	offer our customers the option to purchase advanced replacement and extended warranty contracts either at the time the goods are shipped or at any time
	after shipment takes place. Many customers wait to purchase extended warranty coverage until their standard warranty period&nbsp;ends.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advanced
	replacement is a service we sell which provides customers with the benefit of having a replacement radio or modem shipped to them when a unit they own has been confirmed by us
	to be malfunctioning. When the customer receives the replacement radio or modem, they ship the malfunctioning unit back to us. We repair and keep the returned&nbsp;unit.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	standard warranty for customers generally varies between 12 and 36&nbsp;months. Our extended warranty programs enable customers to continue to have repairs made as needed and
	customer support guidance beyond the standard warranty period.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	Training
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	earn a minimal portion of our total revenue from the sale of training services primarily to installation companies. Only in rare circumstances do we provide
	or sub-contract
	installation services (see&nbsp;below), as the customers to whom we sell microwave equipment outsource the installation to specialized companies. As a result, installation training revenue is
	generally not sold as a bundled service because it is sold to a different customer base. Further, any training that is provided is not essential to the functionality of our product offerings, and is
	thus considered an insignificant deliverable to the overall arrangement and is not considered a separate unit of&nbsp;accounting.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<U>
	Installation
</U>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Periodically,
	a customer may request that we arrange for the installation of our equipment. Installations are performed by a third party service provider. In
	this case, a separate services agreement is created between us and the end-user of our equipment, and we sub-contract the installation to a qualified installer. Evidence that the revenue associated
	with the installation service represents the fair value of the offering is provided by the sub-contracted value of the installation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	revenue recognition concepts highlighted above have not changed as a result of our acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business. Shipping terms through the Nokia OEM sales
	channel follow the Incoterms used by our other customers and do not include acceptance criteria.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Research and Development
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our research costs are expensed as incurred. Our development costs are expensed as incurred unless we meet generally accepted
	accounting criteria for deferral and amortization. Development costs incurred prior to establishment of technological feasibility do not meet these criteria, and are expensed as&nbsp;incurred.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Income taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income taxes are accounted for using the liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this method, deferred income tax assets
	and liabilities are determined based on differences between the tax and accounting bases of assets and liabilities as well as for the benefit of losses available to be carried forward to future years
	for tax purposes that are more likely than not to be realized. Deferred income tax assets and
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	37
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=39,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=70377,FOLIO='37',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GK49904A.;6',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GK49904_1_38">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	liabilities
	are measured using enacted tax rates that apply to taxable income in the years in which temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled. We provide a valuation allowance
	against our deferred tax assets when we believe that it is more likely than not that the assets will not be&nbsp;realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	determine whether it is more likely than not that an uncertain tax position will be sustained upon examination by the tax authorities. The tax benefit of any uncertain tax position
	that meets the more-likely-than-not recognition threshold is calculated as the largest amount that is more than 50% likely of being realized upon successful resolution. To the extent a full benefit is
	not expected to be realized, an income tax liability is effectively established. We recognize accrued interest and penalties on unrecognized tax benefits as interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	periodically review our provision for income taxes and valuation allowance to determine whether the overall tax estimates are reasonable. When we perform our quarterly assessments of
	the provision and valuation allowance, it may be determined that an adjustment is required. This adjustment may have a material impact on our financial position and results of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	ACCOUNTING POLICIES ADOPTED IN THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Parent's Accounting for the Cumulative Translation Adjustment Upon Derecognition of Certain Subsidiaries or Groups of Assets Within a Foreign Entity or of an Investment in a
	Foreign&nbsp;Entity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In March&nbsp;2013, the FASB issued ASU 2013-05, "Foreign Currency Matters." ASU 2013-05&nbsp;resolves the diversity in practice
	about whether Subtopic 810-10, "Consolidation-Overall", or Subtopic 830-30 "Foreign Currency Matters, Translation of Financial Statements", applies to the release of the cumulative translation
	adjustment into net income when a parent either sells a part or all of its
	investment in a foreign entity or no longer holds a controlling financial interest in a subsidiary or group of assets that is a nonprofit activity or a business (other than a sale of in substance real
	estate or conveyance of oil and gas mineral rights) within a foreign entity. In addition, the amendments in ASU 2013-05&nbsp;resolve the diversity in practice for the treatment of business
	combinations achieved in stages (sometimes also referred to as step acquisitions) involving a foreign entity. ASU 2013-05&nbsp;became effective for us on March&nbsp;1, 2014. The adoption did not
	have an impact on our consolidated interim financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Obligations Resulting From Joint and Several Liability Arrangements for Which the Total Amount of the Obligation Is Fixed at the Reporting&nbsp;Date
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In February&nbsp;2013, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2013-04, "Liabilities (Topic 405): Obligations Resulting from Joint and Several
	Liability Arrangements for Which the Total Amount of the Obligation Is Fixed at the Reporting Date" ("ASU&nbsp;2013-04"). ASU 2013-04&nbsp;provides guidance for the recognition, measurement and
	disclosure of obligations resulting from joint and several liability arrangements for which the total amount of the obligation within the scope of this ASU is fixed at the reporting date. The guidance
	requires an entity to measure those obligations as the sum of the amount the reporting entity agreed to pay on the basis of its arrangement among its co-obligors as well as any additional amount the
	reporting entity expects to pay on behalf of its co-obligors. ASU 2013-04&nbsp;also requires an entity to disclose the nature and amount of those obligations. The ASU became effective for us on
	March&nbsp;1, 2014. The adoption did not have an impact on our consolidated interim financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	38
</FONT>
</P>

</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=40,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="8",CHK=834481,FOLIO='38',FILE='DISK106:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49904]GK49904A.;6',USER='PANDERS',CD='26-MAY-2015;01:30' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_1_HTM_PAGE_GK49904_1_39">
</A>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2015
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;BORDER:#000000 SOLID 1PT;PADDING-TOP:12PT;PADDING-RIGHT:12PT;PADDING-BOTTOM:1PT;PADDING-LEFT:12PT;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Presentation of an Unrecognized Tax Benefit When a Net Operating Loss Carryforward, a Similar Tax Loss, or a Tax Credit Carryforward Exists
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In June&nbsp;2013, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2013-11, "Income Taxes (Topic 740): Presentation of an Unrecognized Tax Benefit
	When a Net Operating Loss Carryforward, a Similar Tax Loss, or a Tax Credit Carryforward Exists". The amendments provide guidance on the presentation of unrecognized tax benefits and will better
	reflect the manner in which an entity would settle at the reporting
	date any additional income taxes that would result from the disallowance of a tax position when net operating loss carryforwards, similar tax losses, or tax credit carryforwards exist. The amendments
	in this ASU became effective for us on March&nbsp;1, 2014. The adoption did not have an impact on our consolidated interim financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	FUTURE ACCOUNTING PRONOUNCEMENTS
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In May&nbsp;2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-9, "Revenue from Contracts with Customers". The amendments in this Update
	create Topic 606, Revenue from Contracts with Customers, and supersede the revenue recognition requirements in Topic 605, Revenue Recognition, including most industry-specific revenue recognition
	guidance throughout the Industry Topics of the Codification. In addition, the amendments supersede the cost guidance in Subtopic 605-35, Revenue Recognition-Construction-Type and Production-Type
	Contracts, and create new Subtopic 340-40, Other Assets and Deferred Costs-Contracts with Customers. In April&nbsp;2015, the FASB decided to propose a one-year deferral of the effective date by one
	year for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2017, with early adoption permitted. We are currently assessing the impact this amendment will have on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	June&nbsp;2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-12, "Compensation&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Stock Compensation". The amendments apply to reporting entities that
	grant their employees share-based payments in which the terms of the award provide that a performance target can be achieved after the requisite service period. The amendments in this ASU are
	effective for fiscal years beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2015, early adoption permitted. We do not expect the adoption of this guidance to have a material effect on our consolidated financial
	statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August&nbsp;2014, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2014-15, "Presentation of Financial Statements&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Going Concern". The update provides
	U.S.&nbsp;GAAP guidance on management's responsibility in evaluating whether there is substantial doubt about a company's ability to continue as a going concern and about related footnote
	disclosures. For each reporting period, management will be required to evaluate whether there are conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about a company's ability to continue as a going
	concern within one year from the date the financial statements are issued. The amendments in this ASU are effective for reporting periods beginning after December&nbsp;15, 2016, early adoption
	permitted. We do not expect the adoption of this guidance to have a material effect on our consolidated financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January&nbsp;2015, the FASB issued ASU No.&nbsp;2015-01, "Income Statement&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Extraordinary and Unusual Items". The amendments objective is to
	simplify the income statement presentation requirements in Subtopic 225-20&nbsp;by eliminating the concept of extraordinary items. The amendments in this ASU are effective for fiscal years beginning
	after December&nbsp;15, 2015, early adoption permitted. We do not expect the adoption of this guidance to have a material effect on our Consolidated Financial Statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-SIZE:1PT;LINE-HEIGHT:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	39
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following is management's discussion and analysis ("MD&amp;A") of DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.'s consolidated results of operations and financial condition for the three and twelve months
	ended February&nbsp;28, 2014. This MD&amp;A is dated May&nbsp;14, 2014 and should be read in conjunction with our audited consolidated financial statements and corresponding notes for the three and
	twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 and the Annual Information Form for the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 (the&nbsp;"AIF") which is available at
<U>
	www.sedar.com
</U>
	(SEDAR) and at
<U>
	www.sec.gov/edgar/searchedgar/companysearch.html
</U>
	(EDGAR) as an exhibit to our Annual Report on Form&nbsp;40-F
	for the year ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with United&nbsp;States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) and are reported in United&nbsp;States
	dollars ("USD"). The information contained herein is dated as of May&nbsp;14, 2014 and is current to that date, unless otherwise stated. Our fiscal year commences on March&nbsp;1 of each year and
	ends on the last day of February of the following&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	this document, unless the context requires otherwise, "we", "us", "our", the "Company" and "DragonWave" all refer to DragonWave&nbsp;Inc. collectively with its direct and indirect
	subsidiaries. The content of this MD&amp;A has been approved by our Board of Directors, on the recommendation of its Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless
	otherwise indicated, all currency amounts referenced in this MD&amp;A are denominated in&nbsp;USD.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Forward-Looking Statements
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This MD&amp;A contains "forward-looking information" and "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of applicable Canadian and US
	securities laws. All statements in this MD&amp;A, other than statements that are reporting results or statements of historical fact, are forward-looking statements which involve assumptions and describe
	our future plans, strategies and expectations. Forward-looking statements are generally identifiable by use of the words "may", "will", "should", "continue", "expect", "anticipate", "estimate",
	"believe", "intend", "plan" or "project" or the negative of these words or other variations of these words or comparable terminology. Forward-looking statements include, without limitation, statements
	regarding: our strategic plans and objectives; growth strategy; customer diversification and expansion initiatives; our expectations with respect to the results of the acquisition by us of the
	microwave transport business of Nokia Siemens Networks (whose name was changed to Nokia Solutions and Networks in August&nbsp;2013 in connection with the acquisition by Nokia Corporation of Siemen's
	50% stake in Nokia Siemens Networks) now operates as Nokia (referred to herein as either: "Nokia" or "Nokia's Networks business"); our expectations with respect to end-customer demand for our
	products; our expectations regarding the development of our target markets; and our plans, objectives and targets for operating cost reductions, revenue growth and margin performance. There can be no
	assurance that forward-looking statements will prove to be accurate and actual results or outcomes could differ materially from those expressed or implied in such statements. Important factors that
	could cause actual results or outcomes to differ materially from those discussed in the forward-looking statements are discussed in this MD&amp;A under the heading "Risks and Uncertainties".
	Forward-looking statements are provided to assist external stakeholders in understanding management's expectations and plans relating to the future as of the date of this MD&amp;A and may not be
	appropriate for other purposes. Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on forward-looking statements. Forward-looking statements are made as of the date of this MD&amp;A and we do not undertake
	to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise, except to the extent expressly required by&nbsp;law.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Risks and Uncertainties
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There can be no assurance that forward-looking statements will prove to be accurate and actual results and outcomes could differ
	materially from those expressed or implied in such statements. The following are some of the important factors that could cause actual results or outcomes to differ materially from those discussed in
	the forward-looking statements:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to successfully complete and integrate acquisitions of products or businesses, including the integration of
	microwave transport business of Nokia into our existing product lines and businesses and other risks associated with acquisitions;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our reliance on Nokia and our ability to maintain and
	grow our relationship as a preferred strategic supplier
	to&nbsp;Nokia;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our reliance on a small number of customers for a large percentage of revenue;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to implement
	our ongoing program of operating cost reductions;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our dependence on the development and growth of the market for high-capacity wireless communications services;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	intense competition from several competitors;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	competition from indirect competitors;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</DT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	our history of
	losses;
</FONT>
</DD>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our dependence on our ability to develop new products and enhance existing products;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to successfully
	manage growth;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our dependence on establishing and maintaining relationships with channel partners;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our dependence on our ability to manage our workforce and recruit and retain management and other qualified personnel;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	quarterly revenue and operating results that are
	difficult to predict and can fluctuate substantially;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a lengthy and variable sales cycle;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the impact that general
	economic weakness and volatility may be having on our&nbsp;customers;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	disruption resulting from economic and geopolitical uncertainty;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>

</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	currency fluctuations;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our exposure to credit risk for accounts receivable;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	pressure on our pricing
	models from existing and potential customers and as a result of&nbsp;competition;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the allocation of radio spectrum and regulatory approvals for our products;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the ability of our customers to secure a license for applicable radio&nbsp;spectrum;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	changes in government regulation or industry standards
	that may limit the potential market for our&nbsp;products;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our reliance on suppliers, including outsourced manufacturing, third party component suppliers and suppliers of outsourced
	services;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to manage the risks related to increasingly complex engagements with channel partners and end-customers;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to protect our own intellectual property and potential harm to our business if we infringe the intellectual
	property rights of&nbsp;others;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	risks associated with software licensed by us;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	a change in our tax status or assessment
	by domestic or foreign tax authorities;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	exposure to risks resulting from our international sales and operations, including the requirement to comply with export
	control and economic sanctions&nbsp;laws;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	product defects, product liability claims, and health and safety risks relating to wireless products;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=4,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=962080,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GC49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GC49914_1_3">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	risks associated with our outstanding warrants and the impact that the terms of such warrants on our ability to raise
	capital and to undertake certain business transactions;
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	risks associated with possible loss of our foreign private issuer status; and
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	risks and expenses associated with our common shares, including large fluctuations in the trading price of our common
	shares, and being a public&nbsp;company.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	particular, forward-looking statements relating to the acquisition and integration by us of the microwave transport business of Nokia and our renewed operational framework with Nokia
	announced on April&nbsp;10, 2013 are based on certain assumptions including:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	the successful implementation of our renewed framework, including sales growth from Nokia as a result of the renewed
	framework;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	our ability to obtain operating cost reductions through measures including consolidation and rationalization of the
	business acquired from Nokia, migration to new contract manufacturers, and optimization of our logistical framework to reduce overhead costs related to hardware&nbsp;sales.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	risks relating to Nokia identified by Nokia Corporation are set out in Nokia Corporation's annual report on Form&nbsp;20-F for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 under
	item&nbsp;3D "Risk&nbsp;Factors".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also
	see the discussion under "Liquidity and Capital Resources&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Liquidity Discussion" in this MD&amp;A, as well as the discussion under "Risk Factors"
	contained in our most recently filed AIF. Although
	we have attempted to identify important factors that could cause our actual results to differ materially from expectations, intentions, estimates or forecasts, there may be other factors that could
	cause our results to differ from what we currently anticipate, estimate or intend. Ongoing global economic uncertainty could impact forward-looking statements contained in this MD&amp;A in an
	unpredictable and possibly detrimental manner. In light of these risks, uncertainties and assumptions, the forward-looking events described in this MD&amp;A might not occur or might not occur
	when&nbsp;stated.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The changes in the results between fiscal years 2014, 2013 and 2012 can be attributed to a number of factors including:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The
	revenue growth between fiscal year 2014 and fiscal year 2012 is attributable to our strategic partnership with Nokia and the related business volumes
	resulting from this arrangement. Between
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	4
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=6,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=442295,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GC49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GC49914_1_5">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	fiscal
	year 2013, when the strategic partnership began, and fiscal year 2014 the sales through the Nokia sales channel have decreased by $26.9&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Our
	gross profit percentage was lower in fiscal year 2014 compared to fiscal year 2012 because of the predominance of Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM)
	related revenue, which includes revenue through the Nokia channel in fiscal 2014. OEM related revenue tends to have higher volume discounts and therefore lower prices than sales through other
	channels. The gross profit percentage in fiscal year 2014 compared to fiscal year 2013 was impacted by scheduled pricing reductions to Nokia which occurred in fiscal year 2014 without comparable cost
	reductions.
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Operating
	expenses have decreased in fiscal 2014 relative to fiscal year 2013 because of both changes to our services agreements with Nokia and internal
	restructuring. Expenses have decreased relative to fiscal year 2012 primarily as a result of internal restructuring.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	5
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=8,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=597229,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GC49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_7">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->

<!-- PARA=JUSTIFY -->
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	SELECTED CONSOLIDATED QUARTERLY FINANCIAL INFORMATION
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table sets out selected financial information for each of our most recently completed eight fiscal quarters. In the
	opinion of management, this information has been prepared on the same basis as our audited consolidated financial statements, and all necessary adjustments have been included in the amounts stated
	below to present fairly the unaudited quarterly results when read in conjunction with our consolidated financial statements and related notes&nbsp;thereto.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Historically,
	our operating results have fluctuated on a quarterly basis and we expect that quarterly financial results will continue to fluctuate in the future. The results of
	operations for interim periods should not be relied upon as an indication of the results to be expected or achieved in any future period or any fiscal year as a whole. Fluctuations in results relate
	to the project nature of the network installations of our end-customers including end-customers we supply through Nokia. In addition, results may vary as a result of the timing of staffing,
	infrastructure additions required to support growth, and material costs required to support design initiatives. Operating results may not follow past trends for other reasons, including the
	repercussions of our strategic decisions with respect to, among other things, acquisitions of complementary products or&nbsp;businesses.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;DragonWave is a leading provider of high-capacity packet microwave solutions that drive next-generation IP networks. DragonWave's
	carrier-grade point-to-point packet microwave systems transmit broadband voice, video and data, enabling service providers, government agencies, enterprises and other organizations to meet their
	increasing bandwidth requirements rapidly and affordably. The principal application of DragonWave's products is mobile network backhaul. Additional applications include leased line replacement, last
	mile fiber extension and enterprise networks.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	7
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=9,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=288944,FOLIO='7',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_8">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Key
	points on our results of operations for the fourth quarter and year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 when comparing those results to the same periods in the previous fiscal year
	include the&nbsp;following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Decreases in revenue (fourth quarter decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$10.4&nbsp;million; full year
	decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$33.9&nbsp;million) were driven primarily by the following factors:
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Sales through the Nokia sales channel globally (fourth quarter
	decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$6.4&nbsp;million; full year decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$26.9&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Timing of certain European based integrator's installations resulted in higher revenue in one portion of the year and
	lower in the other (fourth quarter decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.3&nbsp;million; full year increase&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$2.9&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Increases in sales to a Tier&nbsp;1 operator located in Japan (fourth quarter
	increase&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.0&nbsp;million; full year increase&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.0&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Lower sales to a Tier&nbsp;1 operator located in the US serviced primarily through an OEM partnership (fourth quarter
	decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$2.0&nbsp;million; full year decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$2.4&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Lower sales to US based distributors and other (fourth quarter
	decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$2.4&nbsp;million; full year decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$7.0&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Exit from the fusion product line, designed in Israel (fourth quarter
	decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.3&nbsp;million; full year decrease&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.5&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	During fiscal 2014 gross profit percentage approximated 11.2% for the first three quarters of the year and improved to
	14.5% in the fourth quarter of fiscal year 2014. Significant efforts are being made to reduce the input costs of our products and to control continued downward pricing pressures.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	When compared to the gross profit percentage in the fourth quarter of the previous year, our gross profit percentage
	increased by 9.2% as we continue to reduce raw material&nbsp;costs.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	When comparing the full year's gross profit percentage to the same twelve months in the previous fiscal year, gross profit
	decreased by 3.9% due to scheduled pricing decreases over the intervening twelve month&nbsp;period.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	8
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
