<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Amortization, Interest and Foreign Exchange
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We incur amortization of intangible assets charges, interest related to debt and foreign exchange expenses primarily on
	non-USD denominated monetary accounts. These types of costs reduced our earnings in fiscal 2014 (fourth quarter&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.2&nbsp;million; full
	year&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$5.4&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Contract amendments and changes in estimated liabilities and receivables
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the first quarter of fiscal 2014, we amended our contract with Nokia and as a result of that amendment a
	$5.7&nbsp;million gain was recognized in fiscal year 2014. See "Acquisition of the Microwave Transport Business of Nokia Siemens Networks
	(now&nbsp;Nokia)&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Gain on Contract Calculation" in this&nbsp;MD&amp;A.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	There were a number of changes in estimate that impacted our results. In particular, in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2014,
	we reduced our expectations associated with a receivable estimated at the time of the sale of DragonWave's wholly owned subsidiary in Israel by $0.6&nbsp;million. On a year-to-date basis this loss
	was offset by reductions in estimated liabilities first recorded at the time of our acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business. The net of these changes resulted in a full year gain on change
	in estimate of $2.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Equity Offering in September, 2013. See "Our Priorities&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Equity Offering" section
	of this&nbsp;MD&amp;A
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
<DL COMPACT>

<FONT SIZE=2>

<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As a result of the issue of warrants under the equity offering completed in September 2013 (the&nbsp;"Equity Offering"),
	a warrant liability was recognized. The creation of the warrant liability and
</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=11,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=203191,FOLIO='9',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_10">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	its
	subsequent re-valuation resulted in a loss in the fourth quarter, and a gain for the full year (fourth quarter&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;($0.4&nbsp;million); full
	year&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$3.2&nbsp;million)
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Of the total $2.6&nbsp;million in fees associated with the Equity Offering, $0.7&nbsp;million was expensed in the
	statement of operations for the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014. This represents a prorated portion of the total costs based on the value of the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
</UL>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	As
	a result of the factors described above, for fiscal 2014 we incurred a loss applicable to shareholders (fourth quarter&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$11.6&nbsp;million; full
	year&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$34.2&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cash
	decreased by $4.6&nbsp;million when compared to the cash balance at November&nbsp;30, 2013, and by $4.0&nbsp;million relative to the balance at February&nbsp;28, 2013. In the third
	quarter we increased our cash balance by $22.4&nbsp;million following the Equity Offering ($25.0&nbsp;million proceeds less $2.6&nbsp;million in expenses). The ending cash balance was
	$19.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Our Priorities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our primary operational objective is to achieve cash flow break-even from operations. We plan to accomplish this objective largely by
	focusing on the new revenue opportunities we are now working to close on and by continuing to decrease our costs of direct materials and&nbsp;overhead.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Equity Offering
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On September&nbsp;23, 2013, pursuant to the Equity Offering of units, we issued 11,910,000&nbsp;common shares and
	8,932,500&nbsp;warrants for proceeds, before deducting fees and expenses, of approximately $25.0&nbsp;million. After deducting fees and expenses, we realized net proceeds of $22.4&nbsp;million.
	The units were offered at a price of $2.10 per unit. Each unit consisted of one common share and three quarters of one warrant. Each whole warrant entitles the holder to purchase one common share at
	an exercise price of $2.70 per share until September&nbsp;23, 2018, subject to certain adjustments. As at September&nbsp;23, 2013 we recognized a liability in the amount of $6.4&nbsp;million for
	the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	terms of the warrants allow holders of the warrants to exercise the warrants on a cashless basis. A holder of warrants may, in its sole discretion, exercise the warrant in whole or
	in part and, in lieu of making the cash payment on account of the aggregate exercise price, elect instead to receive upon such exercise the net number of common shares determined according to the
	formula set forth in the form of warrant and defined in the form of warrant as the "Net Number". The warrants also provide that holders may exercise on a cashless basis and receive
	133
<SUP>
	1
</SUP>
	/
<SMALL>
	3
</SMALL>
	% of the common shares they would otherwise be entitled to receive upon exercise of the warrants, if such exercise (1)&nbsp;occurs after November&nbsp;12, 2013 and before the
	October&nbsp;12, 2014, and (2)&nbsp;the "Market Price" (as&nbsp;defined in the form of warrant) is less than $2.10 (as&nbsp;adjusted for stock splits, stock dividends, recapitalizations and
	similar events).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	terms of the warrants also provide that in the event of a "fundamental transaction" (as&nbsp;defined in the form of warrant) we may be required to settle the warrants with a cash
	payment. ASC 815-40-25-8&nbsp;states that if an event that is not within the entity's control could require net cash settlement, then the contract shall be classified as a liability. As such, we
	recognized a liability for $6.4&nbsp;million which represented the fair value of the liability as at September&nbsp;23, 2013. As it is a derivative, it is required to be presented at its fair
	value as at each Balance Sheet date. Increases or decreases in fair value of the warrants are included as a component of fair value adjustment warrant liability in the Consolidated Statement of
	Operations. As at February&nbsp;28, 2014, 3,171,000&nbsp;warrants were outstanding and the liability for warrants was decreased to $1.4&nbsp;million. In the twelve
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	10
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=12,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=649384,FOLIO='10',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_11">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	months
	ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 we increased our common stock value by $1.8&nbsp;million which represented the value of warrants exercised and realized a gain in the amount of
	$3.2&nbsp;million in the Consolidated Statement of Operations which represented the change in fair value of the remaining warrant liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subsequent
	to the Consolidated Balance Sheet date a further 200,000&nbsp;warrants were exercised resulting in an issuance of 199,388 of our common&nbsp;shares.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Acquisition of the Microwave Transport Business of Nokia Siemens Networks (now&nbsp;Nokia)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On June&nbsp;1, 2012 we announced the closing of the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business, including its associated
	operational support system (OSS) and related support functions. The acquisition was effected pursuant to the Amended and Restated Master Acquisition Agreement between DragonWave&nbsp;Inc., its
	wholly-owned subsidiary DragonWave S.&agrave; r.l and Nokia Siemens Networks&nbsp;B.V. ("NSN&nbsp;B.V." and together with its affiliates and subsidiaries, "NSN") dated
	May&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2012.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NSN's
	name was changed to Nokia Solutions and Networks in August&nbsp;2013 in connection with the acquisition by Nokia Corporation of Siemen's 50% stake in NSN, and was recently
	renamed Nokia and now operates under the Nokia Corporation brand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	results of operations for the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 were impacted by changes announced on April&nbsp;10, 2013 to our existing operational framework with&nbsp;Nokia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	original purchase price for the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business included a contingent receivable based on business performance in the eighteen months following
	closing. Under the terms of the renewed framework, Nokia paid $13.8&nbsp;million to us on April&nbsp;12, 2013 which settled the balance of our contingent receivable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nokia
	also took on additional commitments and costs so that we can continue to develop and supply microwave products. The Italian services agreement, pursuant to which Nokia provided
	research&nbsp;&amp; development and certain other services to DragonWave since June&nbsp;1, 2012, was terminated. As a result, we were able to reduce our accounts payable by $13.3&nbsp;million. We
	also eliminated the capital assets and the corresponding capital lease obligation associated with the Italian operations. We also recorded an estimated termination fee of $8.7&nbsp;million to be
	paid in several tranches.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Finally,
	a liability recorded related to an Indian lease obligation was amended and a gain of $0.4&nbsp;million was&nbsp;recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	net impact of these items results in a gain of $5.7&nbsp;million which was recognized in the statement of operations for the year ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	11
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Overdue
	balances recorded in accounts receivable and payable as at February&nbsp;28, 2013 between the two companies were settled in the first quarter of fiscal 2014 in the amount of
	$19.4&nbsp;million and $13.8&nbsp;million respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Debt Facility
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have established a long term credit facility with Comerica Bank and Export Development Canada. As at February&nbsp;28, 2014, this
	asset based credit facility was for a total of $40.0&nbsp;million
	plus $4.0&nbsp;million for letters of credit and foreign exchange facilities. Credit availability is subject to ongoing compliance with borrowing covenants and short term assets on&nbsp;hand.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	credit facility was extended on January&nbsp;6, 2014, matures on June&nbsp;1, 2016 and is secured by a first priority charge on all of the assets of DragonWave and its principal
	direct and indirect subsidiaries. The new terms of the credit facility include other customary terms, conditions, covenants, and representations and warranties, consistent with the facility already in
	place. Borrowing options under the credit facility include US&nbsp;dollar, Canadian dollar, and Euro loans. Interest rates vary with market rate fluctuations, with loans bearing interest in the
	range of 3% to 4% above the applicable base rates. Direct costs associated with obtaining the debt facility such as closing fees, registration and legal expenses have been capitalized and will be
	amortized over the 30&nbsp;month term of the facility. During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 the weighted average debt outstanding was $15.0&nbsp;million (fiscal year
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$15.0&nbsp;million) and we recognized $1.0&nbsp;million in interest expense related to the debt facility (fiscal year
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.1&nbsp;million) and expensed $0.6&nbsp;million in deferred financing cost (fiscal year
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.5&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2014, we were in breach of one of the covenants then in place on the facility. However, we obtained a waiver of the breach from our lenders for a period through
	May&nbsp;31, 2014 which eliminated any acceleration of repayment of our&nbsp;obligation.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have been in breach of one or more covenants in the past and in each case we obtained waivers from our lenders prior to the release of our financial statements. As at
	February&nbsp;28, 2013, we were in breach of one of the covenants then in place on the facility at that time. Prior to the release of our financial statements for fiscal year 2013, we obtained a
	waiver of the breach from our lenders for a period through May&nbsp;31, 2013, which eliminated any acceleration of repayment of our obligation. As at August&nbsp;31, 2013 the Company was in breach
	of two of the financial covenants under the credit facility. Both breaches were waived by our&nbsp;lenders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	12
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_13">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Sale of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd.&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;(formerly Axerra Networks&nbsp;Ltd.)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;22, 2013, we sold all of our shares of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd ("DWL"), incorporated in Israel. The
	shares were sold for a nominal amount. Under the share purchase agreement, we have a liability to pay certain future obligations. During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, we reduced the
	contingent liability by $0.3&nbsp;million based on a change in circumstance which is included in the consolidated statement of operations as a change in estimate. As at February&nbsp;28, 2014,
	there is no longer any recorded liability on the balance sheet (February&nbsp;28, 2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.8&nbsp;million), nor is there any maximum potential liability to
	us at February&nbsp;28, 2014 (fiscal year 2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$1.3&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also,
	under the terms of a supply and services agreement, we have an opportunity to earn an additional $5.1&nbsp;million (fiscal year
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$5.3&nbsp;million) based on business performance subsequent to the disposition for which we have recorded a receivable of $52&nbsp;thousand
	(February&nbsp;28, 2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.6&nbsp;million) which represents our estimate of the amounts to be collected based on the discounted forecasted future cash
	inflows. Our revised estimate resulted in a $0.6&nbsp;million expense to the consolidated statement of operations in the fourth quarter of fiscal&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Changes to the Board of Directors during Fiscal Year 2014
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In December&nbsp;2013, we announced the addition of Mr.&nbsp;Robert Pons to our Board of Directors. Mr.&nbsp;Pons is a veteran of
	the telecommunications industry and is based in the United&nbsp;States. He brings a rich combination of senior operating and board governance experience to DragonWave including expertise in
	developing and implementing Sales, Marketing and Distribution strategies.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	June&nbsp;2013, we announced the appointment of Lori O'Neill to our Board of Directors. Lori O'Neill is a Chartered Accountant and Certified Public Accountant (Illinois). She
	retired from Deloitte in 2012 after over 24&nbsp;years of service, 16&nbsp;years as partner. She has experience with growth companies from startup to multinationals, supporting complex
	transactions, private and public equity offerings and mergers and acquisitions. Ms.&nbsp;O'Neill is currently serving as the Chair of our Audit Committee.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Additional Investment in DragonWave HFCL India Private Limited.
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 we contributed an additional $0.2&nbsp;million to DragonWave HFCL India Private
	Limited, in the form of a capital contribution. Subsequent to year end, the non-controlling interest which owns 49.9% of the subsidiary contributed its&nbsp;portion.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Design Wins and Future Prospects
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We believe that revenue growth will be achieved through both strategic partnerships and direct customer relationships. Throughout
	fiscal 2014 we have worked closely with Nokia to redefine our relationship and gain better visibility about future global opportunities with this partner. In the United&nbsp;States we are working
	with a Tier&nbsp;1 operator on the design of a network and we believe this customer relationship holds opportunity for future hardware sales. In India we have been working closely with a major
	operator there to define their needs. Our first shipments to this customer began in the first quarter of fiscal&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Non-GAAP Performances Measures
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This MD&amp;A contains certain information that is not consistent with financial measures prescribed under GAAP. We use earnings before
	interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization ("EBITDA") as this measure
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	13
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=15,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=175115,FOLIO='13',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_14">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<BR>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	allows
	management to evaluate our operational performance and the performance of our assets. EBITDA does not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP, and is not designed to replace other
	measures of financial performance or the statement of cash flows as an indicator of liquid assets. This measure should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for other measures of
	performance calculated according to GAAP. We use this non-GAAP measure because it provides additional information on our existing and active commercial operations performance.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Adjusted
	EBITDA corresponds to EBITDA as defined above less elements that are non-cash in nature. We believe that this metric is necessary in order to isolate the commercial operations
	from certain non-cash costs. Consistent improvement in adjusted EBITDA is one of management's primary objectives. These measures are used by us because we believe they provide useful information
	regarding performance. The definitions of the measures that we adopted may differ from those of other businesses. We calculate EBITDA and adjusted EBITDA consistently over each fiscal&nbsp;period.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_136"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="10PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=8,SEQ=16,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=114761,FOLIO='14',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_15">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Revenue and Expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Revenue
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We consider that we have one operating segment, namely, broadband wireless backhaul equipment. We address this market through a variety
	of products that range in capability and price. We have products that have been internally developed as well as acquired through acquisitions, namely the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport
	business. The vast majority of our sales come from the shipment of equipment (as&nbsp;opposed to services or software) either through direct sales, through sales to distributors, or
	through&nbsp;OEMs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	also analyze our sales according to geographic region and target product development and sales strategies to meet the special requirements of each&nbsp;region.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	three main geographic regions that we examine are North America, Europe/Middle East&nbsp;&amp; Africa ("EMEA") and Asia, India and Other, as well as the Nokia channel both in India and
	world-wide. During this fiscal year, we serviced Nokia through shipments to warehouse locations, and not to end-customer sites, and therefore it is difficult to determine accurately the exact
	geographical location of our&nbsp;products.
</FONT>
</P>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cost of Sales and Expenses
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A large component of our cost of sales is the cost of product purchased from outsourced manufacturers. Final test and assembly for the
	links sold by us is carried on both at our premises and at the premises of our contract manufacturers. Additional costs for logistics and warranty activities are included in cost of sales. We use the
	services of several outsourced contract manufacturers with locations in India, Germany, China and Malaysia. During the past year, we have focused our outsourced manufacturers to two separate companies
	both located in&nbsp;Malaysia.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research
	and development ("R&amp;D") costs relate mainly to the compensation of our engineering group and the material consumption associated with prototyping activities. It also includes
	the costs associated with services agreements in place with Nokia for services delivered in Italy and China during fiscal year 2013. The
	Chinese services agreement came to an end on November&nbsp;30, 2012 and after that date, our Chinese operations became a direct&nbsp;cost.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling
	and marketing expenses ("S&amp;M") include the remuneration of sales staff, travel and trade show activities and customer support services. As well, it includes the costs associated
	with services agreements with Nokia delivered in fiscal&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General
	and administrative expenses ("G&amp;A") relate to the remuneration of related personnel, professional fees associated with tax, accounting and legal advice, and insurance costs. As
	well, it includes the costs associated with services agreements with Nokia delivered in fiscal&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=9,SEQ=17,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=368101,FOLIO='15',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GE49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GE49914_1_16">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Occupancy
	and information systems costs are related to our leasing costs and communications networks and are accumulated and allocated, based on headcount, to all functional areas in our
	business. We continue to lease premises from a real estate company controlled by an individual who was a member of the Board of Directors until June&nbsp;12, 2012. On June&nbsp;12, 2012, following
	our Annual General Meeting of shareholders, that director ceased to be a member of the Board but our lease continues to remain in effect. Our management believes the terms of the lease reflect fair
	market terms and payment provisions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Comparison of the three months and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 and February&nbsp;28, 2013
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	largest contributor to our decrease in revenue was the reduction in the volume of business we secured through Nokia's Networks business. Revenue from the acquired Nokia channel was
	responsible for $26.9&nbsp;million of the $33.8&nbsp;million revenue reduction experienced over the last 12&nbsp;months.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	continue to remain optimistic with regards to the revenue potential of the Nokia channel. This optimism is in part based on press releases which highlighted Nokia's renewed focus on
	the business of networks. This followed its acquisition of the remaining 50% of the Nokia joint venture from Siemens. Our positive outlook is also based on Nokia's position as the incumbent in many of
	the largest network operators in the&nbsp;world.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other
	variations in sales volume included: 1)&nbsp;a reduction in the volume of product sold through our US based distribution channel which can be cyclical in nature, and 2)&nbsp;a
	reduction in our sales to our largest Tier&nbsp;1 operator located in the United&nbsp;States, who underwent a capital re-organization during fiscal year 2013. We continue to see North America as
	an area of strength and growth in the coming years due to our historical position as one of the leading providers of carrier grade ethernet backhaul in this&nbsp;region.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	gross profit percentage in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2014 compared to the same period in the previous year relates to a number of factors including improved material costing with
	contract manufacturers. Pricing reductions scheduled in fiscal 2014 placed downward pressure on the gross margin percentage. Steps have been taken to reduce overhead costs including through the
	relocation of warehouse locations. We continue to work toward negotiating more favorable pricing with component suppliers and contract manufacturers.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	R&amp;D expenses were impacted by changes announced on April&nbsp;10, 2013 to our existing operational framework with Nokia. The termination of the Italian services agreement, in
	particular, resulted in a significant reduction to our expense profile. In addition, substantial cost reduction actions including the closure of our Israeli design centre and the reduction in staff
	levels, primarily in Canada, further reduced expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	17
</FONT>
</P>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Note:
	R&amp;D Canadian compensation reductions include the benefit of an estimated $0.3&nbsp;million due to the strength of the USD relative to the CAD in fiscal 2014 compared to
	fiscal&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>

	staff levels globally further reduced spending for the sales and marketing organizations.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General&nbsp;&amp;
	Administrative ("G&amp;A") expenses have decreased relative to the same three and twelve month periods in the previous year. Once again the changes relate predominantly to
	the Nokia services agreements and the restructuring efforts that took place in fiscal year&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It
	should be noted that reductions in compensation related spending in Canada includes approximately $0.3&nbsp;million in benefit from the strength of the USD in fiscal 2014 relative
	to fiscal year 2013. This change makes CAD expense relatively less expensive when translated for financial statement purposes to&nbsp;USD.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	19
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The amortization of technology and customer relationships acquired as part of our acquisition of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. (formerly known as Axerra
	Networks&nbsp;Ltd.) and the related Office of the Chief Scientist of the Ministry of Industry and Trade in Israel ("OCS") liability ended with the write off of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd.
	acquisition-related intangibles on August&nbsp;31, 2012. As a result, there were no expenses associated with the amortization of these balances in fiscal year 2014. The only remaining intangible
	asset associated with the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business is the asset associated with the favourable accounts receivable terms negotiated in the applied transaction documents.
	Amortization of computer software and infrastructure software has grown modestly over the past year with new software purchases.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	accretion expense in the prior fiscal year related primarily to the accretion of the Israeli OCS liability. The value of the OCS liability was reduced to zero at August&nbsp;31,
	2012. A small accretion expense was recognized in the three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 associated with balances which arose on the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business.
</FONT>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014

</B>
</FONT>

	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	restructuring expenses in fiscal year 2013 related to the announcements in that year of the elimination of positions across all functional areas of the business, which were primarily
	located in Canada and&nbsp;Israel.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	June&nbsp;4, 2012, we borrowed against our credit facility with Comerica Bank and Export Development Canada. As discussed above, on January&nbsp;6, 2014 the line of credit was
	increased and extended. The revised line has been increased to $40.0&nbsp;million plus $4.0&nbsp;million for letters of credit and foreign exchange facilities and will expire on
	June&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of the date of this MD&amp;A, $15.0&nbsp;million is outstanding on the line. Interest rates vary with market rate fluctuations, with loans bearing interest in the range of 3% to 4%
	above the applicable base rates. The terms of the credit facility include other customary terms, conditions, covenants, and representations and&nbsp;warranties.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	capitalized the initial costs associated with the credit facility and amortize that into the statement of operations ratably each&nbsp;month.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the previous fiscal year, in the three months ended August&nbsp;31, 2012, we performed an analysis of our intangible assets in order to determine whether the carrying value of
	those assets exceeded the estimated future cash flows expected to result from their use or disposition. Based upon this analysis, we wrote the assets down to their fair value and recorded a
	corresponding impairment charge as outlined in the table&nbsp;above.
</FONT>

<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=23,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=925856,FOLIO='21',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GG49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GG49914_1_22">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	total costs associated with the Equity Offering in September, 2013, including fees and expenses, approximated $2.6&nbsp;million. Because of the existence of the warrant liability,
	a prorated portion of the total fees and expenses was reported on the Statement of Operations for the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014. The remainder of the total fees and expenses impacted equity
	directly.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;There
	are four factors contributing to the gain on change in estimate during the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In the fourth quarter, we reduced the estimated receivable related to the disposition of DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd.; this
	estimate change had a $0.6&nbsp;million impact on the Statement of&nbsp;Operations.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	In fiscal year 2014, we adjusted the value of product related accrued liabilities estimated at the time of the acquisition
	of Nokia's microwave transport business which we no longer believe are likely to occur ($2.7&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We adjusted the termination liability for the Italian services agreement ($0.3&nbsp;million); this impacted the twelve
	months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We changed the estimate of our Israeli lease liability ($0.3&nbsp;million); this impacted the twelve months ended
	February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Impacting
	the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2013 was the change in estimate made related to a contingent liability calculated on the of sale of our Israeli subsidiary,
	DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd ($1.5&nbsp;million), combined with an increase in a Nokia related contingent receivable for $5.5&nbsp;million. The reduction in the liability and increase in contingent
	receivable resulted in a corresponding gain which totaled $6.0&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_154"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

</B>

</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>

</I>
</B>

</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	described in the section entitled "Acquisition of Microwave Transport Business of Nokia Siemens Networks (now&nbsp;Nokia)", a number of factors make up the Gain on Contract
	Amendment as&nbsp;follows:

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	recognized a gain of $19.4&nbsp;million in the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2013 due to the difference between the cumulative tangible and intangible net assets
	and the purchase price of the acquisition of Nokia's microwave transport business.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	warrant liability is required to be presented at its estimated fair value as at each Balance Sheet date. Increases or decreases in fair value of the warrants are included as a
	component of other income (expense) in the Consolidated Statement of&nbsp;Operations.
</FONT>

	to February&nbsp;28, 2014, 200,000&nbsp;warrants were exercised resulting in an issuance of 199,388 of our common&nbsp;shares.

	foreign exchange balance for the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 is driven by the valuation of our foreign denominated monetary balances, primarily the
	valuation of the EUR relative to the USD during this twelve month period. We do participate from time to time in forward exchange contracts which help to mitigate our exposure to these fluctuations.

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	year-over-year change in income tax expense relates primarily to the write down of the deferred tax assets associated with the impairment of certain DragonWave&nbsp;Ltd. (Israeli
	entity) related balance sheet items. The expense in fiscal year 2014 relates to the anticipated payment of taxes in entities that provide either R&amp;D or sales and customer support services to the rest
	of DragonWave and have no tax losses available.
</FONT>

<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_162"></A>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Cash and Cash Equivalents
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As at February&nbsp;28, 2014, we had $19.0&nbsp;million in Cash and Cash Equivalents ("Cash"), representing a $4.0&nbsp;million
	decrease from the Cash balance at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table explains the change in Cash in the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=27,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=81432,FOLIO='25',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GI49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GI49914_1_26">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Operating
	losses were once again a significant driver in the use of Cash in the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, the Equity Offering increased cash resources by $22.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Many
	of the other significant changes in the twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 relate to the renewed framework with Nokia, announced on
	April&nbsp;10,&nbsp;2013:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We collected $13.8&nbsp;million related to the contingent receivable from Nokia in the first quarter of
	fiscal&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We collected $19.4&nbsp;million in accounts receivable. Offsetting this cash inflow was our payment to Nokia for
	outstanding accounts payable in the amount of $13.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Inventory
	decreased in size relative both to the balance at November&nbsp;30, 2013 and to the balance at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2013.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_163"></A>

</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Trade Receivables
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The trade receivables balance decreased by $18.0&nbsp;million between February&nbsp;28, 2013 and February&nbsp;28, 2014 due
	primarily to the payment by Nokia of $19.4&nbsp;million in receivables outstanding in the first quarter of fiscal 2014. The days sales outstanding fell from 102&nbsp;days at February&nbsp;28,
	2013 to 81&nbsp;days sales outstanding at February&nbsp;28, 2014 which also contributed to a lower accounts receivable balance. In addition, the fourth quarter's sales were $10.4&nbsp;million
	higher in fiscal 2013 than there were in fiscal 2014 which would also result in a higher trade receivables balance at February&nbsp;28, 2013 than the year end twelve months&nbsp;later.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	allowance for doubtful accounts continues to represent a small percentage of our total trade receivables outstanding (February&nbsp;28,
	2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;3.0%; February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;0.7%).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	26
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=28,EFW="2224732",CP="DRAGONWAVE INC.",DN="9",CHK=166248,FOLIO='26',FILE='DISK125:[15ZBE4.15ZBE49914]GI49914A.;2',USER='MPAPADI',CD='26-MAY-2015;06:17' -->
<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GI49914_1_27">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2014, one customer exceeded 10% of the total receivable balance. This customer represented 56% of the trade receivables balance (February&nbsp;28,
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;one customer represented 67% of the trade receivables balance).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Included
	in G&amp;A expenses is an expense of $48&nbsp;thousand related to bad debt expense for the three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 and $0.5&nbsp;million related to bad debt
	expenses for the twelve months ended
	February&nbsp;28, 2014 (fourth quarter fiscal year 2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.2&nbsp;million; full year fiscal year
	2013&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;$0.1&nbsp;million).
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_164"></A>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Inventory
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The inventory balance decreased by $2.3&nbsp;million relative to the closing balance at February&nbsp;28, 2013. By product
	category, the decreases and increases in inventory may be described as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="26PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Accounts Payable and Accrued Liabilities
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The accounts payable and accrued liabilities balance decreased by $27.0&nbsp;million between February&nbsp;28, 2013 and
	February&nbsp;28, 2014. The primary driver for the decrease related to the renewed operational framework with Nokia which resulted in our payment to Nokia of outstanding accounts payable in the
	amount of $13.9&nbsp;million, and the reduction in the payable balance to Nokia associated with the termination of the Italian services agreement of $13.3&nbsp;million. Offsetting these reductions
	was the recognition of an estimated termination fee, currently valued at $9.1&nbsp;million, relating to the termination of the Italian services agreement. The amount recorded is an estimate subject
	to measurement uncertainty as to the timing and amount that could have a material impact on our financial statements should actual results differ from those estimated.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Debt Facility
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;It should be noted that the debt facility is included in the working capital table above because it moved from short term at
	February&nbsp;28, 2013 to long term at February&nbsp;28,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Use of Proceeds
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our net proceeds from the Equity Offering, after payment of the underwriters' fee and deducting the expenses of the Equity Offering
	were $22.4&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	previously disclosed we planned to use the proceeds we received from the Equity Offering as follows: approximately $15.0&nbsp;million to strengthen our balance sheet, approximately
	$5.0&nbsp;million to fund working capital and approximately $2.4&nbsp;million for general corporate purposes. In our industry, a strong balance sheet (in&nbsp;the sense of a cushion of available
	cash) is attractive to customers as it demonstrates the capacity to ramp up and support higher production levels. In some longer term and larger deployments, a certain amount of cash on the balance
	sheet is a pre-condition to qualifying to supply products. To the extent we are successful in winning more
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	27
</FONT>
</P>

	business
	funds allocated to strengthening our balance sheet may be re-allocated to supporting higher levels of production, including purchases of component inventory to support our supply chain. Any
	amounts for general working capital remain unallocated and will be expended at the discretion of&nbsp;management.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
	we intend to use the net proceeds from the Equity Offering for the purposes set forth above, we reserve the right to use such net proceeds for other purposes to the extent that
	circumstances, including unforeseen events and other sound business reasons, make such use necessary or&nbsp;prudent.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Liquidity Discussion
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our consolidated financial statements for the three and twelve month periods February&nbsp;28, 2014 have been prepared assuming that
	we will continue as a going concern, which contemplates the realization of assets and the disbursement of liabilities in the normal course of business. We have consumed a significant amount of cash
	resources during the past three years, mainly attributable to expense base reductions that lagged reductions in sales volumes, and our acquisition and integration of Nokia's microwave transport
	business.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have formulated a plan to return to cash break-even and to continue to operate as a going concern. Some of the significant assumptions and associated risks of our
	plan&nbsp;include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Achieving sustainable sales growth in our Nokia and non-Nokia channel business including new&nbsp;accounts
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Reducing the costs of our materials to improve margin performance on hardware
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Efficiently and cost effectively expand into new regions including India and South&nbsp;America
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued access to debt under arrangements with our current lenders
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;While
	we believe that our assumptions are reasonable, actual events or circumstances may cause the assumptions to be incorrect and actual results may differ materially from
	the&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, DragonWave as a publicly traded company has access to cash resources through the equity&nbsp;markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	28
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the normal course of our business activities, we are subject to claims and legal actions. We recognize a provision for estimated loss contingencies when it is probable that a
	liability has been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated. In management's opinion, adequate provisions have been made for all current and future&nbsp;claims.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD COLSPAN=2 ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2014, there were 58,008,746&nbsp;common shares issued and outstanding, options to purchase 3,173,321&nbsp;common shares granted under our stock option plan,
	and 3,171,000&nbsp;warrants exercisable for common shares, with the number of common shares issuable upon exercise subject to adjustment in accordance with terms of the&nbsp;warrants.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of May&nbsp;8, 2014 there were 58,215,055&nbsp;common shares issued and outstanding, 3,173,321&nbsp;options to purchase common shares outstanding under our stock option plan,
	and 2,971,000&nbsp;warrants exercisable for common shares, with the number of common shares issuable upon exercise subject to adjustment in accordance with terms of the warrants. See "Our
	Priorities&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Equity Offering".
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Restricted Shares&nbsp;&amp; Employee Share Purchase Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We launched an Employee Share Purchase Plan ("ESPP") on October&nbsp;20, 2008. The plan includes provisions to allow employees to
	purchase common shares. We will match the employees' contribution at a rate of 25%. During the three months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014 a total of 8,905&nbsp;common shares were purchased by
	employees at fair market value (full year fiscal 2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;29,221), while we issued 2,227&nbsp;common shares as our matching contribution (full year fiscal
	2014&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;7,305).
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	30
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The leases listed above are arranged at market pricing levels in all jurisdictions and the lease periods listed above represent a commitment for
	the time period indicated. We are actively seeking sub-lease arrangements in a number of locations as part of our efforts to reduce costs. There can be no assurance that we will secure sub-leases or
	that sub-lease terms will be&nbsp;favourable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;21, 2014, we subleased a portion of our Kanata office space and as such we have recorded, during the year ended February&nbsp;28, 2014, net rent expense of
	$84&nbsp;thousand representing the present value of our estimated remaining rent expense for the duration of the lease after taking into account estimated future sublease income and deferred rent on
	the&nbsp;facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	use an outsourced manufacturing model in which most of the component acquisition and assembly of our products is executed by third parties. Generally, we provide the supplier with a
	purchase order 90&nbsp;days in advance of expected delivery. We are responsible for the financial impact of any changes to the product requirements within this period. In some cases when a product
	has been purchased by a contract manufacturer but not pulled on for a build after a certain amount of time, we provide a deposit against that inventory, but do not take ownership of&nbsp;it.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	contract manufacturers currently have inventory intended for use in the production of our products, and we have purchase orders in place for raw materials and manufactured products
	with these contract manufacturers as well. All of this material is considered to be part of the normal production process and we take provisions against any portion of that inventory that we do not
	expect to be fully used based on current forecasts and projections. As mentioned previously, we would generally be responsible for the cost of the material approved to be purchased on our behalf by
	our contract manufacturers should those forecasts or projections change.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2014 we have provisions totaling $0.2&nbsp;million on inventory held by contract manufacturers that we do not expect to be fully&nbsp;used.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	31
</FONT>
</P>

<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GI49914_1_32">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2015/05/27/0001047469-15-005038_G155306.JPG" ALT="LOGO" WIDTH="90" HEIGHT="45">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.
<BR>
	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
	Tables are expressed in USD $000's except share and per share amounts unless otherwise indicated
</I>
</B>

</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Financial Instruments
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Financial instruments are classified into one of the following categories: held-for-trading, held-to-maturity, available-for-sale,
	loans and receivables, and other financial liabilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_170"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Fair Value
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table summarizes the carrying values of our financial instruments
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:80%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS SET -->
<TD WIDTH="" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="84PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="84PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	cash, cash equivalents, contingent receivables and forward exchange contracts
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(2)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	trade receivables, and other receivables which are financial in&nbsp;nature
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(3)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	accounts payable, accrued liabilities, debt facility, and lease obligations
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(4)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Includes
	warrant liability and contingent liabilities
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	classify its fair value measurements using a fair value hierarchy that reflects the significance of inputs used in making the measurements. The accounting standard establishes a fair
	value hierarchy based on the level of independent, objective evidence surrounding the inputs used to measure fair value. A financial instrument's categorization within the fair value hierarchy is
	based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. The inputs fall into three levels that may be used to measure fair&nbsp;value:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;1&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Unadjusted
	quoted prices at the measurement date for identical assets or liabilities in active&nbsp;markets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;2&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Observable
	inputs other than quoted prices included in Level&nbsp;1, such as quoted prices for similar assets and liabilities in active
	markets; quoted prices for identical or similar assets and liabilities in markets that are not active; or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market&nbsp;data.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Level&nbsp;3&nbsp;&#151;&nbsp;Significant
	unobservable inputs which are supported by little or no market activity.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Cash
	and cash equivalents are measured using Level&nbsp;1 inputs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	foreign exchange forward contracts are classified within Level&nbsp;2 as they are based on foreign currency rates quoted by banks and other public data sources. The fair values of
	the foreign exchange forward contracts are based upon the difference between the forward exchange rate and the contract rate with expected cash flows and effect on the consolidated statements of
	operations expected to occur upon settlement;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	contingent receivable and contingent liabilities which have been measured using a Level&nbsp;3 input, a discounted cash flow model that values the underlying assets and liabilities
	based on expected timing of payments and&nbsp;receipts;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	warrant is a liability and is classified as Level&nbsp;3. We used a Monte-Carlo Simulation model to estimate the fair value of the warrants. Significant assumptions used at
	February&nbsp;28, 2014 for the warrants include a
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	32
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2224732ZEX-15_2_HTM_PAGE_GI49914_1_33">

<FONT SIZE=2>

</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>

	DragonWave&nbsp;Inc.

	Management's Discussion and Analysis
<BR>
	For the three and twelve months ended February&nbsp;28, 2014

</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	dividend
	yield of 0%, a 1% assumption that the fundamental transaction will happen every year, volatility of 60%, and a risk free spot rate term&nbsp;structure;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	at February&nbsp;28, 2014, we held the following Level&nbsp;2 and Level&nbsp;3 financial instruments carried at fair value on the consolidated balance&nbsp;sheet.

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_172"></A>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:60%;MARGIN-LEFT:20%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY">
<FONT SIZE=1>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR>
